  2786                                  
  2787                                  ;************************************************************************
  2788                                  ;*									*
  2789                                  ;*	EnsureA20On - ensure that a20 is enabled if we're running	*
  2790                                  ;*	  in the HMA before interrupt entry points into Bios_Code	*
  2791                                  ;*									*
  2792                                  ;************************************************************************
  2793                                  
  2794                                  EnsureA20On:	; proc near		
  2795 000007C2 E80E00                  		call	IsA20Off
  2796                                  		;jz	short EnableA20
  2797                                  		;retn
  2798                                  		; 18/12/2022
  2799 000007C5 750B                    		jnz	short A20On_retn	
  2800                                  
  2801                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  2802                                  
  2803                                  
  2804                                  EnableA20:	; proc near		
  2805 000007C7 50                      		push	ax
  2806 000007C8 53                      		push	bx
  2807 000007C9 B405                    		mov	ah, 5	 ; local enable a20
  2808                                  		;call	cs:xms
  2809 000007CB 2EFF1E[0E00]            		call	far [cs:xms] ; 16/10/2022
  2810 000007D0 5B                      		pop	bx
  2811 000007D1 58                      		pop	ax
  2812                                  A20On_retn:	; 18/12/2022	
  2813 000007D2 C3                      		retn
  2814                                  
  2815                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  2816                                  
  2817                                  
  2818                                  IsA20Off:	; proc near		
  2819 000007D3 1E                      		push	ds
  2820 000007D4 06                      		push	es
  2821 000007D5 51                      		push	cx
  2822 000007D6 56                      		push	si
  2823 000007D7 57                      		push	di
  2824 000007D8 2EC536[BA07]            		lds	si, [cs:HiMem]
  2825 000007DD 2EC43E[BE07]            		les	di, [cs:LoMem]
  2826 000007E2 B90800                  		mov	cx, 8
  2827 000007E5 F3A7                    		repe cmpsw
  2828 000007E7 5F                      		pop	di
  2829 000007E8 5E                      		pop	si
  2830 000007E9 59                      		pop	cx
  2831 000007EA 07                      		pop	es
  2832 000007EB 1F                      		pop	ds
  2833 000007EC C3                      		retn
  2834                                  
  2835                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2836                                  
  2837                                  DisableA20:
  2838 000007ED 50                      		push	ax
  2839 000007EE 53                      		push	bx
  2840 000007EF B406                    		mov	ah, 6		; local disable A20
  2841 000007F1 2EFF1E[0E00]            		call	far [cs:xms]
  2842                                  		;call	cs:xms
  2843 000007F6 5B                      		pop	bx
  2844 000007F7 58                      		pop	ax
  2845 000007F8 C3                      		retn
  2846                                  
  2847                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2848                                  
  2849                                  ;************************************************************************
  2850                                  ;*									*
  2851                                  ;*	int19 - bootstrap interrupt -- we must restore a bunch of the	*
  2852                                  ;*	  interrupt vectors before resuming the original int19 code	*
  2853                                  ;*									*
  2854                                  ;************************************************************************
  2855                                  
  2856                                  int19:					
  2857 000007F9 0E                      		push	cs
  2858 000007FA 1F                      		pop	ds
  2859 000007FB 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]	; 16/10/2022
  2860 000007FF B90500                  		mov	cx, 5		; NUMROMVECTORS
  2861                                  		;mov	si, offset RomVectors
  2862 00000802 BE[0001]                		mov	si, RomVectors	; 19/10/2022
  2863                                  next_int:				
  2864 00000805 AC                      		lodsb			; get int number
  2865 00000806 98                      		cbw			; assume < 128
  2866 00000807 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  2867 00000809 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; int *	4
  2868 0000080B 89C7                    		mov	di, ax
  2869 0000080D AD                      		lodsw
  2870 0000080E AB                      		stosw
  2871 0000080F AD                      		lodsw
  2872 00000810 AB                      		stosw			; install the saved vector
  2873 00000811 E2F2                    		loop	next_int
  2874 00000813 803E[4006]00            		cmp	byte [int19sem], 0 ; 19/10/2022
  2875 00000818 7422                    		jz	short doint19
  2876 0000081A BE[4106]                		mov	si, i19_lst	; stacks code has changed these hardware interrupt vectors
  2877                                  					; stkinit in sysinit1 will initialize int19oldxx values
  2878 0000081D B90E00                  		mov	cx, 14		; num_i19
  2879                                  
  2880                                  i19_restore_loop:			
  2881 00000820 AC                      		lodsb			; get interrupt	number
  2882 00000821 98                      		cbw			; assume < 128
  2883 00000822 89C7                    		mov	di, ax
  2884 00000824 AD                      		lodsw			; get original vector offset
  2885 00000825 89C3                    		mov	bx, ax		; save it
  2886 00000827 AD                      		lodsw
  2887 00000828 83FBFF                  		cmp	bx, 0FFFFh	; check	for 0ffffh (unlikely segment)
  2888 0000082B 740D                    		jz	short i19_restor_1 ; opt no need to check selector too
  2889 0000082D 83F8FF                  		cmp	ax, 0FFFFh	; opt 0ffffh is	unlikely offset
  2890 00000830 7408                    		jz	short i19_restor_1
  2891 00000832 01FF                    		add	di, di
  2892 00000834 01FF                    		add	di, di
  2893 00000836 93                      		xchg	ax, bx
  2894 00000837 AB                      		stosw
  2895 00000838 93                      		xchg	ax, bx
  2896 00000839 AB                      		stosw			; put the vector back
  2897                                  
  2898                                  i19_restor_1:				
  2899 0000083A E2E4                    		loop	i19_restore_loop
  2900                                  
  2901                                  doint19:				
  2902 0000083C 803E[0D00]00            		cmp	byte [inHMA], 0	; ; Is dos running from	HMA
  2903 00000841 7403                    		jz	short SkipVDisk
  2904 00000843 E83000                  		call	EraseVDiskHead	; Then erase our VDISK header at 1MB boundary
  2905                                  					; Some m/c's (AST 386 & HP QS/16 do not clear
  2906                                  					; the memory above 1MB during a	warm boot.
  2907                                  SkipVDisk:				
  2908 00000846 CD19                    		int	19h		; DISK BOOT
  2909                                  					; causes reboot	of disk	system
  2910                                  
  2911                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  2912                                  
  2913                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2914                                  ;
  2915                                  ; procedure : int15
  2916                                  ;
  2917                                  ;		Int15 handler for recognizing ctrl-alt-del seq
  2918                                  ;		If it recognizes ctrl-alt-del and if DOS was
  2919                                  ;		is running high, it Erases the VDISK header
  2920                                  ;		present at 1MB boundary
  2921                                  ;
  2922                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2923                                  
  2924                                  ; 16/10/2022
  2925                                  ;DELKEY		equ	53h
  2926                                  ;ROMDATASEG	equ	40h
  2927                                  KBFLAG		equ	17h
  2928                                  ;CTRLSTATE	equ	04h
  2929                                  ;ALTSTATE	equ	08h
  2930                                  
  2931                                  Int15:		; proc near		
  2932                                  		;cmp	ax, 4F00h+DELKEY
  2933 00000848 3D534F                  		cmp	ax, 4F53h	; del keystroke ?
  2934 0000084B 7405                    		jz	short int15_1
  2935 0000084D 2EFF2E[0B01]            		jmp	far [cs:Old15]	; 16/10/2022
  2936                                  		;jmp	cs:Old15
  2937                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2938                                  
  2939                                  int15_1:				
  2940 00000852 1E                      		push	ds
  2941 00000853 50                      		push	ax
  2942 00000854 B84000                  		mov	ax, 40h		; ROMDATASEG
  2943 00000857 8ED8                    		mov	ds, ax
  2944                                  		;mov	al, ds:17h	; [KBFLAG]
  2945                                  		; 16/10/2022
  2946 00000859 A01700                  		mov	al, [KBFLAG]
  2947 0000085C 240C                    		and	al, 0Ch		; (CTRLSTATE | ALTSTATE)
  2948 0000085E 3C0C                    		cmp	al, 0Ch		; (CTRLSTATE | ALTSTATE)
  2949 00000860 750C                    		jnz	short int15_2
  2950 00000862 0E                      		push	cs
  2951 00000863 1F                      		pop	ds
  2952 00000864 803E[0D00]00            		cmp	byte [inHMA], 0	; is DOS running from HMA
  2953 00000869 7403                    		jz	short int15_2
  2954 0000086B E80800                  		call	EraseVDiskHead
  2955                                  int15_2:				
  2956 0000086E 58                      		pop	ax
  2957 0000086F 1F                      		pop	ds
  2958 00000870 F9                      		stc
  2959 00000871 2EFF2E[0B01]            		jmp	far [cs:Old15]	; 16/10/2022
  2960                                  		;jmp	cs:Old15
  2961                                  
  2962                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  2963                                  
  2964                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2965                                  ;
  2966                                  ; procedure : EraseVDiskHead
  2967                                  ;
  2968                                  ;		Erases the VDisk Header present in the 1MB boundary
  2969                                  ;
  2970                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2971                                  
  2972                                  EraseVDiskHead:	; proc near		
  2973 00000876 50                      		push	ax
  2974 00000877 51                      		push	cx
  2975 00000878 57                      		push	di
  2976 00000879 06                      		push	es
  2977 0000087A E845FF                  		call	EnsureA20On
  2978 0000087D B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; HMA seg
  2979 00000880 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  2980 00000882 BF1000                  		mov	di, 10h		; point	to VDISK header
  2981 00000885 B91000                  		mov	cx, 10h		; size of vdisk	header
  2982 00000888 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax
  2983 0000088A F3AB                    		rep stosw		; clear	it
  2984 0000088C 07                      		pop	es
  2985 0000088D 5F                      		pop	di
  2986 0000088E 59                      		pop	cx
  2987 0000088F 58                      		pop	ax
  2988 00000890 C3                      		retn

  3033                                  ;SR; WIN386 support
  3034                                  
  3035                                  ; WIN386 instance data structure
  3036                                  ;
  3037                                  ; Here is a Win386 startup info structure which we set up and to which
  3038                                  ; we return a pointer when Win386 initializes.
  3039                                  
  3040 0000089A 0300                    Win386_SI:	db 3, 0			; SI_Version
  3041                                  					; Startup Info for Win386
  3042 0000089C 00000000                SI_Next:	dd 0			; pointer to next info structure
  3043 000008A0 00000000                		dd 0			; a field we don't need
  3044 000008A4 00000000                		dd 0			; another field	we don't need
  3045 000008A8 [AC08]                  SI_Instance:	dw Instance_Table
  3046 000008AA 7000                    		dw 70h	; Bios_Data	; far pointer to instance table
  3047                                  
  3048                                  ; This table gives Win386 the instance data in the BIOS and ROM-BIOS data
  3049                                  ; areas. Note that the address and size of the hardware stacks must
  3050                                  ; be calculated and inserted at boot time.
  3051                                  
  3052 000008AC 00005000                Instance_Table:	dw 0, 50h		; print	screen status...
  3053 000008B0 0200                    		dw 2			; ... 2	bytes
  3054 000008B2 0E005000                		dw 0Eh,	50h		; ROM Basic data...
  3055 000008B6 1400                    		dw 14h			; ... 14H bytes
  3056 000008B8 [0C00]                  		dw altah		; a con	device buffer...
  3057 000008BA 7000                    		dw 70h			; Bios_Data segment
  3058 000008BC 0100                    		dw 1			; ... 1 byte
  3059                                  
  3060                                  NextStack:
  3061                                  
  3062                                  ; NOTE:  If stacks are disabled by STACKS=0,0, the following
  3063                                  ;	instance items WILL NOT be filled in by SYSINIT.
  3064                                  ;	That's just fine as long as these are the last items
  3065                                  ;	in the instance list since the first item is initialized
  3066                                  ;	to 0000 at load time.
  3067                                  
  3068 000008BE 00000000                		dw 0, 0			; pointer to next stack	to be used...
  3069 000008C2 0200                    		dw 2			; ... 2 bytes
  3070 000008C4 00000000                IT_StackLoc:	dd 0			; location of hardware stacks
  3071 000008C8 0000                    IT_StackSize:	dw 0			; size of hardware stacks
  3072 000008CA 00000000                		dd 0			; terminate the	instance table
  3073                                  
  3074                                  					;SR;
  3075 000008CE 00                      IsWin386:	db 0			; Flag to indicate whether
  3076                                  					; Win386 is running or not
  3077                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3078                                  
  3079                                  ;This routine was originally in BIOS_CODE but this causes a lot of problems
  3080                                  ;when we call it including checking of A20. The code being only about 
  3081                                  ;30 bytes, we might as well put it in BIOS_DATA
  3082                                  
  3083                                  V86_Crit_SetFocus:			
  3084 000008CF 57                      		push	di
  3085 000008D0 06                      		push	es
  3086 000008D1 53                      		push	bx
  3087 000008D2 50                      		push	ax
  3088 000008D3 31FF                    		xor	di, di
  3089 000008D5 8EC7                    		mov	es, di
  3090 000008D7 BB1500                  		mov	bx, 15h		; Device ID of DOSMGR device
  3091 000008DA B88416                  		mov	ax, 1684h	; Get API entry	point
  3092 000008DD CD2F                    		int	2Fh		; - Multiplex -	MS WINDOWS - GET DEVICE	API ENTRY POINT
  3093                                  					; BX = virtual device (VxD) ID,	ES:DI =	0000h:0000h
  3094                                  					; Return: ES:DI	-> VxD API entry point,	or 0:0 if the VxD does not support an API
  3095 000008DF 8CC0                    		mov	ax, es
  3096 000008E1 09F8                    		or	ax, di
  3097 000008E3 740A                    		jz	short Skip	; Here,	es:di is address of API	routine.
  3098                                  					; Set up stack frame to	simulate a call.
  3099 000008E5 0E                      		push	cs
  3100                                  		;;mov	ax,offset Skip
  3101                                  		;mov	ax,Skip
  3102                                  		;push	ax
  3103                                  		; 08/10/2023
  3104 000008E6 68[EF08]                		push	Skip
  3105 000008E9 06                      		push	es
  3106 000008EA 57                      		push	di		; API far call address
  3107 000008EB B80100                  		mov	ax,1		; SetFocus function number
  3108 000008EE CB                      		retf			; do the call
  3109                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3110                                  
  3111                                  Skip:					
  3112 000008EF 58                      		pop	ax
  3113 000008F0 5B                      		pop	bx
  3114 000008F1 07                      		pop	es
  3115 000008F2 5F                      		pop	di
  3116 000008F3 CB                      		retf
  3117                                  
  3118                                  ;End WIN386 support
