  4560                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4561                                  
  4562                                  ;	entry point to call utility functions in Bios_Code. At this time,
  4563                                  ;	  we aren't doing any A20 switching. During MSINIT time Bios_Code
  4564                                  ;	  will not yet be moved to its final resting place, so we know
  4565                                  ;	  it'll be low.
  4566                                  ;
  4567                                  ;	to use this function, do a "push cs" and load bp with the offset of
  4568                                  ;	  the function you want to call in Bios_Code. This routine will
  4569                                  ;	  push the address of a retf in Bios_Code onto the stack which
  4570                                  ;	  will get executed when the utility function finishes. It will
  4571                                  ;	  then transfer control to Bios_Code:bp using a couple of pushes
  4572                                  ;	  and a retf
  4573                                  
  4574                                  ; 16/10/2022
  4575                                  ;BC_RETF equ bc_retf - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h
  4576                                  ; 09/12/2022
  4577                                  BC_RETF equ bc_retf
  4578                                  
  4579                                  addr_of_bcretf:	;dw 0C8h		; dw bc_retf
  4580                                  					; 2C7h:0C8h = 70h:2638h
  4581 00001761 [C800]                  		dw BC_RETF
  4582                                  
  4583                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4584                                  
  4585                                  call_bios_code:	; proc far			
  4586 00001763 2EFF36[6117]            		push	word [cs:addr_of_bcretf] 
  4587                                  					; set up near return to far return
  4588 00001768 2EFF36[E006]            		push	word [cs:cdev+2] ; push Bios_Code segment
  4589 0000176D 55                      		push	bp		; save offset of utility function
  4590 0000176E CB                      		retf			; far jump to (DOS)BIOS code
  4591                                  
  4592                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4593                                  
  4594 0000176F 00                      flp_drvs	db 0			
  4595                                  
  4596                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4597                                  
  4598                                  ; 01/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0)
  4599                                  
  4600                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4601                                  ; entry point from boot sector
  4602                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4603                                  
  4604                                  init:		; 27/12/2018
  4605                                  		; MSDOS 6.0 (MSINIT.ASM)
  4606                                  		;=============================================================
  4607                                  		;
  4608                                  		; entry from boot sector. the register contents are:
  4609                                  		;
  4610                                  		;   dl = int 13 drive number we booted from
  4611                                  		;   ch = media byte
  4612                                  		;   bx = first data sector on disk.
  4613                                  		;   ax = first data sector (high)
  4614                                  		;   di = sectors/fat for the boot media.
  4615                                  
  4616                                  		; 07/04/2018
  4617                                  		;=============================================================
  4618                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 - registers from FD Boot Sector 
  4619                                                  ; DL = [bsDriveNumber]
  4620                                  		; DH = [bsMedia]
  4621                                  		; AX = [bsSectors] ; Total sectors
  4622                                  		; DS = 0, SS = 0
  4623                                  		; BP = 7C00h
  4624                                  
  4625                                  		; 07/10/2023
  4626                                  		; (from MSLOAD)
  4627                                  		; ss = 0, sp = 700h, bp = any, ds = previous cs  
  4628                                  		
  4629                                  		; 13/12/2023
  4630                                  		;cli	; not necessary at this stage
  4631                                  
  4632                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4633                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4634                                  		;push	ax
  4635                                  		;xor	ax, ax
  4636                                  		;mov	ds, ax
  4637                                  		;pop	ax
  4638                                  	
  4639                                  ; 02/10/2022
  4640                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4641                                  ; Note: Retro DOS v4.0 Kernel does not use/contain MSLOAD part of IO.SYS (5.0)
  4642                                  ; 	Because, Retro DOS v2 boot sector loads complete/entire MSDOS.SYS
  4643                                  ;	(RETRODOS.SYS) Kernel file (IO.SYS & MSDOS.SYS together).
  4644                                  ;	As result of boot sector ve init differences, Retro DOS init code (here)
  4645                                  ;	moves kernel to segment 070h at first, then sets diskette parameters
  4646                                  ;	at segment 50h (while MSDOS 5.0 boot sector sets this).
  4647                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4648                                  
  4649                                  ; msload will check the extended boot record and set ax, bx accordingly.
  4650                                  
  4651                                  ;	msload passes a 32 bit sector number hi word in ax and low in bx
  4652                                  ;	save this in cs:bios_h and cs:bios_l. this is for the start of
  4653                                  ;	data sector of the bios.
  4654                                  
  4655 00001770 2EA3[CE16]              		mov	[cs:bios_h], ax	; (start of) dos bios (IO.SYS) data sector
  4656 00001774 2E891E[CC16]            		mov	[cs:bios_l], bx
  4657                                  
  4658                                  ; with the following information from msload, we don't need the
  4659                                  ;     boot sector any more.-> this will solve the problem of 29 kb size
  4660                                  ;     limitation of msbio.com file.
  4661                                  
  4662 00001779 0E                      		push	cs		; Save a peck of interrupt vectors...
  4663 0000177A 07                      		pop	es
  4664                                  
  4665 0000177B 51                      		push	cx ; +++ ; ch = [MediaByte]
  4666                                  		;push	di ; *! (not necessary) ; 13/12/2023
  4667                                  
  4668                                  		; 13/12/2023
  4669                                  		; ds <> cs
  4670                                  		; ds = relocated MSLOAD segment, cs = BIOSDATA segment
  4671                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4672                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4673                                  		; 24/12/2022
  4674                                  		; ds = cs
  4675 0000177C 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  4676 0000177E 8ED9                    		mov	ds, cx
  4677                                  		; ds = 0
  4678                                  
  4679 00001780 B105                    		mov	cl, 5
  4680                                  		;mov	cx, 5		; NUMROMVECTORS
  4681                                  					; no. of rom vectors to	be saved
  4682                                  		;mov	si, offset RomVectors ; point to list of int vectors
  4683 00001782 BE[0001]                		mov	si, RomVectors
  4684                                  		
  4685                                  		; 13/12/2023
  4686 00001785 FA                      		cli
  4687                                  next_int_:		
  4688 00001786 2E                      		cs	; 16/10/2022
  4689 00001787 AC                      		lodsb		
  4690                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si] ; cs lodsb
  4691 00001788 98                      		cbw			; ax = interrupt number
  4692 00001789 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  4693 0000178B D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; int no * 4
  4694 0000178D 89C7                    		mov	di, ax		; interrupt vector address
  4695 0000178F 87F7                    		xchg	si, di		; rombios interrupt vector address in si
  4696                                  					; saving address in di
  4697                                  		;lodsw			; movsw
  4698                                  		;stosw
  4699                                  		;lodsw			; movsw
  4700                                  		;stosw			; save the vector
  4701                                  		; 28/09/2023
  4702 00001791 A5                      		movsw
  4703 00001792 A5                      		movsw
  4704                                  
  4705 00001793 87F7                    		xchg	si, di
  4706 00001795 E2EF                    		loop	next_int_
  4707                                  
  4708                                  		; 13/12/2023
  4709                                  		;pop	di  ; *!
  4710                                  		;pop	cx ; +++ ; ch = [MediaByte]
  4711                                  
  4712                                  ; we need to save int13 in two places in case we are running on an at.
  4713                                  ; on ats we install the ibm supplied rom_bios patch which hooks
  4714                                  ; int13 ahead of orig13. since int19 must unhook int13 to point to the
  4715                                  ; rom int13 routine, we must have that rom address also stored away.
  4716                                  
  4717                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4718                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4719                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13], ax
  4720                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13+2]
  4721                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13+2], ax
  4722                                  
  4723                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4724 00001797 C7064C00[7407]          		mov	word [13h*4], block13
  4725                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Ch, offset	block13	; 13h*4
  4726                                  					; set up int 13	for new	action
  4727 0000179D 8C0E4E00                		mov	[13h*4+2], cs
  4728                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Eh, cs ; 13h*4+2
  4729 000017A1 C7065400[4808]          		mov	word [15h*4], Int15
  4730                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:54h, offset	Int15 ;	15h*4
  4731                                  					; set up int 15	for new	action
  4732 000017A7 8C0E5600                		mov	[15h*4+2], cs
  4733                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:56h, cs ; 15h*4+2
  4734 000017AB C7066400[F907]          		mov	word [19h*4], int19
  4735                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:64h, offset	int19 ;	19h*4
  4736                                  					; set up int 19	for new	action
  4737 000017B1 8C0E6600                		mov	[19h*4+2], cs
  4738                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:66h, cs ; 19h*4+2
  4739                                  
  4740                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4741 000017B5 0E                      		push	cs
  4742 000017B6 1F                      		pop	ds
  4743                                  		
  4744 000017B7 A1[0601]                		mov	ax, [Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4745 000017BA A3[B400]                		mov	[Orig13], ax
  4746 000017BD A1[0801]                		mov	ax, [Old13+2]
  4747 000017C0 A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
  4748                                  					; ;
  4749 000017C3 FB                      		sti
  4750 000017C4 CD11                    		int	11h		; EQUIPMENT DETERMINATION
  4751                                  					; Return: AX = equipment flag bits
  4752                                  
  4753                                  ; we have to support a system that does not have any diskette
  4754                                  ; drives but only hardfiles. this system will ipl from the hardfile.
  4755                                  ; if the equipment flag bit 0 is 1, then the system has diskette drive(s).
  4756                                  ; otherwise, the system has only hardfiles.
  4757                                  ;
  4758                                  ; important thing is that still, for compatibility reason, the drive letter
  4759                                  ; for the hardfiles start from "c".  so, we still need to allocate dummy bds
  4760                                  ; drive a and drive b. at sysinit time, we are going to set cds table entry
  4761                                  ; of dpb pointer for these drives to 0, so any user attempt to access this
  4762                                  ; drives will get "invalid drive letter ..." message. we are going to
  4763                                  ; establish "fakefloppydrv" flag. ***sysinit module should call int 11h to
  4764                                  ; determine whether there are any diskette drivers in the system or not.!!!***
  4765                                  
  4766                                  ; check the register returned by the equipment determination interrupt
  4767                                  ; we have to handle the case of no diskettes in the system by faking
  4768                                  ; two dummy drives.
  4769                                  ;
  4770                                  ; if the register indicates that we do have floppy drives we don't need
  4771                                  ; to do anything special.
  4772                                  ;
  4773                                  ; if the register indicates that we don't have any floppy drives then
  4774                                  ; what we need to do is set the fakefloppydrv variable, change the
  4775                                  ; register to say that we do have floppy drives and then go to execute
  4776                                  ; the code which starts at notsingle. this is because we can skip the
  4777                                  ; code given below which tries to find if there are one or two drives
  4778                                  ; since we already know about this.
  4779                                  
  4780                                  		; 12/12/2022
  4781 000017C6 A801                    		test	al, 1
  4782                                  		;test	ax, 1		; floppy drives	present	?
  4783 000017C8 7524                    		jnz	short normalfloppydrv ;	yes.
  4784                                  
  4785                                  ; Some ROM BIOSs lie that there are no floppy drives. Lets find out
  4786                                  ; whether it is an old ROM BIOS or a new one
  4787                                  ;
  4788                                  ; WARNING !!!
  4789                                  ;
  4790                                  ; This sequence of code is present in SYSINIT1.ASM also. Any modification
  4791                                  ; here will require an equivalent modification in SYSINIT1.ASM also
  4792                                  
  4793                                  		; 13/12/2023
  4794                                  		; ((cx is already on top of the stack))
  4795                                  		;push	cx	; +++ ; ch = [MediaByte]
  4796                                  		;push	bx	; not necessary
  4797 000017CA 50                      		push	ax
  4798 000017CB 52                      		push	dx
  4799                                  		;push	di	; not necessary
  4800 000017CC 06                      		push	es
  4801                                  
  4802 000017CD B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  4803 000017CF B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  4804 000017D1 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  4805                                  					; DL = drive number
  4806                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  4807                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  4808                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  4809 000017D3 7204                    		jc	short _gdskp_error
  4810                                  		;mov	[cs:flp_drvs], dl
  4811                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4812                                  		; ds = cs
  4813 000017D5 8816[6F17]              		mov	[flp_drvs], dl
  4814                                  _gdskp_error:				
  4815                                  		; 13/12/2023
  4816 000017D9 07                      		pop	es
  4817                                  		;pop	di
  4818 000017DA 5A                      		pop	dx
  4819 000017DB 58                      		pop	ax
  4820                                  		;pop	bx
  4821                                  		; 13/12/2023
  4822                                  		;pop	cx	; +++ ; ch = [MediaByte]
  4823 000017DC 7210                    		jc	short normalfloppydrv
  4824                                  					; if error it is an old ROM BIOS
  4825                                  					; so, lets assume that ROM BIOS lied
  4826                                  
  4827                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4828                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:flp_drvs], 0 ; number of drvs == 0?
  4829                                  		;jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4830                                  		;mov	al, [cs:flp_drvs]
  4831 000017DE A0[6F17]                		mov	al, [flp_drvs]
  4832 000017E1 08C0                    		or	al, al		; number of drvs == 0?
  4833 000017E3 7403                    		jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4834                                  
  4835                                  		;dec	al		; make it zero based
  4836                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4837 000017E5 48                      		dec	ax
  4838 000017E6 EB0A                    		jmp	short got_num_flp_drvs
  4839                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4840                                  
  4841                                  _set_fake_flpdrv:
  4842                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4843                                  		;mov	ax, 1
  4844                                  		; 13/12/2023
  4845 000017E8 40                      		inc	ax ; al = 1
  4846 000017E9 A2[DF16]                		mov	[fakefloppydrv], al ; 1
  4847                                  		;mov	byte [cs:fakefloppydrv], 1
  4848                                  		;			; we don't have any floppy drives.
  4849                                  		;mov	ax, 1
  4850 000017EC EB09                    		jmp	short settwodrive ; well then set it for two drives!
  4851                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4852                                  
  4853                                  normalfloppydrv:			; yes, bit 0 is 1.			
  4854 000017EE D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; there	exist floppy drives.
  4855 000017F0 D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; put bits 6 & 7 into bits 0 & 1
  4856                                  got_num_flp_drvs:			
  4857                                  		;and	ax, 3		; only look at bits 0 &	1
  4858                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4859 000017F2 2403                    		and	al, 3
  4860 000017F4 7505                    		jnz	short notsingle	; zero means single drive system
  4861 000017F6 40                      		inc	ax		; pretend it's a two drive system
  4862                                  settwodrive:				; set this to two fakedrives
  4863                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4864                                  		; ds = cs
  4865 000017F7 FE06[7800]              		inc	byte [single]
  4866                                  		;inc	byte [cs:single] ; remember this
  4867                                  notsingle:				
  4868 000017FB 40                      		inc	ax		; ax has number	of drives, 2-4
  4869                                  					; is also 0 indexed boot drive if we
  4870                                  					; booted off hard file
  4871                                  		; 13/12/2023
  4872 000017FC 59                      		pop	cx	; +++ ; ch = [MediaByte]
  4873                                  
  4874 000017FD 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; ch is	fat id,	cl # floppies
  4875                                  
  4876                                  ; 16/10/2022
  4877                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - "MSEQU.INC" (24/07/1987)
  4878                                  INITSPOT EQU	534h	; IBM wants 4 zeros here
  4879                                  BRKADR	 EQU	1BH * 4	; 6CH, 1BH break vector address
  4880                                  TIMADR	EQU	1CH * 4	; 70H, 1CH timer interrupt
  4881                                  DSKADR	EQU	1EH * 4	; address of ptr to disk parameters
  4882                                  SEC9	EQU	522h	; address of disk parameters
  4883                                  CHROUT	EQU	29h
  4884                                  LSTDRV	EQU     504h
  4885                                  
  4886                                  ; determine whether we booted from floppy or hard disk...
  4887                                  
  4888 000017FF F6C280                  		test	dl, 80h		; boot from floppy ?
  4889 00001802 7502                    		jnz	short gothrd	; no.
  4890 00001804 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; indicate boot	from drive a
  4891                                  gothrd:					
  4892                                  		; 07/10/2023			
  4893                                  		;xor	dx, dx		; ax = 0-based drive we	booted from
  4894                                  		;			; bios_l, bios_h set.
  4895                                  		;			; cl = number of floppies including fake one
  4896                                  		;			; ch = media byte
  4897                                  
  4898                                  		; 07/10/2023
  4899                                  		; ss = 0, sp = 700h (from MSLOAD)
  4900                                  		;cli
  4901                                  		;mov	ss, dx		; set stack segment and stack pointer
  4902                                  		;mov	sp, 700h

  5278                                  
  5279                                  ; scan the list of drives to determine their type. we have three flavors of
  5280                                  ; diskette drives:
  5281                                  ;
  5282                                  ;   48tpi drives    we do nothing special for them
  5283                                  ;   96tpi drives    mark the fact that they have changeline support.
  5284                                  ;   3.5"  drives    mark changeline support and small.
  5285                                  ;
  5286                                  ; the following code uses registers for certain values:
  5287                                  ;
  5288                                  ;   dl - physical drive
  5289                                  ;   ds:di - points to current bds
  5290                                  ;   cx - flag bits for bds
  5291                                  ;   dh - form factor for the drive (1 - 48tpi, 2 - 96tpi, 3 - 3.5" medium)
  5292                                  					
  5293 000019A2 30D2                    		xor	dl, dl
  5294                                  
  5295                                  		; 21/12/2022
  5296                                  		; ds = cs
  5297                                  		;push	cs
  5298                                  		;pop	ds

  5302                                  					; to set aside two bdss	for the	two fake floppy	drives
  5303                                  
  5304                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  5305                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, MSINIT.ASM)
  5306                                  
  5307                                  ; check to see if we are faking floppy drives. if not we don't
  5308                                  ; do anything special. if we are faking floppy drives we need
  5309                                  ; to set aside two bdss for the two fake floppy drives. we
  5310                                  ; don't need to initalise any fields though. so starting at start_bds
  5311                                  ; use the link field in the bds structure to go to the second bds
  5312                                  ; in the list and initalise it's link field to -1 to set the end of
  5313                                  ; the list. then jump to the routine at dohard to allocate/initialise
  5314                                  ; the bds for harddrives.
  5315                                  
  5316 000019AC 803E[DF16]01            		cmp	byte [fakefloppydrv], 1
  5317 000019B1 750B                    		jnz	short loop_drive
  5318 000019B3 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5319                                  					; di <-	first bds link
  5320 000019B5 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5321                                  					; di <-	second bds link
  5322 000019B7 C705FFFF                		mov	word [di], 0FFFFh ; set end of link
  5323 000019BB E90801                  		jmp	dohard		; allocate/initialise bds for harddrives
  5324                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5325                                  
  5326                                  loop_drive:

  5329 000019C4 E9FB00                  		jmp	done_drives

  5331

  5333                                  		; 13/12/2023
  5334                                  		;xor	cx, cx		; zero all flags
  5335

  5337                                  					; get next bds
  5338 000019C9 B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; ff48tpi
  5339                                  					; set form factor to 48	tpi
  5340 000019CB C606[DE16]28            		mov	byte [num_cyln], 40 ; 40 tracks per side
  5341                                  		
  5342                                  		; 21/12/2022

  5344                                  		;push	di

  5354 000019D6 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  5355                                  					; DL = drive number
  5356                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  5357                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives

  5359                                  		; 13/12/2023

  5362                                  		; 13/12/2023
  5363 000019D9 7303                    		jnc	short chk_pfr
  5364 000019DB E98000                  		jmp	noparmsfromrom
  5365                                  
  5366                                  ; if cmos is bad, it gives es,ax,bx,cx,dh,di=0. cy=0.
  5367                                  ; in this case, we are going to put bogus informations to bds table.
  5368                                  ; we are going to set ch=39,cl=9,dh=1 to avoid divide overflow when
  5369                                  ; they are calculated at the later time. this is just for the diagnostic
  5370                                  ; diskette which need msbio,msdos to boot up before it sets cmos.
  5371                                  ; this should only happen with drive b.
  5372                                  
  5373                                  chk_pfr:
  5374 000019DE 80FD00                  		cmp	ch, 0		; if ch=0, then	cl,dh=0	too.
  5375 000019E1 7505                    		jnz	short pfr_ok
  5376                                  		;mov	ch, 39		; rom gave wrong info.
  5377                                  		;mov	cl, 9		; let's default to 360k.
  5378                                  		; 21/12/2022

  5388

  5390

  5392                                  		;jbe	short eot_ok
  5393                                  		; 09/12/2022

  5413                                  		; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - BIOSDATA:1AAAh)
  5414

  5416                                  		; (MSDOS 5.0 & MSDOS 6.22 IO.SYS both have a bug here,
  5417                                  		;  they does not save CX,DX registers before INT 13h func 15h)
  5418                                  		; (this is also a ROMBIOS bug, some ROMBIOSs return number
  5419                                  		;  of sectors in cx:dx pair while others restore cx:dx)
  5420                                  		;  -- ref: Ralf Brown's Interrupt List --
  5421                                  		; ((MSDOS 6.22 IO.SYS - BIOSDATA:1AF0h))
  5422                                  		; ((PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSDATA:2119h))
  5423                                  		; (This BUG does not exist in PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM)

  5427                                  		;push	dx ; *+ ; save drive number (DL)

  5434                                  					; DL = drive ID

  5436                                  					; CX:DX	= number of sectors on the media

  5439                                  		;pop	cx ; *+ ; restore flags (cx=0)

  5441                                  		mov	dx, bx ; *++ ; bl = drive number
  5442                                  		jc	short changeline_done
  5443                                  
  5444                                  		cmp	ah, 2		; check	for presence of	changeline
  5445                                  		jnz	short changeline_done

  5450                                  					; signal type

  5452                                  %endif
  5453                                  		; 13/12/2023

  5455                                  		;jc	short changeline_done

  5458                                  ; and can recognise. for the rest, we set the form factor as "other".

  5624                                  ; we need to do special things if we have a single drive system and are setting
  5625                                  ; up a logical drive. it needs to have the same int13 drive number as its
  5626                                  ; counterpart, but the next drive letter. also reset ownership flag.
  5627                                  ; we detect the presence of this situation by examining the flag single for the

  5745                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5746                                  ; if more than 2 diskette drives on the system, then it is necessary to remap
  5747                                  ; the bds chain to adjust the logical drive num (drive letter) with greater
  5748                                  ; than two diskette drives
  5749                                  ;
  5750                                  ; new scheme:	if more than 2 disktte drives, first map the bds structure
  5751                                  ;		as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the  drive
  5752                                  ;		letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5753                                  ;		drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5754                                  ;		and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  5755                                  ;		drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.
  5756                                  ;******************************************************************************

  5768                                  ;we now decide, based on the configurations available so far, what
  5769                                  ;code or data we need to keep as a stay resident code. the following table
  5770                                  ;shows the configurations under consideration. they are listed in the order
  5771                                  ;of their current position memory.
  5772                                  ;
  5773                                  ;configuration will be done in two ways:
  5774                                  ;
  5775                                  ;first, we are going to set "static configuration". static configuration will
  5776                                  ;consider from basic configuration to endof96tpi configuration. the result
  5777                                  ;of static configuration will be the address the dynamic configuration will
  5778                                  ;use to start with.
  5779                                  ;
  5780                                  ;secondly, "dynamic cofiguration" will be performed. dynamic configuration
  5781                                  ;involves possible relocation of code or data. dynamic configuration routine
  5782                                  ;will take care of bdsm tables and at rom fix module thru k09 suspend/resume
  5783                                  ;code individually. after these operation, [dosdatasg] will be set.
  5784                                  ;this will be the place sysinit routine will relocate msdos module for good.

  5869                                  ; M065 -- begin changes
  5870                                  ;
  5871                                  ; On certain systems with Western Digital disk controllers, the
  5872                                  ; following detection scheme caused an unpredictable and serious
  5873                                  ; failure. In particular, they've implemented a nonstandard
  5874                                  ; Int13(ah=16h) which reconfigures the hard drive, depending on
  5875                                  ; what happens to be at es:[bx] and other memory locations indexed
  5876                                  ; off of it.
  5877                                  ;
  5878                                  ; Compaq was unable to tell us exactly which kind of systems have
  5879                                  ; the bug, except that they guarantee that the bug was fixed in
  5880                                  ; ROM BIOSs dated 08/04/86 and later. We'll check for the COMPAQ
  5881                                  ; string, and then look for date codes before 08/04/86 to decide

  6122 00001C27 268B5D06                		mov	bx, [es:di+6]	; [di+BDS.BDS_BPB.BPB_BYTESPERSECTOR]
  6123 00001C2B 891E[D816]              		mov	[md_sectorsize], bx ; used by get_fat_sector proc.
  6124 00001C2F 268A5D1F                		mov	bl, [es:di+1Fh]	; [di+BDS.fatsiz]
  6125                                  					; get size of fat on media
  6126 00001C33 881E[D216]              		mov	[fbigfat], bl
  6127 00001C37 268A4D08                		mov	cl, [es:di+8]
  6128 00001C3B 268B4517                		mov	ax, [es:di+17h] ; [di+BDS.BDS_BPB.BPB_HIDDENSECTORS]
  6129 00001C3F 2906[CC16]              		sub	[bios_l], ax	; subtract hidden sectors since we
  6130                                  					; need a logical sector number that will
  6131                                  					; be used by getclus(diskrd procedure)
  6132 00001C43 268B4519                		mov	ax, [es:di+19h] ; [di+BDS.BDS_BPB.BPB_HIDDENSECTORS+2]
  6133 00001C47 1906[CE16]              		sbb	[bios_h], ax	; subtract upper 16 bits of sector num
  6134                                  	; ------
  6135                                  
  6136 00001C4B 30ED                    		xor	ch, ch	 ; cx = sectors/cluster
  6137                                  
  6138                                  	; the boot program has left the directory at 0:500h
  6139                                  
  6140 00001C4D 1E                      		push	ds
  6141 00001C4E 31FF                    		xor	di, di
  6142 00001C50 8EDF                    		mov	ds, di
  6143 00001C52 8B1E3A05                		mov	bx, [53Ah]
  6144                                  		;mov	bx, ds:53Ah	; clus=*53Ah
  6145                                  					; (First cluster field of 2nd dir entry
  6146                                  					; of root directory in the buffer at 500h)
  6147 00001C56 1F                      		pop	ds
  6148                                  loadit:
  6149 00001C57 B84D04                  		mov	ax, SYSINITSEG	; 46Dh
  6150                                  		;mov	ax, 46Dh	; sysinit segment
  6151 00001C5A 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  6152 00001C5C 268E06[7102]            		mov	es, [es:CURRENTDOSLOCATION] ; 09/12/2022
  6153                                  		;mov	es, [es:271h]
  6154                                  
  6155 00001C61 E8B206                  		call	getclus		; read cluster at ES:DI (DI is updated)
  6156                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6157                                  ;iseof:
  6158                                  		;;test	byte [cs:fbigfat], fbig
  6159                                  		;test	byte [cs:fbigfat], 40h ; fbig
  6160                                  		; 12/12/2023
  6161                                  		; ds = cs
  6162 00001C64 F606[D216]40            		test	byte [fbigfat], 40h ; fbig
  6163 00001C69 7506                    		jnz	short eofbig
  6164 00001C6B 81FBF70F                		cmp	bx, 0FF7h
  6165 00001C6F EB03                    		jmp	short iseofx
  6166                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6167

  6170                                  iseofx:

  6172 00001C76 E8F003                  		call	setdrvparms	; 
  6173

  6175                                  		;jmp	far 46Dh:267h
  6176 00001C79 EA[6702]4D04            		jmp	SYSINITSEG:SYSINITSTART

  6178                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  6179                                  
  6180                                  ; Following are subroutines to support resident device driver initialization
  6181                                  ;
  6182                                  ;M011 -- note:  deleted setup_bdsms and reset_bdsms here
  6183                                  
  6184                                  ;	M035 -- begin changed section
  6185                                  
  6186                                  ;******************************************************************************
  6187                                  ; module name: remap
  6188                                  ;
  6189                                  ; descriptive name: all the code for himem that could be separated from msbio
  6190                                  ;
  6191                                  ; function:  remap the bds chain to adjusted logical drive numbers (drive
  6192                                  ;	     letters) if more than two diskette drives on the system.
  6193                                  ;
  6194                                  ;     scheme:  if more than 2 diskette drives, first map the bds structure
  6195                                  ;	       as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the drive
  6196                                  ;	       letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  6197                                  ;	       drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  6198                                  ;	       and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  6199                                  ;	       drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.
  6200                                  
  6201                                  ; input:       none
  6202                                  ; exit:	drive letters have been remapped in bds chain
  6203                                  ; exit error:  none
  6204                                  ; called from: msinit
  6205                                  ;
  6206                                  ; notes:  this function  will be called only if more than 2 diskettes are
  6207                                  ;	  found in the system
  6208                                  ;	  this function assumes that there are no more than 26 drives assigned
  6209                                  ;	    this is guaranteed by the code that creates bdss for partitions
  6210                                  ;	  this function assumes that the first entries in the chain are
  6211                                  ;	   floppy drives, and all the rest are hard drives
  6212                                  ;	  will alter the boot drive if necessary to reflect remapping
  6213                                  ;
  6214                                  ;******************************************************************************
  6215                                  
  6216                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6217                                  ; 02/10/2022
  6218                                  
  6219                                  remap:		; proc near
  6220                                  
  6221                                  		; 15/12/2023
  6222                                  		; ds = cs
  6223                                  		;mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; get first bds
  6224 00001C7E 8B3E[1901]              		mov	di, [start_bds]
  6225                                  
  6226                                  ; search for 1st fixed disk physical drive num
  6227                                  
  6228                                  drive_loop:
  6229 00001C82 807D0480                		cmp	byte [di+4], 80h ; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  6230                                  					; first	hard disk??
  6231 00001C86 7409                    		jz	short fdrv_found ; yes,	continue
  6232 00001C88 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6233                                  					; get next bds,	assume segment
  6234 00001C8A 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, -1 ; 0FFFFh	; last bds?
  6235 00001C8D 75F3                    		jnz	short drive_loop ; loop	if not
  6236 00001C8F EB49                    		jmp	short rmap_exit	; yes, no hard drive on	system
  6237                                  
  6238                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6239                                  ;first disk drive bds, now change the logical drive num to 2 and the subsequent
  6240                                  ;logical drive nums to 3, 4, 5 etc.
  6241                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6242                                  
  6243                                  fdrv_found:
  6244 00001C91 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; start	with logical drv num=2
  6245                                  fdrv_loop:
  6246 00001C93 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6247 00001C96 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6248                                  					; ds:di--> next	bds
  6249                                  		;inc	al		; set num for next drive
  6250                                  		; 18/12/2022
  6251 00001C98 40                      		inc	ax
  6252 00001C99 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; last hard drive ?
  6253 00001C9C 75F5                    		jnz	short fdrv_loop	; no - assign more disk drives
  6254                                  
  6255                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6256                                  ; now, rescan and find bds of 3rd floppy drive and assign next drive letter
  6257                                  ; in al to 3rd. if the current drive letter is past z, then do not allocate
  6258                                  ; any more.
  6259                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6260                                  
  6261                                  		;mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; [start_bds]
  6262                                  		; 15/12/2023
  6263 00001C9E 8B3E[1901]              		mov	di, [start_bds]	; get first bds
  6264 00001CA2 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6265                                  					; ds:di-->bds2
  6266                                  		;mov	ah, [cs:dsktnum] ; get number of floppies to remap
  6267 00001CA4 8A26[2501]              		mov	ah, [dsktnum]
  6268 00001CA8 80EC02                  		sub	ah, 2		; adjust for a:	& b:
  6269                                  remap_loop1:
  6270 00001CAB 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6271                                  					; set new num to next floppy
  6272 00001CAD 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6273 00001CB0 FEC0                    		inc	al		; new number for next floppy
  6274 00001CB2 FECC                    		dec	ah		; count down extra floppies
  6275 00001CB4 75F5                    		jnz	short remap_loop1
  6276                                  
  6277                                  ; now we've got to adjust the boot drive if we reassigned it
  6278                                  
  6279                                  		; 15/12/2023
  6280                                  		;mov	al, [cs:drvfat]
  6281 00001CB6 A0[CA16]                		mov	al, [drvfat]
  6282 00001CB9 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; is it	a: or b: ?
  6283 00001CBB 721D                    		jb	short rmap_exit
  6284                                  		;sub	al, [cs:dsktnum]
  6285 00001CBD 2A06[2501]              		sub	al, [dsktnum]	; is it one of the other floppies?
  6286 00001CC1 7204                    		jb	short remap_boot_flop ;	brif so
  6287                                  
  6288                                  ; we've got to remap the boot hard drive
  6289                                  ; subtract the number of EXTRA floppies from it
  6290                                  
  6291 00001CC3 0402                    		add	al, 2		; bootdrv -= (dsktnum-2)
  6292 00001CC5 EB04                    		jmp	short remap_change_boot_drv
  6293                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6294                                  
  6295                                  ; we've got to remap the boot floppy.
  6296                                  ; add the number of hard drive partitions to it
  6297                                  
  6298                                  remap_boot_flop:
  6299                                  		;add	al, [cs:drvmax]	; bootdrv += (drvmax-dsktnum)
  6300                                  		; 15/12/2023
  6301 00001CC7 0206[7500]              		add	al, [drvmax]
  6302                                  remap_change_boot_drv:			
  6303                                  		;mov	[cs:drvfat], al ; alter msdos.sys load drive
  6304 00001CCB A2[CA16]                		mov	[drvfat], al
  6305 00001CCE FEC0                    		inc	al
  6306 00001CD0 1E                      		push	ds
  6307 00001CD1 BF4D04                  		mov	di, SYSINITSEG	; 46Dh
  6308                                  		;mov	di, 544h	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM
  6309                                  		;;mov	di, 46Dh	; SYSINIT segment
  6310 00001CD4 8EDF                    		mov	ds, di
  6311 00001CD6 A2[9602]                		mov	[DEFAULTDRIVE], al
  6312                                  		;mov	ds:296h, al	; [SYSINIT+DEFAULT_DRIVE]
  6313                                  					; pass it to sysinit as	well
  6314 00001CD9 1F                      		pop	ds ; ds = cs
  6315                                  rmap_exit:
  6316 00001CDA C3                      		retn
  6317                                  
  6318                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  6319                                  
  6320                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6321                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 -actual-)
  6322                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 -draft-)
  6323                                  ; 02/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3)	
  6324                                  ; 19/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0 (MSDOS 2.11)
  6325                                  ;**************************************************
  6326                                  ; getboot - get the boot sector for a hard disk
  6327                                  ;
  6328                                  ; Reads the boot sector from a specified drive into
  6329                                  ; a buffer at the top of memory.
  6330                                  ;
  6331                                  ; dl = int13 drive number to read boot sector for
  6332                                  ;**************************************************
  6333                                  
  6334                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6335                                  bootbias equ 200h
  6336                                  
  6337                                  getboot:	; proc near
  6338                                  		
  6339                                  		; 15/12/2023
  6340                                  		; ds = cs
  6341                                  		
  6342                                  		; 08/04/2018
  6343                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 (IBMBIO.COM, IBMDOS 2.1)
  6344                                  		; 28/03/2018 - MSDOS 6.0 - MSINIT.ASM, 1991
  6345                                  		; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
  6346                                  		;	      (disassembled IO.SYS code of MSDOS 5.0)
  6347                                  
  6348                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:init_bootseg] ; 17/10/2022
  6349                                  		; 15/12/2023
  6350 00001CDB A1[D516]                		mov	ax, [init_bootseg]
  6351 00001CDE 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  6352                                  
  6353                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6354 00001CE0 BB0002                  		mov	bx, bootbias ; 200h
  6355                                  		;mov	bx, 200h	; bootbias
  6356                                  					; load BX, ES:BX is where sector goes
  6357 00001CE3 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  6358 00001CE6 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
  6359 00001CE8 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1
  6360 00001CEB CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  6361                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  6362                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  6363                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  6364 00001CED 7209                    		jb	short erret
  6365                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6366 00001CEF 26813EFE0355AA          		cmp	word [es:bootbias+1FEh], 0AA55h
  6367                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:3FEh, 0AA55h ; [es:bootbias+1FEh]
  6368                                  					; Dave Litton magic word?
  6369 00001CF6 7401                    		jz	short norm_ret	; yes
  6370                                  erret:
  6371 00001CF8 F9                      		stc
  6372                                  norm_ret:
  6373 00001CF9 C3                      		retn
  6374                                  
  6375                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  6376                                  
  6377                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 
  6378                                  
  6379                                  ;***************************************************************************
  6380                                  ;   sethard - generate bpb for a variable sized hard file. ibm has a
  6381                                  ;   partitioned hard file; we must read physical sector 0 to determine where
  6382                                  ;   our own logical sectors start. we also read in our boot sector to
  6383                                  ;   determine version number
  6384                                  ;
  6385                                  ;   inputs:	dl is rom drive number (80...)
  6386                                  ;		bh is partition number (0....) 
  6387                                  ;		ds:di points to bds
  6388                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear -> bpb is filled in
  6389                                  ;		carry set   -> bpb is left uninitialized due to error
  6390                                  ;	trashes (at least) si, cx
  6391                                  ;	MUST PRESERVE ES:!!!!
  6392                                  ;***************************************************************************
  6393                                  
  6394                                  sethard:	; proc near		
  6395                                  		; 14/08/2023
  6396                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA
  6397 00001CFA 57                      		push	di
  6398 00001CFB 53                      		push	bx
  6399                                  		;push	ds  ; ds = cs = BIOSDATA ; 14/08/2023
  6400 00001CFC 06                      		push	es
  6401 00001CFD 885D05                  		mov	[di+5],	bl	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6402 00001D00 885504                  		mov	[di+4],	dl	; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  6403 00001D03 804D2301                		or	byte [di+23h], 1 ; [di+BDS.flags]
  6404                                  					; fnon_removable
  6405 00001D07 C6452205                		mov	byte [di+22h], 5 ; [di+BDS.formfactor]
  6406                                  					; ffHardFile
  6407 00001D0B C606[D216]00            		mov	byte [fbigfat], 0 ; assume 12 bit FAT
  6408 00001D10 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; partition number
  6409 00001D12 52                      		push	dx
  6410 00001D13 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  6411 00001D15 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  6412                                  					; DL = drive number
  6413                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  6414                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  6415                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  6416 00001D17 FEC6                    		inc	dh
  6417 00001D19 887515                  		mov	[di+15h], dh	; [di+BDS.heads] ; get number of heads
  6418 00001D1C 5A                      		pop	dx
  6419 00001D1D 7263                    		jb	short setret	; error	if no hard disk
  6420 00001D1F 80E13F                  		and	cl, 3Fh
  6421 00001D22 884D13                  		mov	[di+13h], cl	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  6422 00001D25 52                      		push	dx		; save partition number
  6423 00001D26 E8B2FF                  		call	getboot
  6424 00001D29 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore partition number
  6425 00001D2A 7256                    		jb	short setret
  6426 00001D2C BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6427                                  
  6428                                  ; The first 'active' partition is 00, the second is 01....
  6429                                  ;   then the remainder of the 'primary' but non-active partitions
  6430                                  
  6431                                  act_part:				
  6432 00001D2F 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h ; is the partition active?
  6433 00001D34 7418                    		jz	short no_act	; no
  6434 00001D36 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; reject if partitiontype != 1, 4 or 6
  6435 00001D3A 740C                    		jz	short got_good_act
  6436 00001D3C 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6437 00001D40 7406                    		jz	short got_good_act
  6438 00001D42 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6439 00001D46 7506                    		jnz	short no_act
  6440                                  got_good_act:				
  6441 00001D48 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition #?
  6442 00001D4A 743A                    		jz	short set2	; WE GOT THE ONE WANTED!!
  6443 00001D4C FECE                    		dec	dh		; count	down
  6444                                  no_act:					
  6445 00001D4E 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6446 00001D51 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6447                                  					; last entry done?
  6448 00001D55 75D8                    		jnz	short act_part	; no, process next entry
  6449 00001D57 BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6450                                  					; restore original value of bx
  6451                                  
  6452                                  ; Now scan the non-active partitions
  6453                                  
  6454                                  get_primary:				
  6455 00001D5A 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h
  6456 00001D5F 7518                    		jnz	short not_prim	; we've already scanned
  6457                                  					; the ACTIVE ones
  6458 00001D61 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; see if partitiontype == 1, 4 or 6
  6459 00001D65 740C                    		jz	short got_prim
  6460 00001D67 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6461 00001D6B 7406                    		jz	short got_prim
  6462 00001D6D 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6463 00001D71 7506                    		jnz	short not_prim
  6464                                  got_prim:				
  6465 00001D73 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition?
  6466 00001D75 740F                    		jz	short set2
  6467 00001D77 FECE                    		dec	dh
  6468                                  not_prim:				
  6469 00001D79 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6470 00001D7C 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6471 00001D80 75D8                    		jnz	short get_primary ; loop till we've gone through table
  6472                                  setret:					
  6473 00001D82 F9                      		stc			; error	return
  6474 00001D83 E9A002                  		jmp	ret_hard_err
  6475                                  
  6476                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6477                                  
  6478                                  ;  until we get the real logical boot record and get the bpb,
  6479                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be used instead of BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS
  6480                                  ;  for the convenience of the computation.
  6481                                  ;
  6482                                  ;  at the end of this procedure, if a bpb information is gotten from
  6483                                  ;  the valid boot record, then we are going to use those bpb information
  6484                                  ;  without change.
  6485                                  ;
  6486                                  ;  otherwise, if (hidden sectors + total sectors) <= a word, then we will move
  6487                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS (low) to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and zero out
  6488                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS entry to make it a conventional bpb format.
  6489                                  
  6490                                  set2:					
  6491                                  		; 14/08/2023
  6492                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment (0070h)
  6493 00001D86 8816[D716]              		mov	[rom_drv_num], dl
  6494                                  		;mov	[cs:rom_drv_num], dl
  6495                                  			; save the rom bios drive number we are handling now.
  6496 00001D8A 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]	; hidden sectors (start	sector)
  6497 00001D8E 268B5706                		mov	dx, [es:bx+6]
  6498                                  
  6499                                  ; decrement the sector count by 1 to make it zero based. exactly 64k
  6500                                  ; sectors should be allowed	
  6501                                  
  6502 00001D92 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1
  6503 00001D95 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0
  6504 00001D98 26034708                		add	ax, [es:bx+8]	; sectors in partition
  6505 00001D9C 2613570A                		adc	dx, [es:bx+10]
  6506 00001DA0 7305                    		jnb	short okdrive
  6507 00001DA2 800E[D216]80            		or	byte [fbigfat], 80h ; ftoobig
  6508                                  okdrive:				
  6509 00001DA7 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]
  6510 00001DAB 894517                  		mov	[di+17h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  6511                                  					; BPB_HIDDENSECTORS = p->partitionbegin
  6512 00001DAE 268B4706                		mov	ax, [es:bx+6]
  6513 00001DB2 894519                  		mov	[di+19h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  6514 00001DB5 268B570A                		mov	dx, [es:bx+10]	; # of sectors (high)
  6515 00001DB9 268B4708                		mov	ax, [es:bx+8]	; # of sectors (low)
  6516 00001DBD 89551D                  		mov	[di+1Dh], dx	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]

  6892                                  ; ****** cas ---

  6898                                  ; it for calculating the fat size. Pretty scary, huh? For now,
  6899                                  ; we'll go ahead and copy it into the DPB, except in the case
  6900                                  ; that it equals zero, in which case we just use the values in
  6901                                  ; the DPB from the partition table.
  6902                                  
  6903                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6904                                  ;MOVMEDIAIDS equ mov_media_ids - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (751h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  6905                                  ;CLEARIDS equ clear_ids - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (5D9h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)		    		
  6906                                  ; 09/12/2022
  6907                                  MOVMEDIAIDS equ mov_media_ids
  6908                                  CLEARIDS equ clear_ids
  6909                                  ; 11/09/2023
  6910                                  CLEARIDS_X equ clear_ids_x
  6911                                  
  6912                                  copybpb_fat:
  6913                                  		; 10/12/2022
  6914                                  		; (number of FATs optimization)
  6915                                  		; SI = disksector+11				
  6916                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6917                                  		;mov	si, disksector+11
  6918                                  		;;mov	si, 159h	; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB
  6919                                  					; cs:si	-> bpb in boot
  6920 00001EEA 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6921                                  		; 14/08/2023
  6922                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment (0070h)
  6923 00001EEC 8B4408                  		mov	ax, [si+8]
  6924                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:si+8]	; [cs:si+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
  6925                                  					; get totsec from boot sec
  6926 00001EEF 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
  6927 00001EF1 7514                    		jnz	short copy_totsec ; if non zero, use that
  6928 00001EF3 8B4415                  		mov	ax, [si+15h] ; 12/08/2023
  6929                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:si+15h]	; [cs:si+EBPB.BIGTOTALSECTORS]
  6930                                  					; get the big version
  6931                                  					; (32 bit total	sectors)
  6932 00001EF6 8B5417                  		mov	dx, [si+17h] ; 12/08/2023
  6933                                  		;mov	dx, [cs:si+17h]	; [cs:si+EBPB.BIGTOTALSECTORS+2]
  6934                                  		; 10/12/2022
  6935                                  		; (number of FATs optimization)
  6936                                  		; CL = number of FATs (2 or 1) 
  6937 00001EF9 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; see if it is a big zero
  6938 00001EFB 09C3                    		or	bx, ax
  6939 00001EFD 7508                    		jnz	short copy_totsec
  6940                                  			; screw it. it was bogus.
  6941 00001EFF 8B451B                  		mov	ax, [di+1Bh]	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32]
  6942 00001F02 8B551D                  		mov	dx, [di+1Dh]	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  6943 00001F05 EB06                    		jmp	short fat_big_small
  6944                                  
  6945                                  		;mov	cx, dx
  6946                                  		;or	cx, ax		; see if it is a big zero
  6947                                  		;jz	short totsec_already_set ; screw it. it	was bogus.
  6948                                  copy_totsec:				
  6949 00001F07 89451B                  		mov	[di+1Bh], ax	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32]
  6950                                  					; make DPB match boot sec
  6951 00001F0A 89551D                  		mov	[di+1Dh], dx	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  6952                                  
  6953                                  		; 10/12/2022
  6954                                  ;totsec_already_set:			
  6955                                  		;mov	ax, [di+1Bh]	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32]
  6956                                  		;mov	dx, [di+1Dh]	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  6957                                  
  6958                                  ; determine fat entry size.
  6959                                  
  6960                                  fat_big_small:
  6961                                  
  6962                                  ;at this moment dx;ax = total sector number
  6963                                  
  6964                                  ;Do not assume 1 reserved sector. Update the reserved sector field in BDS 
  6965                                  ;from the BPB on the disk
  6966                                  				
  6967                                  		; 14/08/2023
  6968                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment (0070h)
  6969                                  				
  6970 00001F0D 8B5C03                  		mov	bx, [si+3]
  6971                                  		;mov	bx, [cs:si+3]	; [cs:si+EBPB.RESERVEDSECTORS]
  6972                                  					; get #reserved_sectors	from BPB
  6973 00001F10 895D09                  		mov	[di+9],	bx	; [di+BDS.resectors]
  6974                                  					; update BDS field
  6975 00001F13 29D8                    		sub	ax, bx
  6976 00001F15 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; update the count
  6977                                  		; 14/08/2023
  6978 00001F18 8B5C0B                  		mov	bx, [si+0Bh]
  6979                                  		;mov	bx, [cs:si+0Bh]	; [cs:si+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
  6980                                  					; bx = sectors/fat
  6981 00001F1B 895D11                  		mov	[di+11h], bx	; [di+BDS.fatsecs]
  6982                                  					; set in bds bpb
  6983                                  		; 10/12/2022
  6984                                  		; (number of FATs optimization)
  6985                                  		; CL = number of FATs (2 or 1) 
  6986                                  		;dec	cl ; *
  6987                                  		; 18/12/2022
  6988 00001F1E 49                      		dec	cx ; *
  6989 00001F1F D3E3                    		shl	bx, cl
  6990                                  		;shl	bx, 1	; =*?=	; always 2 fats
  6991                                  		
  6992 00001F21 29D8                    		sub	ax, bx		; sub #	fat sectors
  6993 00001F23 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0
  6994 00001F26 8B5C06                  		mov	bx, [si+6] ; 14/08/2023
  6995                                  		;mov	bx, [cs:si+6]	; [cs:si+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
  6996                                  					; # root entries
  6997 00001F29 895D0C                  		mov	[di+0Ch], bx	; [di+BDS.direntries]
  6998                                  					; set in bds bpb
  6999 00001F2C B104                    		mov	cl, 4
  7000 00001F2E D3EB                    		shr	bx, cl		; div by 16 ents/sector
  7001 00001F30 29D8                    		sub	ax, bx		; sub #	dir sectors
  7002 00001F32 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		;
  7003                                  					; dx:ax	now contains the
  7004                                  					; # of data sectors
  7005 00001F35 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx ; *
  7006 00001F37 8A4C02                  		mov	cl, [si+2] ; 14/08/2023
  7007                                  		;mov	cl, [cs:si+2]	; [cs:si+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  7008                                  					; sectors per cluster
  7009 00001F3A 884D08                  		mov	[di+8],	cl	; [di+BDS.secperclus]
  7010                                  					; set in bios bpb
  7011 00001F3D 50                      		push	ax
  7012 00001F3E 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
  7013 00001F40 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  7014 00001F42 F7F1                    		div	cx		; cx = sectors per cluster
  7015                                  		; 14/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  7016 00001F44 A3[2905]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
  7017                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_h], ax	; [temp_h]:ax now contains the
  7018                                  					; # clusters.
  7019 00001F47 58                      		pop	ax
  7020 00001F48 F7F1                    		div	cx
  7021                                  		;cmp	word [cs:temp_h], 0
  7022 00001F4A 833E[2905]00            		cmp	word [temp_h], 0 ; 14/08/2023
  7023 00001F4F 7718                    		ja	short toobig_ret ; too big cluster number
  7024 00001F51 3DF60F                  		cmp	ax, 0FF6h	; 4096-10
  7025                                  					; is this 16-bit fat?
  7026 00001F54 7205                    		jb	short copymediaid ; no,	small fat
  7027                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7028 00001F56 800E[D216]40            		or	byte [fbigfat], 40h
  7029                                  		;or	ds:fbigfat, 40h	; fbig
  7030                                  					; 16 bit fat
  7031                                  copymediaid:				
  7032 00001F5B 06                      		push	es
  7033 00001F5C 1E                      		push	ds
  7034 00001F5D 07                      		pop	es
  7035                                  		; 14/08/2023
  7036                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA
  7037                                  		;push	cs
  7038                                  		;pop	ds
  7039                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7040 00001F5E BD[3607]                		mov	bp, MOVMEDIAIDS
  7041                                  		;mov	bp, 751h	; mov_media_ids
  7042                                  					; at 2C7h:751h = 70h:2CC1h
  7043                                  					; copy filesys_id, volume label
  7044 00001F61 0E                      		push	cs		; simulate far call
  7045 00001F62 E8FEF7                  		call	call_bios_code
  7046                                  		; 14/08/2023
  7047                                  		;push	es
  7048                                  		;pop	ds
  7049 00001F65 07                      		pop	es
  7050 00001F66 E99800                  		jmp	massage_bpb	; now final check for bpb info
  7051                                  					; and return.
  7052                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7053                                  
  7054                                  toobig_ret:				
  7055                                  		; 14/08/2023 (ds=cs=BIOSDATA)
  7056 00001F69 800E[D216]80            		or	byte [fbigfat], 80h ; ftoobig
  7057                                  		;or	byte [cs:fbigfat], 80h ; ftoobig 
  7058                                  					; too big (32 bit clust #) for FAT16
  7059 00001F6E E9AE00                  		jmp	goodret		; still	drive letter is	assigned
  7060                                  					; but useless. to big for
  7061                                  					; current pc dos fat file system

  7064                                  unknown:	
  7065                                  		; 12/12/2022
  7066 00001F71 804D2402                		or	byte [di+24h], 02h

  7068                                  					; unformatted_media
  7069                                  					; Set unformatted media	flag.
  7070

  7072                                  ; but we should	try and	read it	anyway.
  7073                                  
  7074                                  unknown3_0:

  7076                                  					; [di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  7077 00001F78 8B451B                  		mov	ax, [di+1Bh]	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32]
  7078 00001F7B BE[0817]                		mov	si, disktable2
  7079                                  
  7080                                  scan:					
  7081                                  		;cmp	dx, [cs:si]	; total sectors hw
  7082                                  		; 14/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  7083 00001F7E 3B14                    		cmp	dx, [si] 
  7084 00001F80 720C                    		jb	short gotparm
  7085 00001F82 7705                    		ja	short scan_next
  7086                                  		;cmp	ax, [cs:si+2]	; total sectors lw
  7087 00001F84 3B4402                  		cmp	ax, [si+2]
  7088 00001F87 7605                    		jbe	short gotparm
  7089                                  
  7090                                  scan_next:				
  7091 00001F89 83C60A                  		add	si, 10		; 5*2
  7092 00001F8C EBF0                    		jmp	short scan	; covers upto 512 mb media
  7093                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7094                                  
  7095                                  gotparm:				
  7096 00001F8E 8A4C08                  		mov	cl, [si+8]	; fat size for fbigfat flag
  7097                                  		;or	ds:fbigfat, cl
  7098                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7099 00001F91 080E[D216]              		or	[fbigfat], cl	; (fbig flag, 40h or 0) ; 08/08/2023
  7100                                  		; 14/08/2023
  7101                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA
  7102 00001F95 8B4C04                  		mov	cx, [si+4]
  7103                                  		;mov	cx, [cs:si+4]	; ch = number of sectors per cluster
  7104                                  					; cl = log base 2 of ch
  7105 00001F98 8B5406                  		mov	dx, [si+6]
  7106                                  		;mov	dx, [cs:si+6]	; dx = number of root dir entries
  7107                                  
  7108                                  ; now calculate size of fat table
  7109                                  
  7110 00001F9B 89550C                  		mov	[di+0Ch], dx	; [di+BDS.direntries]
  7111                                  					; save number of (root)	dir entries
  7112 00001F9E 8B551D                  		mov	dx, [di+1Dh]	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
