  9278                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9279                                  
  9280                                  ;************************************************************************
  9281                                  ;*									*
  9282                                  ;*	aux port driver code -- "aux" == "com1"				*
  9283                                  ;*									*
  9284                                  ;*	the device driver entry/dispatch code sets up auxnum to		*
  9285                                  ;*	give the com port number to use (0=com1, 1=com2, 2=com3...)	*
  9286                                  ;*									*
  9287                                  ;************************************************************************
  9288                                  
  9289                                  ;	values in ah, requesting function of int 14h in rom bios
  9290                                  
  9291                                  ;auxfunc_send	 equ	1	;transmit
  9292                                  ;auxfunc_receive equ	2	;read
  9293                                  ;auxfunc_status	 equ	3	;request status
  9294                                  
  9295                                  ;	error flags, reported by int 14h, reported in ah:
  9296                                  
  9297                                  ;flag_data_ready equ	01h	;data ready
  9298                                  ;flag_overrun	 equ	02h	;overrun error
  9299                                  ;flag_parity	 equ	04h	;parity error
  9300                                  ;flag_frame	 equ	08h	;framing error
  9301                                  ;flag_break	 equ	10h	;break detect
  9302                                  ;flag_tranhol_emp equ	20h	;transmit holding register empty
  9303                                  ;flag_timeout	 equ	80h	;timeout
  9304                                  
  9305                                  ;	these flags reported in al:
  9306                                  
  9307                                  ;flag_cts	 equ	10h	;clear to send
  9308                                  ;flag_dsr	 equ	20h	;data set ready
  9309                                  ;flag_rec_sig	 equ	80h	;receive line signal detect
  9310                                  
  9311                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9312                                  
  9313                                  ;************************************************************************
  9314                                  ;*									*
  9315                                  ;*	aux_read - read cx bytes from [auxnum] aux port to buffer	*
  9316                                  ;*		   at es:di						*
  9317                                  ;*									*
  9318                                  ;************************************************************************
  9319                                  
  9320                                  aux_read:				; 2C7h:30Dh = 70h:287Dh
  9321                                  		;jcxz	short exvec2
  9322 00000306 E311                    		jcxz	exvec2		; 19/10/2022
  9323 00000308 E87700                  		call	getbx		; put address of auxbuf	in bx
  9324 0000030B 30C0                    		xor	al, al
  9325 0000030D 8607                    		xchg	al, [bx]
  9326 0000030F 08C0                    		or	al, al
  9327 00000311 7503                    		jnz	short aux2
  9328                                  aux1:					
  9329 00000313 E80500                  		call	auxin		; get character	from port
  9330                                  					; won't return if error
  9331                                  aux2:					
  9332 00000316 AA                      		stosb
  9333 00000317 E2FA                    		loop	aux1		; if more characters, go around	again
  9334                                  exvec2:					
  9335 00000319 F8                      		clc			; all done, successful exit
  9336                                  auxin_retn:	; 18/12/2022
  9337 0000031A C3                      		retn
  9338                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9339                                  
  9340                                  ;************************************************************************
  9341                                  ;*									*
  9342                                  ;*	auxin - call rom bios to read character from aux port		*
  9343                                  ;*		if error occurs, map the error and return one		*
  9344                                  ;*		level up to device driver exit code, setting		*
  9345                                  ;*		the number of bytes transferred appropriately		*
  9346                                  ;*									*
  9347                                  ;************************************************************************
  9348                                  
  9349                                  auxin:					
  9350 0000031B B402                    		mov	ah, 2		; auxfunc_receive
  9351 0000031D E83C00                  		call	auxop
  9352 00000320 F6C40E                  		test	ah, 0Eh		; flag_frame|flag_parity|flag_overrun
  9353                                  		;jnz	short arbad	; skip if any error bits set
  9354                                  		;retn
  9355                                  		; 25/06/2023 (BugFix)
  9356 00000323 74F5                    		jz	short auxin_retn
  9357                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9358                                  
  9359                                  arbad:					
  9360 00000325 58                      		pop	ax		; remove return	address	(near call)
  9361 00000326 30C0                    		xor	al, al
  9362 00000328 0CB0                    		or	al, 0B0h	; flag_rec_sig|	flag_dsr|flag_cts
  9363 0000032A E9AAFD                  		jmp	bc_err_cnt
  9364                                  
  9365                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9366                                  
  9367                                  ;************************************************************************
  9368                                  ;*									*
  9369                                  ;*	aux_rdnd - non-destructive aux port read			*
  9370                                  ;*									*
  9371                                  ;************************************************************************
  9372                                  
  9373                                  aux_rdnd:				; 2C7h:335h = 70h:28A5h
  9374 0000032D E85200                  		call	getbx
  9375 00000330 8A07                    		mov	al, [bx]	; have bx point	to auxbuf
  9376 00000332 08C0                    		or	al, al		; if al	is non-zero (char in buffer)
  9377 00000334 7511                    		jnz	short auxdrx	; then return character
  9378 00000336 E82100                  		call	auxstat		; if not, get status of	aux device
  9379 00000339 F6C401                  		test	ah, 1		; flag_data_ready - test data ready
  9380 0000033C 740C                    		jz	short auxbus	; then device is busy (not ready)
  9381 0000033E A820                    		test	al, 20h		; flag_dsr - test data set ready
  9382 00000340 7408                    		jz	short auxbus	; then device is busy (not ready)
  9383 00000342 E8D6FF                  		call	auxin		; else aux is ready, get character
  9384 00000345 8807                    		mov	[bx], al
  9385                                  auxdrx:					
  9386 00000347 E9A7FE                  		jmp	rdexit		; return busy status
  9387                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9388                                  
  9389                                  auxbus:					
  9390 0000034A E979FE                  		jmp	z_bus_exit
  9391                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9392                                  
  9393                                  ;************************************************************************
  9394                                  ;*									*
  9395                                  ;*	aux_wrst - return aux port write status				*
  9396                                  ;*									*
  9397                                  ;************************************************************************
  9398                                  
  9399                                  aux_wrst:				; 2C7h:355h = 70h:28C5h
  9400 0000034D E80A00                  		call	auxstat		; get status of	aux in ax
  9401 00000350 A820                    		test	al, 20h		; test data set	ready
  9402 00000352 74F6                    		jz	short auxbus	; then device is busy (not ready)
  9403 00000354 F6C420                  		test	ah, 20h		; flag_tranhol_emp - test transmit hold	reg empty
  9404 00000357 74F1                    		jz	short auxbus	; then device is busy (not ready)
  9405                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9406                                  		; cf=0	; (test instruction resets cf)
  9407                                  		;clc
  9408 00000359 C3                      		retn
  9409                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9410                                  
  9411                                  ;************************************************************************
  9412                                  ;*									*
  9413                                  ;*	auxstat - call rom bios to determine aux port status		*
  9414                                  ;*									*
  9415                                  ;*	exit:	ax = status						*
  9416                                  ;*		dx = [auxnum]						*
  9417                                  ;*									*
  9418                                  ;************************************************************************
  9419                                  
  9420                                  auxstat:				
  9421 0000035A B403                    		mov	ah, 3		; auxfunc_status
  9422                                  
  9423                                  		; fall into auxop
  9424                                  
  9425                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9426                                  
  9427                                  ;************************************************************************
  9428                                  ;*									*
  9429                                  ;*	auxop - perform rom-biox aux port interrupt			*
  9430                                  ;*									*
  9431                                  ;*	entry:	ah = int 14h function number				*
  9432                                  ;*	exit:	ax = results						*
  9433                                  ;*		dx = [auxnum]						*
  9434                                  ;*									*
  9435                                  ;************************************************************************
  9436                                  
  9437                                  auxop:		; proc near		
  9438 0000035C 8B16[2100]              		mov	dx, [auxnum]	; ah=function code
  9439                                  					; 0=init, 1=send, 2=receive, 3=status
  9440                                  					; get port number
  9441 00000360 CD14                    		int	14h		; SERIAL I/O - GET USART STATUS
  9442                                  					; DX = port number (0-3)
  9443                                  					; Return: AX = port status code
  9444 00000362 C3                      		retn
  9445                                  
  9446                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9447                                  
  9448                                  ;************************************************************************
  9449                                  ;*									*
  9450                                  ;*	aux_flsh - flush aux input buffer - set contents of		*
  9451                                  ;*		   auxbuf [auxnum] to zero				*
  9452                                  ;*									*
  9453                                  ;*	cas - shouldn't this code call the rom bios input function	*
  9454                                  ;*	      repeatedly until it isn't ready?  to flush out any	*
  9455                                  ;*	      pending serial input queue if there's a tsr like MODE	*
  9456                                  ;*	      which is providing interrupt-buffering of aux port?	*
  9457                                  ;*									*
  9458                                  ;************************************************************************
  9459                                  
  9460                                  aux_flsh:				; 2C7h:36Ch = 70h:28DCh
  9461 00000363 E81C00                  		call	getbx		; flush	aux input buffer
  9462 00000366 C60700                  		mov	byte [bx], 0	; get bx to point to auxbuf
  9463                                  					; zero out buffer
  9464                                  		;clc			; all done, successful return
  9465                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9466                                  		; cf=0 ('add' instruction in 'getbx')
  9467 00000369 C3                      		retn
  9468                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9469                                  
  9470                                  ;************************************************************************
  9471                                  ;*									*
  9472                                  ;*	aux_writ - write to aux device					*
  9473                                  ;*									*
  9474                                  ;************************************************************************
  9475                                  
  9476                                  aux_writ:				; 2C7h:374h = 70h:28E4h
  9477                                  		;jcxz	short exvec2	; write	to aux device (if cx > 0)
  9478 0000036A E3AD                    		jcxz	exvec2		; 19/10/2022
  9479                                  aux_loop:				
  9480 0000036C 268A05                  		mov	al, [es:di]	; get character	to be written
  9481                                  					; move di pointer to next character
  9482 0000036F 47                      		inc	di
  9483 00000370 B401                    		mov	ah, 1		; auxfunc_send - indicates a write
  9484 00000372 E8E7FF                  		call	auxop		; send character over aux port
  9485 00000375 F6C480                  		test	ah, 80h		; check	for error
  9486 00000378 7405                    		jz	short awok	; then no error
  9487 0000037A B00A                    		mov	al, 10		; else indicate	write fault
  9488 0000037C E958FD                  		jmp	bc_err_cnt	; call error routines
  9489                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9490                                  
  9491                                  awok:					
  9492 0000037F E2EB                    		loop	aux_loop	; if cx	is non-zero,
  9493                                  					; still	more character to print
  9494                                  		;clc			; all done, successful return
  9495                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9496                                  		; cf=0 (test instruction above)	
  9497 00000381 C3                      		retn
  9498                                  
  9499                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9500                                  
  9501                                  ;************************************************************************
  9502                                  ;*									*
  9503                                  ;*	getbx - return bx -> single byte input buffer for		*
  9504                                  ;*		selected aux port ([auxnum])				*
  9505                                  ;*									*
  9506                                  ;************************************************************************
  9507                                  
  9508                                  getbx:	
  9509 00000382 8B1E[2100]              		mov	bx, [auxnum]	; return bx -> single byte input buffer
  9510                                  					; for selected aux port	([auxnum])
  9511                                  		;add	bx, offset auxbuf
  9512 00000386 81C3[1600]              		add	bx, auxbuf	; 19/10/2022
  9513                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9514                                  		; cf=0 (if [uaxnum] is valid number) 
  9515 0000038A C3                      		retn
  9516                                  
  9517                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9518                                  
  9519                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9520                                  
  9521                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
  9522                                  ;								:
  9523                                  ;		    clock device driver 			:
  9524                                  ;								:
  9525                                  ;								:
  9526                                  ;   this file contains the clock device driver. 		:
  9527                                  ;								:
  9528                                  ;   the routines in this files are:				:
  9529                                  ;								:
  9530                                  ;	routine 		function			:
  9531                                  ;	------- 		--------			:
  9532                                  ;	tim_writ		set the current time		:
  9533                                  ;	tim_read		read the current time		:
  9534                                  ;	time_to_ticks		convert time to corresponding	:
  9535                                  ;				  number of clock ticks 	:
  9536                                  ;								:
  9537                                  ; the clock ticks at the rate of:				:
  9538                                  ;								:
  9539                                  ;	1193180/65536 ticks/second (about 18.2 ticks per second):
  9540                                  ; see each routine for information on the use.			:
  9541                                  ;								:
  9542                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
  9543                                  
  9544                                  ; convert time to ticks
  9545                                  ; input : time in cx and dx
  9546                                  ; ticks returned in cx:dx
  9547                                  
  9548                                  ;19/07/2019
  9549                                  ;09/03/2019
  9550                                  
  9551                                  time_to_ticks:				; 0070h:2906h =	02C7h:0396h
  9552                                  
  9553                                  ; first convert from hour,min,sec,hund. to
  9554                                  ; total number of 100th of seconds
  9555                                  
  9556 0000038B B03C                    		mov	al, 60
  9557 0000038D F6E5                    		mul	ch		; hours	to minutes
  9558 0000038F B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  9559 00000391 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; total	minutes
  9560 00000393 B97017                  		mov	cx, 6000	; 60*100
  9561 00000396 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; get out of the way of	the multiply
  9562 00000398 F7E1                    		mul	cx		; convert to 1/100 sec
  9563 0000039A 89C1                    		mov	cx, ax
  9564 0000039C B064                    		mov	al, 100
  9565 0000039E F6E7                    		mul	bh		; convert seconds to 1/100 sec
  9566 000003A0 01C1                    		add	cx, ax		; combine seconds with hours and min
  9567 000003A2 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0		; ripple carry
  9568 000003A5 B700                    		mov	bh, 0
  9569 000003A7 01D9                    		add	cx, bx		; combine 1/100	sec
  9570 000003A9 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  9571                                  
  9572                                  	; dx:cx is time in 1/100 sec
  9573                                  
  9574 000003AC 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9575 000003AD 91                      		xchg	ax, cx		; now time is in cx:ax
  9576 000003AE BB0BE9                  		mov	bx, 59659
  9577 000003B1 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply low half
  9578 000003B3 87D1                    		xchg	dx, cx
  9579 000003B5 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; cx->ax, ax->dx, dx->cx
  9580 000003B6 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply high	half
  9581 000003B8 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; combine overlapping products
  9582 000003BA 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  9583 000003BD 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; ax:dx=time*59659
  9584 000003BE BB0500                  		mov	bx, 5
  9585 000003C1 F6F3                    		div	bl		; divide high half by 5
  9586 000003C3 88C1                    		mov	cl, al
  9587 000003C5 B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  9588 000003C7 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; remainder of divide-by-5
  9589 000003C9 98                      		cbw
  9590 000003CA 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; use it to extend low half
  9591 000003CB F7F3                    		div	bx		; divide low half by 5
  9592 000003CD 89C2                    		mov	dx, ax		; cx:dx	is now number of ticks in time
  9593 000003CF CB                      		retf			; far return
  9594                                  
  9595                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9596                                  
  9597                                  ; 17/10/2022
  9598                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9599                                  
  9600                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  9601                                  ;
  9602                                  ; tim_writ sets the current time
  9603                                  ;
  9604                                  ; on entry es:[di] has the current time:
  9605                                  ;
  9606                                  ;	number of days since 1-1-80	(word)
  9607                                  ;	minutes (0-59)			(byte)
  9608                                  ;	hours (0-23)			(byte)
  9609                                  ;	hundredths of seconds (0-99)	(byte)
  9610                                  ;	seconds (0-59)			(byte)
  9611                                  ;
  9612                                  ; each number has been checked for the correct range.
  9613                                  ;
  9614                                  ;	NOTE: Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9615                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9616                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9617                                  ;
  9618                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  9619                                  
  9620                                  tim_writ:				; 2C7h:3DBh = 70h:294Bh
  9621 000003D0 268B05                  		mov	ax, [es:di]
  9622 000003D3 50                      		push	ax		; daycnt. we need to set this at the very
  9623                                  					; end to avoid tick windows.
  9624 000003D4 803E[F304]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  9625                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  9626 000003D9 7426                    		jz	short no_cmos_1
  9627 000003DB 268A4503                		mov	al, [es:di+3]	; near indirect	calls
  9628                                  					; get binary hours
  9629                                  					; convert to bcd
  9630 000003DF FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  9631                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd	; call far [bintobcd]
  9632 000003E3 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch = bcd hours
  9633 000003E5 268A4502                		mov	al, [es:di+2]	; get binary minutes
  9634 000003E9 FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  9635                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd	; convert to bcd
  9636 000003ED 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; cl = bcd minutes
  9637 000003EF 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; get binary seconds
  9638 000003F3 FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  9639                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd
  9640 000003F7 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; dh = bcd seconds
  9641 000003F9 B200                    		mov	dl, 0		; dl = 0 (st) or 1 (dst)
  9642 000003FB FA                      		cli
  9643 000003FC B403                    		mov	ah, 3
  9644 000003FE CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  9645                                  					; CH = hours in	BCD, CL	= minutes in BCD
  9646                                  					;  DH =	seconds	in BCD,DL = 01h	if daylight savings, 00h if standard time
  9647                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  9648 00000400 FB                      		sti
  9649                                  no_cmos_1:				
  9650 00000401 268B4D02                		mov	cx, [es:di+2]
  9651 00000405 268B5504                		mov	dx, [es:di+4]
  9652                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9653 00000409 FF1E[E206]              		call	far [ttticks]
  9654                                  		;call	dword ptr ds:ttticks ; call far	[ttticks]
  9655                                  					; convert time to ticks
  9656                                  					; cx:dx	now has	time in	ticks
  9657 0000040D FA                      		cli			; turn off timer
  9658 0000040E B401                    		mov	ah, 1
  9659 00000410 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET TIME OF DAY
  9660                                  					; CX:DX	= clock	count
  9661                                  					; Return: time of day set
  9662                                  		;pop	ds:daycnt
  9663 00000412 8F06[F004]              		pop	word [daycnt]
  9664 00000416 FB                      		sti
  9665                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  9666 00000417 803E[F304]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  9667 0000041C 740A                    		jz	short no_cmos_2
  9668 0000041E FF1E[0605]              		call	far [daycnttoday]
  9669                                  		;call	ds:daycnttoday	; call far [daycnttoday]
  9670                                  					; convert to bcd format
  9671 00000422 FA                      		cli
  9672 00000423 B405                    		mov	ah, 5
  9673 00000425 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET DATE IN REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  9674                                  					; DL = day in BCD, DH =	month in BCD, CL = year	in BCD
  9675                                  					; CH = century (19h or 20h)
  9676                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  9677 00000427 FB                      		sti
  9678                                  no_cmos_2:
  9679                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9680                                  		; cf=0				
  9681                                  		;clc
  9682 00000428 C3                      		retn
  9683                                  
  9684                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9685                                  
  9686                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9687                                  
  9688                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9689                                  ; gettime reads date and time
  9690                                  ; and returns the following information:
  9691                                  ;
  9692                                  ;	es:[di]  =count of days since 1-1-80
  9693                                  ;	es:[di+2]=hours
  9694                                  ;	es:[di+3]=minutes
  9695                                  ;	es:[di+4]=seconds
  9696                                  ;	es:[di+5]=hundredths of seconds
  9697                                  ;
  9698                                  ;	NOTE:  Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9699                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9700                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9701                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9702                                  
  9703                                  tim_read:				; 2C7h:435h = 70h:29A5h
  9704 00000429 E84E00                  		call	GetTickCnt
  9705 0000042C 8B36[F004]              		mov	si, [daycnt]
  9706                                  
  9707                                  ; we now need to convert the time in tick to the time in 100th of
  9708                                  ; seconds. the relation between tick and seconds is:
  9709                                  ;
  9710                                  ;		 65,536 seconds
  9711                                  ;	       ----------------
  9712                                  ;		1,193,180 tick
  9713                                  ;
  9714                                  ; to get to 100th of second we need to multiply by 100. the equation is:
  9715                                  ;
  9716                                  ;	ticks from clock  * 65,536 * 100
  9717                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9718                                  ;		1,193,180
  9719                                  ;
  9720                                  ; fortunately this formula simplifies to:
  9721                                  ;
  9722                                  ;	ticks from clock * 5 * 65,536
  9723                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9724                                  ;		59,659
  9725                                  ;
  9726                                  ; the calculation is done by first multipling tick by 5. next we divide by
  9727                                  ; 59,659. in this division we multiply by 65,536 by shifting the dividend
  9728                                  ; my 16 bits to the left.
  9729                                  ;
  9730                                  ; start with ticks in cx:dx
  9731                                  ; multiply by 5
  9732                                  
  9733 00000430 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
  9734 00000432 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; start	with ticks in cx:dx
  9735                                  					; multiply by 5
  9736 00000434 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9737 00000436 D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	2
  9738 00000438 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9739 0000043A D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	4
  9740 0000043C 01DA                    		add	dx, bx
  9741 0000043E 11C8                    		adc	ax, cx		; times	5
  9742 00000440 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9743                                  
  9744                                  ; now have ticks * 5 in	dx:ax
  9745                                  ; we now need to multiply by 65536 and divide by 59659 d.
  9746                                  
  9747 00000441 B90BE9                  		mov	cx, 59659	; get divisor
  9748 00000444 F7F1                    		div	cx		; dx now has remainder
  9749                                  					; ax has high word of final quotient
  9750 00000446 89C3                    		mov	bx, ax		; put high word	in safe	place
  9751 00000448 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; this is the multiply by 65536
  9752 0000044A F7F1                    		div	cx		; bx:ax	now has	time in	100th of seconds
  9753                                  
  9754                                  ; rounding based on the	remainder may be added here
  9755                                  ; the result in	bx:ax is time in 1/100 second.
  9756                                  
  9757 0000044C 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		
  9758 0000044E B9C800                  		mov	cx, 200		;extract 1/100's
  9759                                  
  9760                                  ; division by 200 is necessary to ensure no overflow--max result
  9761                                  ; is number of seconds in a day/2 = 43200.
  9762                                  
  9763 00000451 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9764 00000453 80FA64                  		cmp	dl, 100		; remainder over 100?
  9765 00000456 7203                    		jb	short noadj
  9766 00000458 80EA64                  		sub	dl, 100		; keep 1/100's less than 100
  9767                                  noadj:					
  9768 0000045B F5                      		cmc			; if we	subtracted 100,	carry is now set
  9769 0000045C 88D3                    		mov	bl, dl		; save 1/100's
  9770                                  
  9771                                  ; to compensate	for dividing by	200 instead of 100, we now multiply
  9772                                  ; by two, shifting a one in if the remainder had exceeded 100.
  9773                                  
  9774 0000045E D1D0                    		rcl	ax, 1		
  9775 00000460 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  9776 00000462 D1D2                    		rcl	dx, 1
  9777 00000464 B93C00                  		mov	cx, 60		; divide out seconds
  9778 00000467 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9779 00000469 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; save the seconds
  9780 0000046B F6F1                    		div	cl		; break	into hours and minutes
  9781 0000046D 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah
  9782                                  
  9783                                  ; time is now in ax:bx (hours, minutes, seconds, 1/100 sec)
  9784                                  
  9785 0000046F 50                      		push	ax
  9786 00000470 89F0                    		mov	ax, si		; daycnt
  9787 00000472 AB                      		stosw
  9788 00000473 58                      		pop	ax
  9789 00000474 AB                      		stosw
  9790 00000475 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  9791 00000477 AB                      		stosw
  9792 00000478 F8                      		clc
  9793 00000479 C3                      		retn
  9794                                  
  9795                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9796                                  
  9797                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9798                                  
  9799                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9800                                  ;
  9801                                  ; procedure : GetTickCnt
  9802                                  ;
  9803                                  ;		Returns the tick count in CX:DX. Takes care of DayCnt in case
  9804                                  ;		of rollover [except when power management driver is in use]. 
  9805                                  ;		Uses the following logic for updating Daycnt
  9806                                  ;
  9807                                  ;		if ( rollover ) {
  9808                                  ;			if ( t_switch )
  9809                                  ;				daycnt++ ;
  9810                                  ;			else
  9811                                  ;				daycnt += rollover ;
  9812                                  ;		}
  9813                                  ;
  9814                                  ; USES : AX
  9815                                  ;
  9816                                  ; RETURNS : CX:DX - tick count
  9817                                  ; MODIFIES : daycnt
  9818                                  ;
  9819                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9820                                  
  9821                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9822                                  GetTickCnt:	
  9823 0000047A 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  9824 0000047C CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- GET TIME OF DAY
  9825                                  					; Return: CX:DX	= clock	count
  9826                                  					; AL = 00h if clock was	read or	written	(via AH=0,1) since the previous
  9827                                  					; midnight
  9828                                  					; Otherwise, AL	> 0
  9829 0000047E 803E[F204]00            		cmp	byte [t_switch], 0 ; use old method ? (>0 is yes)
  9830 00000483 7507                    		jnz	short inc_case	; old method assumes  that Int 1Ah returns rollover flag
  9831 00000485 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; new method assumes that Int 1Ah returns roll over count
  9832                                  					; and not flag
  9833 00000487 0106[F004]              		add	[daycnt], ax
  9834 0000048B C3                      		retn
  9835                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9836                                  
  9837                                  inc_case:				
  9838 0000048C 08C0                    		or	al, al
  9839 0000048E 7404                    		jz	short no_rollover
  9840 00000490 FF06[F004]              		inc	word [daycnt]
  9841                                  no_rollover:				
  9842 00000494 C3                      		retn
  9843                                  
  9844                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9845                                  ; MSDISK.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991

  9871                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9872                                  ;	disk interface routines
  9873                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9874                                  
  9875                                  ; device attribute bits:
  9876                                  ;	bit 6 - get/set map for logical drives and generic ioctl.
  9877                                  
  9878                                  ;MAXERR		equ	5
  9879                                  ;MAX_HD_FMT_ERR	equ	2
  9880                                  
  9881                                  ;LSTDRV	equ 504h
  9882                                  
  9883                                  ; some floppies do not have changeline. as a result, media-check would
  9884                                  ; normally return i-don't-know, the dos would continually reread the fat and
  9885                                  ; discard cached data. we optimize this by implementing a logical door-latch:
  9886                                  ; it is physically impossible to change a disk in under 2 seconds. we retain
  9887                                  ; the time of the last successful disk operation and compare it with the current
  9888                                  ; time during media-check. if < 2 seconds and at least 1 timer tick has passed,
  9889                                  ; the we say no change. if > 2 seconds then we say i-don't-know. finally, 
  9890                                  ; since we cannot trust the timer to be always available, we record the number 
  9891                                  ; of media checks that have occurred when no apparent time has elapsed. while
  9892                                  ; this number is < a given threshold, we say no change. when it exceeds that
  9893                                  ; threshold, we say i-don't-know and reset the counter to 0. when we store 
  9894                                  ; the time of last successful access, if we see that time has passed too,
  9895                                  ; we reset the counter.
  9896                                  
  9897                                  accessmax	equ	5
  9898                                  
  9899                                  ; due to various bogosities, we need to continually adjust what the head
  9900                                  ; settle time is.  the following algorithm is used:
  9901                                  ;
  9902                                  ;   get the current head settle value.
  9903                                  ;   if it is 0, then
  9904                                  ;	set slow = 15
  9905                                  ;   else
  9906                                  ;	set slow = value
  9907                                  ;   ...
  9908                                  ;*********************************************
  9909                                  ;************ old algorithm ******************
  9910                                  ;*   if we are seeking and writing then
  9911                                  ;*	 use slow
  9912                                  ;*   else
  9913                                  ;*	 use fast
  9914                                  ;*********************************************
  9915                                  ;*********** ibm's requested logic ***********
  9916                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing and not on an at then
  9917                                  ;	use slow
  9918                                  ;   else
  9919                                  ;	use fast
  9920                                  ;   ...
  9921                                  ;   restore current head settle value
  9922                                  ;
  9923                                  ;
  9924                                  ;---------------------------------------
  9925                                  multrk_on	equ	10000000b	;user spcified mutitrack=on, or system turns
  9926                                  					; it on after handling config.sys file as a
  9927                                  					; default value, if multrk_flag = multrk_off1.
  9928                                  multrk_off1	equ	00000000b	;initial value. no "multitrack=" command entered.
  9929                                  multrk_off2	equ	00000001b	;user specified multitrack=off.
  9930                                  
  9931                                  ; close data segment, open Bios_Code segment
  9932                                  
  9933                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9934                                  
  9935                                  ; BIOSCODE:04A2h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
  9936                                  
  9937                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9938                                  ;	command jump table
  9939                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9940                                  
  9941 00000495 00                      		db 0
  9942

  9944                                  %if 0
  9945                                  
  9946                                  dsktbl:		db 26			; 2C7h:4A2h = 70h:2A12h
  9947                                  					; ((dtbl_siz-1)/2) ; this is the size of the table ; 26
  9948                                  		dw 1742h		; dsk_init
  9949                                  		dw 4EBh			; media_chk
  9950                                  		dw 592h			; get_bpb
  9951                                  		dw 0D5h			; bc_cmderr
  9952                                  		dw 857h			; dsk_read
  9953                                  		dw 83Dh			; x_bus_exit
  9954                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9955                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9956                                  		dw 849h			; dsk_writ
  9957                                  		dw 841h			; dsk_writv
  9958                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9959                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9960                                  		dw 0D5h			; bc_cmderr
  9961                                  		dw 80Ah			; dsk_open
  9962                                  		dw 81Ah			; dsk_close
  9963                                  		dw 831h			; dsk_rem
  9964                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9965                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9966                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9967                                  		dw 0C6Bh		; do_generic_ioctl
  9968                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9969                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9970                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9971                                  		dw 1124h		; ioctl_getown
  9972                                  		dw 1142h		; ioctl_setown
  9973                                  		dw 129Ah		; ioctl_support_query
  9974                                  
  9975                                  ;dtbl_siz equ $-dsktbl
  9976                                  
  9977                                  %endif
  9978                                  		; 11/12/2022
  9979 00000496 1A                      dsktbl:		db (dtbl_siz-1)/2	; 26 ; this is the size of the table
  9980 00000497 [C316]                  		dw dsk_init
  9981 00000499 [DF04]                  		dw media_chk
  9982 0000049B [8505]                  		dw get_bpb
  9983 0000049D [D500]                  		dw bc_cmderr
  9984 0000049F [3508]                  		dw dsk_read
  9985 000004A1 [1B08]                  		dw x_bus_exit
  9986 000004A3 [4B05]                  		dw ret_carry_clear
  9987 000004A5 [4B05]                  		dw ret_carry_clear

  9990 000004AB [4B05]                  		dw ret_carry_clear
  9991 000004AD [4B05]                  		dw ret_carry_clear

  9997 000004B9 [4B05]                  		dw ret_carry_clear

 10009                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10010                                  
 10011                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10012                                  ; setdrive scans through the data structure of bdss, and returns a pointer to
 10013                                  ; the one that belongs to the drive specified. carry is set if none exists
 10014                                  ; for the drive. Pointer is returned in es:[di]
 10015                                  ;
 10016                                  ;  AL contains the logical drive number.
 10017                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10018                                  
 10019                                  SetDrive:	
 10020                                  		;les	di, ds:start_bds ; Point es:di to first bds	
 10021 000004CB C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; 19/10/2022
 10022                                  X_Scan_Loop:				
 10023 000004CF 26384505                		cmp	[es:di+5], al	
 10024 000004D3 7409                    		jz	short X_SetDrv
 10025 000004D5 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link] ; Go	to next	bds
 10026 000004D8 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 10027 000004DB 75F2                    		jnz	short X_Scan_Loop
 10028 000004DD F9                      		stc
 10029                                  X_SetDrv:				
 10030 000004DE C3                      		retn
 10031                                  
 10032                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10033                                  
 10034                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10035                                  
 10036                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 10037                                  ; if id is f9, have a 96tpi disk else
 10038                                  ; if bit 2 is 0 then media is not removable and could not have changed
 10039                                  ;  otherwise if within 2 secs of last disk operation media could not
 10040                                  ;    have changed, otherwise dont know if media has changed
 10041                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 10042                                  
 10043                                  media_chk:				; 2C7h:4EBh = 70h:2A5Bh
 10044 000004DF E8E9FF                  		call	SetDrive
 10045 000004E2 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1
 10046 000004E5 26F6452401              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
 10047                                  					; fchanged_by_format
 10048 000004EA 7416                    		jz	short WeAreNotFakingIt
 10049                                  		; 12/12/2022
 10050 000004EC 26806524FE              		and	byte [es:di+24h], 0FEh ; ~fchanged_by_format
 10051                                  		;and	word [es:di+23h], 0FEFFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10052                                  					; ~fchanged_by_format ;	reset flag
 10053 000004F1 C606[1E01]FF            		mov	byte [tim_drv], 0FFh ; -1
 10054                                  					; Ensure that we ask the rom if media has changed
 10055 000004F6 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10056                                  					; fnon_removable
 10057 000004FB 740C                    		jz	short wehaveafloppy
 10058 000004FD BEFFFF                  		mov	si, 0FFFFh	; Indicate media changed
 10059 00000500 EB2C                    		jmp	short Media_Done ; Media_Done
 10060                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10061                                  
 10062                                  WeAreNotFakingIt:
 10063                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], fnon_removable			
 10064 00000502 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 10065 00000507 7525                    		jnz	short Media_Done
 10066                                  wehaveafloppy:				
 10067 00000509 31F6                    		xor	si, si		; Presume "I don't know"
 10068                                  
 10069                                  		; If we have a floppy with changeline support, we ask the ROM
 10070                                  		; to determine if media has changed. We do not perform the
 10071                                  		; 2 second check for these drives.
 10072                                  
 10073 0000050B 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; Do we	have changeline	support?
 10074 00000510 740A                    		jz	short mChk_NoChangeLine	; Brif not
 10075 00000512 E87912                  		call	mediacheck	;  Call	into removable routine
 10076 00000515 7236                    		jb	short err_exitj
 10077 00000517 E8C913                  		call	haschange
 10078 0000051A 7512                    		jnz	short Media_Done
 10079                                  mChk_NoChangeLine:
 10080                                  		; If we come here, we have a floppy with no changeline support
 10081                                  			
 10082 0000051C BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; Presume no change
 10083 0000051F A0[1E01]                		mov	al, [tim_drv]	; Last drive accessed
 10084 00000522 263A4504                		cmp	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10085                                  					; Is drive of last access the same?
 10086 00000526 7505                    		jnz	short Media_Unk	; No, then "i don't know"
 10087 00000528 E82800                  		call	Check_Time_Of_Access
 10088 0000052B EB01                    		jmp	short Media_Done
 10089                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10090                                  
 10091                                  Media_Unk:				
 10092 0000052D 4E                      		dec	si		; ; Return "I don't know"
 10093                                  
 10094                                  		; SI now contains the correct value for media change.
 10095                                  		; Clean up the left overs
 10096                                  Media_Done:	
 10097                                  		; 19/10/2022			
 10098 0000052E 06                      		push	es
 10099 0000052F C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]
 10100 00000533 2689770E                		mov	[es:bx+0Eh], si	; [es:bx+trans]
 10101 00000537 07                      		pop	es
 10102 00000538 09F6                    		or	si, si
 10103 0000053A 790F                    		jns	short ret_carry_clear ;	volidok
 10104 0000053C 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 10105 00000541 7403                    		jz	short mChk1_NoChangeLine ; Brif	no changeline support
 10106 00000543 E82F13                  		call	media_set_vid
 10107                                  mChk1_NoChangeLine:			
 10108 00000546 C606[1E01]FF            		mov	byte [tim_drv], 0FFh ; -1
 10109                                  					; Make sure we ask rom for media check
 10110                                  ret_carry_clear:			
 10111 0000054B F8                      		clc			; volidok
 10112 0000054C C3                      		retn
 10113                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10114                                  
 10115                                  err_exitj:				
 10116 0000054D E87D06                  		call	maperror	; guaranteed to	set carry
 10117                                  ret81:					
 10118 00000550 B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; return error status
 10119 00000552 C3                      		retn			; return with carry set
 10120                                  
 10121                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10122                                  
 10123                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10124                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
 10125                                  ; drive.
 10126                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
 10127                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
 10128                                  ; returns in si:
 10129                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
 10130                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
 10131                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
 10132                                  ;
 10133                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data
 10134                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10135                                  
 10136                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10137                                  Check_Time_Of_Access:
 10138 00000553 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; presume no change.
 10139 00000556 E821FF                  		call	GetTickCnt	; cx:dx	is the elapsed time
 10140 00000559 268B4547                		mov	ax, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
 10141                                  					; get stored time
 10142 0000055D 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
 10143 0000055F 268B4549                		mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
 10144 00000563 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
 10145 00000565 751A                    		jnz	short timecheck_unk ; cx<>0 => >1 hour
 10146 00000567 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass
 10147 00000569 7511                    		jnz	short timepassed ; yes, examine max value
 10148 0000056B FE06[1D01]              		inc	byte [accesscount]
 10149 0000056F 803E[1D01]05            		cmp	byte [accesscount], 5 
 10150                                  					; if count is less than threshold, ok
 10151 00000574 720C                    		jb	short timecheck_ret
 10152 00000576 FE0E[1D01]              		dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap
 10153 0000057A EB05                    		jmp	short timecheck_unk ; "i don't know" if media changed
 10154                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10155                                  
 10156                                  timepassed:				
 10157 0000057C 83FA24                  		cmp	dx, 36		; 18*2 ; 18.2 tics per second.
 10158                                  					; min elapsed time? (2 seconds)
 10159 0000057F 7601                    		jbe	short timecheck_ret ; yes, presume no change
 10160                                  
 10161                                  		; everything indicates that we do not know what has happened.
 10162                                  timecheck_unk:				
 10163 00000581 4E                      		dec	si		; presume i don't know
 10164                                  timecheck_ret:				
 10165 00000582 C3                      		retn
 10166                                  
 10167                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10168                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10169                                  Err_Exitj2:
 10170 00000583 EBC8                    		jmp	short err_exitj
 10171                                  
 10172                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10173                                  
 10174                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10175                                  
 10176                                  ; ==========================================================================
 10177                                  ; Build a valid bpb for the disk in the drive.
 10178                                  ; ==========================================================================
 10179                                  
 10180                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10181                                  get_bpb:				; 2C7h:592h = 70h:2B02h
 10182 00000585 268A25                  		mov	ah, [es:di]	; get fat id byte read by dos
 10183 00000588 E840FF                  		call	SetDrive	; get the correct bds for the drive
 10184 0000058B 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10185                                  					; fnon_removable
 10186 00000590 7523                    		jnz	short already_gotbpb ; no need to build	for fixed disks
 10187                                  
 10188                                  		; let's set the default value for volid,vol_serial,
 10189                                  		; filesys_id in bds table
 10190                                  
 10191 00000592 E83700                  		call	clear_ids
 10192                                  		;mov	ds:set_id_flag,	1 ; indicate to	set system id in bds
 10193 00000595 C606[0A05]01            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 1
 10194 0000059A E85B00                  		call	GetBp		; build	a bpb if necessary
 10195 0000059D 72B1                    		jb	short ret81
 10196                                  		;cmp	ds:set_id_flag,	2 ; already, volume_label set from boot
 10197 0000059F 803E[0A05]02            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 2
 10198                                  		;mov	ds:set_id_flag,	0 ; record to bds table?
 10199 000005A4 C606[0A05]00            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 0
 10200 000005A9 740A                    		jz	short already_gotbpb ; do not set it again from	root dir
 10201                                  					; otherwise, conventional boot record
 10202                                  		;cmp	ds:fhave96, 0	; do we	have changeline	support?
 10203 000005AB 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 10204 000005B0 7403                    		jz	short already_gotbpb ; brif not
 10205 000005B2 E83413                  		call	set_volume_id
 10206                                  already_gotbpb:				
 10207 000005B5 83C706                  		add	di, 6		; BDS.BPB
 10208                                  					; return the bpb from the current bds
 10209                                  
 10210                                  ;		 fall into setptrsav, es:di -> result
 10211

 10216                                  ; ==========================================================================
 10217                                  ;Setptrsav is also jumped to from dsk_init (msbio2.asm). In both cases, the
 10218                                  ;pointer to be returned is in es:di. We were incorrectly returning ds:di.
 10219                                  ;Note that this works in most cases because most pointers are in Bios_Data.
 10220                                  ;It fails, for instance, when we install an external drive using driver.sys
 10221                                  ;because then the BDS segment is no longer Bios_Data. 
 10222                                  ;NB: It is fine to corrupt cx because this is not a return value and anyway
 10223                                  ;this returns to Chardev_entry (msbio1.asm) where all registers are 
 10224                                  ;restored before returning to the caller.
 10225                                  ; ==========================================================================
 10226                                  
 10227                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10228                                  SetPtrSav:	; return point for dsk_init				
 10229 000005B8 8CC1                    		mov	cx, es		; save es
 10230                                  		;les	bx, ds:ptrsav
 10231 000005BA C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]
 10232 000005BE 2688670D                		mov	[es:bx+0Dh], ah	; [es:bx+media]
 10233 000005C2 26897F12                		mov	[es:bx+12h], di	; [es:bx+count]
 10234 000005C6 26894F14                		mov	[es:bx+14h], cx	; [es:bx+count+2]
 10235 000005CA F8                      		clc
 10236 000005CB C3                      		retn

 10241                                  
 10242                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------
 10243                                  ; clear ids in bds table. only applied for floppies.
 10244                                  ;input:  es:di -> bds table
 10245                                  ;	assumes ds: -> Bios_Data
 10246                                  ;output: volid set to "NO NAME    "
 10247                                  ;	 vol_serial set to 0.
 10248                                  ;	 filesys_id set to "FAT12   " or "FAT16   "
 10249                                  ;	   depending on the flag fatsize in bds.
 10250                                  ;
 10251                                  ;	trashes si, cx
 10252                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------
 10253                                  
 10254                                  ;size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL equ 11
 10255                                  ;size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID equ 8
 10256                                  
 10257                                  clear_ids:
 10258                                  		; 11/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.1 IO.SYS (Optimization & BugFix)
 10259 000005CC 268A451F                		mov	al, [es:di+1Fh] ; mov al,[es:di+BDS.fatsiz]
 10260                                  clear_ids_x:	; 11/09/2023		
 10261                                   		; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:05D9h)
 10262 000005D0 57                      		push	di
 10263 000005D1 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx		; no serial number
 10264 000005D3 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
 10265 000005D7 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
 10266                                  
 10267                                  		; BUGBUG - there's a lot in common here and with
 10268                                  		; mov_media_ids.. see if we can save some space by
 10269                                  		; merging them... jgl
 10270                                  
 10271                                  		;mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10272                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10273 000005DB B10B                    		mov	cl, 11 ; cx = 11		
 10274                                  
 10275                                  		;mov	si, offset vol_no_name ; "NO NAME    "
 10276 000005DD BE[1D05]                		mov	si, vol_no_name	; 19/10/2022
 10277 000005E0 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 10278 000005E3 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10279                                  		
 10280                                  		; 11/09/2023 (BugFix, DI is not start addr of BDS structure here)
 10281                                  		;;test	byte [es:di+BDS.fatsiz], fbig
 10282                                  		; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:05EFh)
 10283                                  		;test	byte [es:di+1Fh], 40h
 10284                                  
 10285                                  			; ! NOTE - 11/08/2023 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS bugfix)
 10286                                  			; Microsoft/IBM code has a bug here because the BDS's
 10287                                  			; .volid and .filesys_id fields will be reset
 10288                                  			; (to their default text) according to 'BDS.fatsiz' flags
 10289                                  			; at the BDS offset 31 but current (this) code checks flags
 10290                                  			; at ES:DI+31 while DI points the BDS offset 86!?
 10291                                  			;
 10292                                  			; Correct Code:
 10293                                  			; ;test byte [ES:31],40h or [ES:BDS.fatsiz],fbig
 10294                                  			; 11/09/2023
 10295                                  			; (before 'rep movsb') 'mov al,[es:di+BDS.Fatsiz]' and then
 10296                                  			; (after 'rep movsb') 'test al,fbig' (AL is free/proper to use here)	
 10297                                  			;
 10298                                  			; Same BUG is existing in PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:06C3h
 10299                                  			; and in Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0E1Ah as 'test byte [es:di+59],20h'
 10300                                  			; (PCDOS 7.1 BUG note: 26/06/2023)
 10301                                  			;
 10302                                  			; (Why this bug did not affect MSDOS and PCDOS 7.x applications:
 10303                                  			; 'clear_ids' is used for floppy disks only and the default
 10304                                  			; option of 'clear_ids' is FAT12 volid and filesys_id text
 10305                                  			; when the flag bit has wrong value for FAT16/40h or FAT32/20h.)
 10306                                  
 10307 000005E5 A840                    		test	al, 40h ; * 
 10308                                  		
 10309                                  		;mov	si, offset fat_16_id ; "FAT16	"
 10310 000005E7 BE[1405]                		mov	si, fat_16_id	; 19/10/2022
 10311 000005EA 7503                    		jnz	short ci_bigfat

 10313 000005EC BE[0B05]                		mov	si, fat_12_id	 ; 19/10/2022

 10326                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10327                                  
 10328                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10329                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
 10330                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
 10331                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
 10332                                  ;	    for all other cases,
 10333                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
 10334                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
 10335                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
 10336                                  ;
 10337                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
 10338                                  ;
 10339                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
 10340                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
 10341                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
 10342                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
 10343                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
 10344                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
 10345                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
 10346                                  ;
 10347                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
 10348                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
 10349                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
 10350                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10351                                  
 10352                                  GetBp:		; if returning fake bpb then return bpb as is.
 10353                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], return_fake_bpb|fnon_removable

 10355 000005FD 7403                    		jz	short getbp1	; getbp1
 10356 000005FF E99A00                  		jmp	getret_exit
