 13134                                  
 13135                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13136                                  
 13137                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13138                                  ;	get media id
 13139                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13140                                  ;
 13141                                  ; FUNCTION: get the volume label,the system id and the serial number from
 13142                                  ;	    the media that has the extended boot record.
 13143                                  ;	    for the conventional media,this routine will return "unknown
 13144                                  ;	    media type" error to dos.
 13145                                  ;
 13146                                  ; INPUT :   ES:di -> bds table for this drive.
 13147                                  ;
 13148                                  ; OUTPUT:   the request packet filled with the information,if not carry.
 13149                                  ;	    if carry set,then al contains the device driver error number
 13150                                  ;	    that will be returned to dos.
 13151                                  ;	    register DS,DX,AX,CX,DI,SI destroyed.
 13152                                  ;
 13153                                  ; SUBROUTINES TO BE CALLED:
 13154                                  ;	BootIo:NEAR
 13155                                  ;
 13156                                  ; LOGIC:
 13157                                  ;	to recognize the extended boot record,this logic will actually
 13158                                  ;	access the boot sector even if it is a hard disk.
 13159                                  ;	note:the valid extended bpb is recognized by looking at the mediabyte
 13160                                  ;	field of bpb and the extended boot signature.
 13161                                  ;
 13162                                  ; {
 13163                                  ;	get logical drive number from bds table;
 13164                                  ;	rFlag = read operation;
 13165                                  ;	BootIo;		 /*get the media boot record into the buffer
 13166                                  ;	if (no error) then
 13167                                  ;	     if (extended boot record) then
 13168                                  ;		{ set volume label,volume serial number and system id
 13169                                  ;		  of the request packet to those of the boot record;
 13170                                  ;		};
 13171                                  ;	     else		  /*not an extended bpb */
 13172                                  ;		{ set register al to "unknown media.." error code;
 13173                                  ;		  set carry bit;
 13174                                  ;		};
 13175                                  ;	else
 13176                                  ;	     ret;	/*already error code is set in the register al
 13177                                  ;
 13178                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13179                                  
 13180                                  ;size_of_EXT_BOOT_SERIAL equ 4
 13181                                  ;;size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL equ 11
 13182                                  ;;size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID equ 8
 13183                                  
 13184                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13185                                  GetMediaId:
 13186 0000114A E89F00                  		call	ChangeLineChk
 13187 0000114D 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet] ; Logical drive number
 13188 00001151 C606[2001]02            		mov	byte [rflag], 2	; Read operation
 13189 00001156 E87B00                  		call	BootIo		; Read boot sector into	DiskSector
 13190 00001159 7224                    		jb	short IOCtl_If1
 13191                                  					; Valid? (0F0h-0FFh?)
 13192 0000115B 803E[6301]F0            		cmp	byte [disksector+15h], 0F0h
 13193                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 13194 00001160 721A                    		jb	short IOCtl_If2	; brif not valid (0F0h - 0FFh)
 13195                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13196 00001162 BE[7401]                		mov	si, disksector+26h
 13197 00001165 803C29                  		cmp	byte [si], 29h
 13198                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h ; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG]
 13199                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
 13200 00001168 7512                    		jnz	short IOCtl_If2	; not extended boot record
 13201 0000116A C43E[1200]              		les	di, [ptrsav]	; es:di	points to request header
 13202 0000116E 26C47F13                		les	di, [es:bx+19]	; [es:bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 13203                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13204 00001172 46                      		inc	si
 13205                                  		; si = disksector+27h 
 13206                                  		;mov	si, disksector+27h ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL
 13207 00001173 83C702                  		add	di, 2		; A_MEDIA_ID_INFO.MI_SERIAL
 13208 00001176 B91700                  		mov	cx, 23		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_SERIAL
 13209                                  					; L+size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 13210                                  					; +size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
 13211 00001179 F3A4                    		rep movsb		; Move from Bios_Data into request packet
 13212                                  	
 13213                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13214                                  		; cf = 0
 13215                                  		;clc
 13216                                  
 13217 0000117B C3                      		retn
 13218                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13219                                  
 13220                                  IOCtl_If2:				
 13221 0000117C B007                    		mov	al, 7		; error_unknown_media
 13222 0000117E F9                      		stc
 13223                                  IOCtl_If1:				
 13224 0000117F C3                      		retn
 13225                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13226                                  
 13227                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13228                                  
 13229                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13230                                  ;  set media id
 13231                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13232                                  
 13233                                  ; function: set the volume label, the system id and the serial number of
 13234                                  ;	    the media that has the extended boot record.
 13235                                  ;	    for the conventional media, this routine will return "unknown
 13236                                  ;	    media.." error to dos.
 13237                                  ;	    this routine will also set the corresponding informations in
 13238                                  ;	    the bds table.
 13239                                  ;
 13240                                  ; input :   ES:di -> bds table for this drive.
 13241                                  ;
 13242                                  ; output:   the extended boot record in the media will be set according to
 13243                                  ;	    the request packet.
 13244                                  ;	    if carry set, then al contains the device driver error number
 13245                                  ;	    that will be returned to dos.
 13246                                  ;
 13247                                  ; subroutines to be called:
 13248                                  ;	BootIo:NEAR
 13249                                  ;
 13250                                  ; logic:
 13251                                  ;
 13252                                  ; {
 13253                                  ;	get drive_number from bds;
 13254                                  ;	rFlag = "read operation";
 13255                                  ;	BootIo;
 13256                                  ;	if (no error) then
 13257                                  ;	     if (extended boot record) then
 13258                                  ;		{ set volume label,volume serial number and system id
 13259                                  ;		  of the boot record to those of the request packet;
 13260                                  ;		  rFlag = "write operation";
 13261                                  ;		  get drive number from bds;
 13262                                  ;		  BootIo;	  /*write it back*/
 13263                                  ;		};
 13264                                  ;	     else		  /*not an extended bpb */
 13265                                  ;		{ set register al to "unknown media.." error code;
 13266                                  ;		  set carry bit;
 13267                                  ;		  ret;	 /*return back to caller */
 13268                                  ;		};
 13269                                  ;	else
 13270                                  ;	     ret;		 /*already error code is set */
 13271                                  ;
 13272                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13273                                  
 13274                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13275                                  SetMediaId:
 13276 00001180 E86900                  		call	ChangeLineChk
 13277 00001183 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 13278                                  					; Logical drive	number
 13279 00001187 88C2                    		mov	dl, al
 13280 00001189 C606[2001]02            		mov	byte [rflag], 2	; romread
 13281 0000118E 52                      		push	dx
 13282 0000118F E84200                  		call	BootIo		; Read boot sec	to Bios_Data:DiskSector
 13283 00001192 5A                      		pop	dx
 13284 00001193 723E                    		jb	short IOCtl_If6
 13285                                  					; Valid? (0F0h-0FFh?)
 13286 00001195 803E[6301]F0            		cmp	byte [disksector+15h], 0F0h
 13287                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 13288 0000119A 7234                    		jb	short IOCtl_If7	; Brif not
 13289 0000119C 803E[7401]29            		cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h ; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG]
 13290                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
 13291 000011A1 752D                    		jnz	short IOCtl_If7	; not extended boot record
 13292 000011A3 06                      		push	es		; Save BDS pointer
 13293 000011A4 57                      		push	di
 13294 000011A5 1E                      		push	ds		; Point	ES To boot record
 13295 000011A6 07                      		pop	es
 13296 000011A7 BF[7501]                		mov	di, disksector+27h ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL
 13297 000011AA C536[1200]              		lds	si, [ptrsav]	; ds:si	points to request header.
 13298 000011AE C57413                  		lds	si, [si+19]	; [si+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 13299 000011B1 83C602                  		add	si, 2		; A_MEDIA_ID_INFO.MI_SERIAL
 13300 000011B4 B91700                  		mov	cx, 23		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_SERIAL
 13301                                  					; +size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 13302                                  					; +size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
 13303 000011B7 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13304 000011B9 06                      		push	es		; point	ds back	to Bios_Data
 13305 000011BA 1F                      		pop	ds
 13306 000011BB 5F                      		pop	di		; restore bds pointer
 13307 000011BC 07                      		pop	es
 13308 000011BD E876F5                  		call	mov_media_ids	; update the bds media id info.
 13309 000011C0 88D0                    		mov	al, dl
 13310 000011C2 C606[2001]03            		mov	byte [rflag], 3	; romwrite
 13311 000011C7 E80A00                  		call	BootIo		; write	it back.
 13312 000011CA C606[1E01]FF            		mov	byte [tim_drv], 0FFh
 13313                                  					; make sure chk_media check the driver
 13314                                  					; return with error code from BootIo
 13315 000011CF C3                      		retn
 13316                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13317                                  
 13318                                  IOCtl_If7:				
 13319 000011D0 B007                    		mov	al, 7		; error_unknown_media
 13320 000011D2 F9                      		stc
 13321                                  IOCtl_If6:				
 13322 000011D3 C3                      		retn
 13323                                  
 13324                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13325                                  
 13326                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13327                                  
 13328                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13329                                  ;	BootIo
 13330                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13331                                  ;
 13332                                  ; function: read/write the boot record into boot sector.
 13333                                  ;
 13334                                  ; input :
 13335                                  ;	    al=logical drive number
 13336                                  ;	    rFlag = operation (read/write)
 13337                                  ;
 13338                                  ; output:   for read operation,the boot record of the drive specified in bds
 13339                                  ;	    be read into the DiskSector buffer.
 13340                                  ;	    for write operation,the DiskSector buffer image will be written
 13341                                  ;	    to the drive specified in bds.
 13342                                  ;	    if carry set,then al contains the device driver error number
 13343                                  ;	    that will be returned to dos.
 13344                                  ;	    AX,CX,DX register destroyed.
 13345                                  ;	    if carry set,then al will contain the error code from DiskIO.
 13346                                  ;
 13347                                  ; subroutines to be called:
 13348                                  ;	DiskIO:NEAR
 13349                                  ;
 13350                                  ; logic:
 13351                                  ;
 13352                                  ; {
 13353                                  ;	first_sector = 0;	 /*logical sector 0 is the boot sector */
 13354                                  ;	sectorcount = 1;	 /*read 1 sector only */
 13355                                  ;	buffer = DiskSector;	 /*read it into the DiskSector buffer */
 13356                                  ;	call DiskIO (rFlag,drive_number,first_sector,sectorcount,buffer);
 13357                                  ; }
 13358                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13359                                  
 13360                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13361                                  BootIo:	
 13362 000011D4 06                      		push	es
 13363 000011D5 57                      		push	di
 13364 000011D6 53                      		push	bx
 13365 000011D7 1E                      		push	ds
 13366 000011D8 07                      		pop	es		; Point ES: to Bios_Data
 13367                                  
 13368                                  		; Call DiskIO to read/write the boot sec. The parameters which
 13369                                  		; need to be initialized for this subroutine out here are
 13370                                  		; - Transfer address to Bios_Data:DiskSector
 13371                                  		; - Low sector needs to be initalized to 0. this is a reg. param
 13372                                  		; - Hi sector in [Start_Sec_H] needs to be initialised to 0.
 13373                                  		; - Number of sectors <-- 1
 13374                                  
 13375 000011D9 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; es:di -> transfer address
 13376 000011DC 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx		; First	sector (h) -> 0
 13377 000011DE 8916[2B05]              		mov	[start_sec_h], dx ; Start sector (h) -> 0
 13378 000011E2 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1
 13379 000011E5 E8E0F6                  		call	diskio
 13380 000011E8 5B                      		pop	bx
 13381 000011E9 5F                      		pop	di
 13382 000011EA 07                      		pop	es
 13383 000011EB C3                      		retn
 13384                                  
 13385                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13386                                  
 13387                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13388                                  
 13389                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13390                                  ;	ChangeLineChk
 13391                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13392                                  ;
 13393                                  ; when the user calls get/set media id call before dos establishes the media
 13394                                  ; by calling "media_chk",the change line activity of the drive is going to be
 13395                                  ; lost.	this routine will check the change line activity and will save the
 13396                                  ; history in the flags.
 13397                                  ;
 13398                                  ; FUNCTION: check the change line error activity
 13399                                  ;
 13400                                  ; INPUT :  ES:di -> bds table.
 13401                                  ;
 13402                                  ; OUTPUT:   flag in bds table will be updated if change line occurs.
 13403                                  ;
 13404                                  ; SUBROUTINES TO BE CALLED:
 13405                                  ;	Set_Changed_DL
 13406                                  ;
 13407                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13408                                  
 13409                                  ChangeLineChk:	
 13410 000011EC 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13411 000011F0 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; Fixed	disk?
 13412 000011F2 7821                    		js	short ChangeLnChkRet ; Yes, skip it.
 13413                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13414 000011F4 26F6452304              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 4
 13415                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 4 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 13416                                  					; return_fake_bpb
 13417 000011F9 751A                    		jnz	short ChangeLnChkRet
 13418 000011FB 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1	; This rom support change line?
 13419 00001200 7513                    		jnz	short ChangeLnChkRet
 13420 00001202 E8DE06                  		call	haschange	; This drive support change line?
 13421 00001205 740E                    		jz	short ChangeLnChkRet ; Do nothing
 13422                                  
 13423                                  		; Execute the rom disk interrupt to check changeline activity.
 13424                                  
 13425 00001207 B416                    		mov	ah, 16h
 13426 00001209 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - FLOPPY	DISK - CHANGE OF DISK STATUS (AT,XT2,XT286,CONV,PS)
 13427                                  					; DL = drive to	check
 13428                                  					; Return: AH = disk change status
 13429 0000120B 7308                    		jnb	short ChangeLnChkRet
 13430 0000120D 53                      		push	bx
 13431 0000120E BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 13432                                  					; Update flag in BDS for this
 13433                                  					; physical drive
 13434 00001211 E8A806                  		call	set_changed_dl
 13435 00001214 5B                      		pop	bx
 13436                                  ChangeLnChkRet:				
 13437 00001215 C3                      		retn
 13438                                  
 13439                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13440                                  
 13441                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13442                                  
 13443                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13444                                  ;	GetAccessFlag
 13445                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13446                                  ;
 13447                                  ; FUNCTION: get the status of UNFORMATTED_MEDIA bit of flags in bds table
 13448                                  ;
 13449                                  ; INPUT :
 13450                                  ;	    ES:di -> bds table
 13451                                  ;
 13452                                  ; OUTPUT:   a_DiskAccess_Control.dac_access_flag = 0 if disk i/o not allowed.
 13453                                  ;						 = 1 if disk i/o allowed.
 13454                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13455                                  
 13456                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13457                                  GetAccessFlag:				
 13458 00001216 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; DS:BX	points to request header
 13459 0000121A C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; [bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 13460                                  		;mov	al, 0		; Assume result	is unformatted
 13461                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13462 0000121D 28C0                    		sub	al, al
 13463                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13464 0000121F 26F6452402              		test	byte [es:di+36], 02h
 13465                                  		;test	word [es:di+35], 200h ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 13466                                  					; unformatted_media
 13467 00001224 7502                    		jnz	short GafDone	; Done if unformatted
 13468 00001226 FEC0                    		inc	al		; Return true for formatted
 13469                                  
 13470                                  GafDone:				
 13471 00001228 884701                  		mov	[bx+1],	al	; [bx+A_DISKACCESS_CONTROL.DAC_ACCESS_FLAG]
 13472 0000122B C3                      		retn
 13473                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13474                                  
 13475                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13476                                  
 13477                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13478                                  ;	SetAccessFlag
 13479                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13480                                  ;
 13481                                  ; function: set/reset the UNFORMATTED_MEDIA bit of flags in bds table
 13482                                  ;
 13483                                  ; input :
 13484                                  ;	    ES:di -> bds table
 13485                                  ;
 13486                                  ; output:   unformtted_media bit modified according to the user request
 13487                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13488                                  
 13489                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13490                                  SetAccessFlag:				
 13491 0000122C C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; ES:BX	points to request header
 13492 00001230 C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; [bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 13493                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13494 00001233 26806524FD              		and	byte [es:di+36], 0FDh
 13495                                  		;and	word [es:di+35], 0FDFFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 13496                                  					; ~unformatted_media
 13497 00001238 807F0100                		cmp	byte [bx+1], 0	; [bx+A_DISKACCESS_CONTROL.DAC_ACCESS_FLAG]
 13498 0000123C 7505                    		jnz	short saf_Done
 13499                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13500 0000123E 26804D2402              		or	byte [es:di+36], 02h
 13501                                  		;or	word [es:di+35], 200h ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 13502                                  					; unformatted_media
 13503                                  saf_Done:				
 13504 00001243 C3                      		retn
 13505                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13506                                  
 13507                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13508                                  
 13509                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13510                                  ; Ioctl_Support_Query
 13511                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13512                                  ;
 13513                                  ; New device command which was added in DOS 5.00 to allow a query of a 
 13514                                  ; specific GENERIC IOCtl to see if it is supported. Bit 7 in the
 13515                                  ; device attributes specifies if this function is supported.
 13516                                  ;
 13517                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13518                                  
 13519                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13520                                  ioctl_support_query:
 13521 00001244 06                      		push	es
 13522 00001245 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]	; ES:BX Points to request header.
 13523 00001249 268B470D                		mov	ax, [es:bx+13]	; [es:bx+IOCTL_REQ.MAJORFUNCTION]
 13524                                  					; AL ==	Major, AH == Minor
 13525 0000124D 3C08                    		cmp	al, 8		; IOC_DC
 13526                                  					; See if major code is 8
 13527 0000124F 7513                    		jnz	short nosupport
 13528 00001251 0E                      		push	cs
 13529 00001252 07                      		pop	es
 13530 00001253 B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; IOC_DC_TABLE_LEN
 13531                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13532 00001256 BF[370C]                		mov	di, IOC_DC_Table
 13533                                  		;mov	di, 0C60h	; IOC_DC_Table
 13534                                  					; at 2C7h:0C60h	= 70h:31D0h
 13535 00001259 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah		; Put minor code in AL
 13536 0000125B F2AE                    		repne scasb		; Scan for minor code in AL
 13537 0000125D 7505                    		jnz	short nosupport	; it was not found
 13538 0000125F B80001                  		mov	ax, 100h
 13539                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13540                                  		; (jump to ioctlsupexit is not required)
 13541                                  		;jmp	short $+2	; ioctlsupexit
 13542                                  					; Signal ioctl is supported
 13543                                  		;;jmp	short ioctlsupexit
 13544                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13545                                  ioctlsupexit:				
 13546 00001262 07                      		pop	es
 13547                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13548                                  		; cf = 0
 13549                                  		;clc
 13550 00001263 C3                      		retn
 13551                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13552                                  nosupport:				
 13553 00001264 07                      		pop	es
 13554 00001265 E96DEE                  		jmp	bc_cmderr
 13555                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13556                                  
 13557                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13558                                  
 13559                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13560                                  ;	GetMediaSenseStatus
 13561                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13562                                  ;
 13563                                  ; FUNCTION: Will return the type of diskette media in the specified DOS
 13564                                  ;	    diskette drive and whether the media is the default type
 13565                                  ;	    for that drive. (default type means the max size for that
 13566                                  ;	    drive)
 13567                                  ;
 13568                                  ; INPUT :   ES:DI -> BDS table
 13569                                  ; OUTPUT:   If carry clear
 13570                                  ;	    DS:BX -> Updated IOCtlPacket
 13571                                  ;
 13572                                  ;			 Special Function at offset 0:
 13573                                  ;				0	- Media detected is not default type
 13574                                  ;				1	- Media detected is default type
 13575                                  ;
 13576                                  ;			 Device Type at offset 1:
 13577                                  ;				2       - 720K 3.5" 80 tracks
 13578                                  ;				7	- 1.44M 3.5" 80 tracks
 13579                                  ;				9	- 2.88M 3.5" 80 tracks
 13580                                  ;
 13581                                  ; Error Codes returned in AX if carry set:
 13582                                  ;
 13583                                  ; 8102 - Drive not ready	- No disk is in the drive.
 13584                                  ; 8107 - Unknown media type	- Drive doesn't support this function or
 13585                                  ;				  the media is really unkown, any error
 13586                                  ;				  other than "media not present"
 13587                                  ; 
 13588                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13589                                  
 13590                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13591                                  SenseMediaType:				
 13592 00001268 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; DS:BX	points to request header.
 13593 0000126C C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 13594                                  		; 10/10/2022
 13595                                  		;mov	word [bx], 0	; Initialize the 2 packet bytes
 13596 0000126F 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13597 00001271 8917                    		mov	[bx], dx ; 0
 13598                                  		;
 13599 00001273 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13600                                  					; Get int 13h drive number from	BDS
 13601                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13602                                  		;xor	dh, dh		; DX = physical	drive number
 13603 00001277 B420                    		mov	ah, 20h		; Get Media Type function
 13604                                  					; If no	carry media type in AL
 13605 00001279 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - QCACHE	- DISMOUNT
 13606 0000127B 7216                    		jb	short MediaSenseEr ; error code	in AH
 13607 0000127D FE07                    		inc	byte [bx]	; Signal media type is default (bit 1)
 13608                                  DetermineMediaType:			
 13609 0000127F FEC8                    		dec	al
 13610 00001281 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; Chk for 720K ie: (3-1) = 2
 13611 00001283 740A                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 13612 00001285 0404                    		add	al, 4
 13613 00001287 3C07                    		cmp	al, 7		; Chk for 1.44M ie: (4-1+4) = 7
 13614 00001289 7404                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 13615 0000128B 3C09                    		cmp	al, 9		; Chk for 2.88M	ie: (6-1+4) = 9
 13616 0000128D 7510                    		jnz	short UnknownMediaType ; Just didn't recognize media type
 13617                                  GotMediaType:				
 13618 0000128F 884701                  		mov	[bx+1],	al	; Save the return value
 13619                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13620                                  		; cf = 0
 13621                                  		;clc			; Signal success
 13622 00001292 C3                      		retn
 13623                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13624                                  
 13625                                  MediaSenseEr:				
 13626 00001293 80FC32                  		cmp	ah, 32h		; See if not default media error
 13627 00001296 74E7                    		jz	short DetermineMediaType ; Not really an error
 13628 00001298 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; Now assume drive not ready
 13629 0000129A 80FC31                  		cmp	ah, 31h		; See if media was present
 13630 0000129D 7402                    		jz	short SenseErrExit ; Return drive not ready
 13631                                  UnknownMediaType:			
 13632 0000129F B007                    		mov	al, 7		; Just don't know the media type
 13633                                  SenseErrExit:				
 13634 000012A1 B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; Signal error return
 13635 000012A3 F9                      		stc
 13636 000012A4 C3                      		retn
 13637                                  
 13638                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13639                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13640                                  		;db    0
 13641                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13642                                  
 13643                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13644                                  
 13645                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13646                                  ; MSINT13.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 13647                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13648                                  ; 16/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 13649                                  
 13650                                  ;	int 2f function 13h allows the user to change the orig13 int_13 vector
 13651                                  ;	after booting. this allows testing and implementation of custom int_13
 13652                                  ;	handlers, without giving up ms-dos error recovery
 13653                                  ;	entry:	ds:dx	== addr. of new int_13 handler
 13654                                  ;		es:bx	== addr. of new int_13 vector used by warm boot (int19)
 13655                                  ;	exit:	orig13	== address of new int_13 handler
 13656                                  ;		ds:dx	== old orig13 value
 13657                                  ;		es:bx	== old old13  value
 13658                                  ;
 13659                                  ; int 2f handler for external block drivers to communicate with the internal
 13660                                  ; block driver in msdisk. the multiplex number chosen is 8. the handler
 13661                                  ; sets up the pointer to the request packet in [ptrsav] and then jumps to
 13662                                  ; dsk_entry, the entry point for all disk requests.
 13663                                  ;
 13664                                  ; on exit from this driver, we will return to the external driver
 13665                                  ; that issued this int 2f, and can then remove the flags from the stack.
 13666                                  ; this scheme allows us to have a small external device driver, and makes
 13667                                  ; the maintainance of the various drivers (driver and msbio) much easier,
 13668                                  ; since we only need to make changes in one place (most of the time).
 13669                                  ;
 13670                                  ;   ax=800h - check for installed handler - reserved
 13671                                  ;   ax=801h - install the bds into the linked list
 13672                                  ;   ax=802h - dos request
 13673                                  ;   ax=803h - return bds table starting pointer in ds:di
 13674                                  ;	   (ems device driver hooks int 13h to handle 16kb dma overrun
 13675                                  ;	    problem. bds table is going to be used to get head/sector
 13676                                  ;	    informations without calling generic ioctl get device parm call.)
 13677                                  
 13678                                  ;BIOSSEGMENT equ 70h
 13679                                  DOSBIOSSEG equ 0070h ; 17/10/2022	
 13680                                  
 13681                                  ;;BIOSCODE:1302h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
 13682                                  
 13683                                  i2f_handler:				; here is 02C7h:1302h =	0070h:3872h
 13684 000012A5 80FC13                  		cmp	ah, 13h
 13685 000012A8 7413                    		jz	short int2f_replace_int13
 13686 000012AA 80FC08                  		cmp	ah, 8
 13687 000012AD 7431                    		jz	short mine
 13688                                  
 13689                                  ; Check for WIN386 startup and return the BIOS instance data
 13690                                  
 13691 000012AF 80FC16                  		cmp	ah, 16h		; MultWin386
 13692 000012B2 746C                    		jz	short win386call
 13693 000012B4 80FC4A                  		cmp	ah, 4Ah		; multMULT
 13694 000012B7 7503                    		jnz	short i2f_handler_iret
 13695 000012B9 E99700                  		jmp	handle_multmult
 13696                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13697                                  
 13698                                  i2f_handler_iret:			
 13699 000012BC CF                      		iret
 13700                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13701                                  
 13702                                  int2f_replace_int13:			
 13703 000012BD 50                      		push	ax	; free up a register for caller's ds
 13704 000012BE 8CD8                    		mov	ax, ds	; then we can use ds: -> Bios_Data
 13705                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h] ; 15/10/2022	
 13706                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13707                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13708 000012C0 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022
 13709                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13710                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13	; save old value of old13 and
 13711                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13+2	; orig13 so that we can
 13712                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13	; return them to caller
 13713                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13+2
 13714                                  		
 13715                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 13716                                  		;push	word [Orig13]
 13717 000012C5 FF36[B600]              		push	word [Orig13+2]
 13718                                  		;push	word [Old13]
 13719 000012C9 FF36[0801]              		push	word [Old13+2]
 13720                                  
 13721                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13, dx	; orig13 := addr. of new int_13
 13722                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13+2, ax
 13723                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13, bx	; old13 := addr. of new boot_13
 13724                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13+2, es
 13725                                  		
 13726                                  		;mov	[Orig13], dx
 13727                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13728 000012CD 8716[B400]              		xchg	dx, [Orig13]
 13729 000012D1 A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
 13730                                  		;mov	[Old13], bx
 13731                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13732 000012D4 871E[0601]              		xchg	bx, [Old13]
 13733 000012D8 8C06[0801]              		mov	[Old13+2], es
 13734                                  
 13735 000012DC 07                      		pop	es			; es:bx := old old13 vector
 13736                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13737                                  		;pop	bx
 13738 000012DD 1F                      		pop	ds			; ds:dx := old orig13 vector
 13739                                  		;pop	dx ; 02/09/2023
 13740 000012DE 58                      		pop	ax
 13741                                  i2f_iret:
 13742 000012DF CF                      		iret
 13743                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13744                                  
 13745                                  mine:					
 13746 000012E0 3CF8                    		cmp	al, 0F8h 		; iret on reserved functions
 13747 000012E2 73FB                    		jnb	short i2f_iret
 13748 000012E4 08C0                    		or	al, al			; a get installed state request?
 13749 000012E6 7503                    		jnz	short disp_func
 13750 000012E8 B0FF                    		mov	al, 0FFh
 13751                                  		;jmp	short i2f_iret
 13752                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13753 000012EA CF                      		iret
 13754                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13755                                  
 13756                                  disp_func:				
 13757 000012EB 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1			; request for installing bds?
 13758 000012ED 7418                    		jz	short do_subfun_01
 13759 000012EF 3C03                    		cmp	al, 3			; get bds vector?
 13760 000012F1 7423                    		jz	short do_get_bds_vector
 13761                                  
 13762                                  ; set up pointer to request packet
 13763                                  
 13764 000012F3 1E                      		push	ds
 13765 000012F4 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022	
 13766                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13767                                  					; = [0070h:25A0h] = [02C7h:0030h]
 13768                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13769                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:ptrsav, bx
 13770                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:ptrsav+2, es

 13940                                  
 13941                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13942                                  ;
 13943                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13944                                  ;
 13945                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13946                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13947                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13948                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13949                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13950                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13951                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13952                                  ;
 13953                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13954                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13955                                  ;
 13956                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13957                                  
 13958                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13959                                  HMAPtr:
 13960 000013A0 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13961                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13962 000013A5 8B3E[F408]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13963                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13964 000013A9 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13965 000013AC 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13966 000013AE 803E[FA08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13967                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13968 000013B3 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13969 000013B5 FF1E[F608]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13970                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13971 000013B9 8B3E[F408]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13972                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13973                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13974 000013BD C3                      		retn
 13975                                  
 13976                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13977                                  
 13978                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13979                                  
 13980                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13981                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13982                                  
 13983                                  move_sector:
 13984                                  
 13985                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13986                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13987                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13988                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13989                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13990                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13991                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13992                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13993                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13994                                  ;
 13995                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13996                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13997                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13998                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13999                                  ; back to a byte move.
 14000                                  
 14001 000013BE FC                      		cld
 14002 000013BF 51                      		push	cx
 14003 000013C0 B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 14004 000013C3 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 14005 000013C7 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14006 000013C9 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 14007 000013CD 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14008 000013CF F3A5                    		rep movsw
 14009 000013D1 59                      		pop	cx
 14010 000013D2 C3                      		retn
 14011                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14012                                  
 14013                                  movsec_bytes:				
 14014 000013D3 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 14015 000013D5 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 14016 000013D7 59                      		pop	cx
 14017 000013D8 C3                      		retn
 14018                                  
 14019                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14020                                  
 14021                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14022                                  
 14023                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 14024                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 14025                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 14026                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 14027                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 14028                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 14029                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 14030                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 14031                                  ;
 14032                                  ; input conditions:
 14033                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 14034                                  ;
 14035                                  ; output:
 14036                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 14037                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 14038                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 14039                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 14040                                  
 14041                                  check_wrap:	
 14042 000013D9 50                      		push	ax
 14043 000013DA 53                      		push	bx
 14044 000013DB 06                      		push	es
 14045 000013DC 57                      		push	di
 14046 000013DD E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 14047 000013E0 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 14048                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14049 000013E2 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14050                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14051 000013E7 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 14052 000013E9 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14053 000013ED 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 14054 000013EF 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 14055 000013F2 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 14056 000013F4 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 14057 000013F6 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 14058                                  
 14059                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 14060                                  ; last sector on that track.
 14061                                  
 14062 000013F8 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 14063 000013FA 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 14064                                  		; 18/12/2022
 14065 000013FC 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 14066 000013FD 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 14067                                  					; if on	boundary
 14068                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 14069                                  not_on_bound:				
 14070 000013FF 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 14071 00001402 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 14072 00001404 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 14073 00001406 40                      		inc	ax
 14074 00001407 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 14075 00001409 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 14076                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14077 0000140C 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14078 00001410 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 14079                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14080                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 14081 00001412 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 14082 00001414 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 14083 00001415 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 14084                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14085 00001417 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 14086                                  
 14087                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 14088                                  
 14089 00001419 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 14090 0000141B 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 14091 0000141D 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 14092                                  
 14093                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 14094                                  
 14095 0000141F 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 14096 00001421 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 14097 00001423 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 14098                                  no_head_bound:				
 14099 00001424 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 14100 00001426 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 14101 00001427 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 14102 00001429 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 14103 0000142B 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 14104 0000142D 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 14105 00001430 B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 14106 00001432 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 14107 00001434 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 14108 00001436 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 14109 00001438 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 14110 0000143A D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 14111 0000143C 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 14112 0000143E 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 14113                                  no_wrap:				
 14114 00001440 F8                      		clc
 14115 00001441 5F                      		pop	di
 14116 00001442 07                      		pop	es
 14117 00001443 5B                      		pop	bx
 14118 00001444 58                      		pop	ax
 14119 00001445 C3                      		retn
 14120                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14121                                  
 14122                                  no_wrap_head:				
 14123 00001446 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 14124 00001448 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 14125 0000144A EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 14126                                  
 14127                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14128                                  
 14129                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14130                                  
 14131                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 14132                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 14133                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 14134                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 14135                                  ;
 14136                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 14137                                  
 14138                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14139                                  find_bds:	
 14140 0000144C C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 14141                                  fbds_1:					
 14142 00001450 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14143 00001454 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 14144 00001456 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 14145                                  					; go to next bds
 14146 00001459 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14147 0000145C 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 14148 0000145E F9                      		stc
 14149                                  fdbs_2:					
 14150 0000145F C3                      		retn
 14151                                  
 14152                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14153                                  
 14154                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14155                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14156                                  doint:
 14157                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14158 00001460 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14159                                  					; get physical drive number
 14160                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 14161                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 14162                                  		
 14163 00001463 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14164 00001465 08C0                    		or	al, al
 14165 00001467 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 14166                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14167 00001469 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14168                                  					; get request code
 14169                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 14170 0000146C FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14171                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 14172 0000146F 9D                      		popf
 14173                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 14174                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14175 00001470 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14176                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 14177                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14178 00001475 9C                      		pushf
 14179                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14180 00001476 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14181                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 14182                                  dointdone:				
 14183 00001479 C3                      		retn
 14184                                  
 14185                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14186                                  
 14187                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14188                                  
 14189                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 14190                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 14191                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 14192                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 14193                                  ;
 14194                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 14195                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 14196                                  ;
 14197                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 14198                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 14199                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 14200                                  
 14201                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 14202                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 14203                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 14204                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 14205                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 14206                                  ;.olddx: resw
 14207                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 14208                                  ;.olddd: resd
 14209                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 14210                                  ;end struc
 14211                                  
 14212                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14213                                  
 14214                                  ;   entry conditions:
 14215                                  ;	ah = function
 14216                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 14217                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 14218                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 14219                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 14220                                  ;   output conditions:
 14221                                  ;	no dma violation.
 14222                                  
 14223                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 14224                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 14225                                  ;
 14226                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 14227                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 14228                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 14229                                  
 14230                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14231                                  
 14232                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

 14234 0000147A 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array

 14241                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14242                                  
 14243                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline

 14255 0000148C 5B                      		pop	bx

 14259                                  ; 16/10/2022

 14261                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing

 14263                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h

 14272 00001497 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0

 14274 0000149B 8406[3105]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?

 14278                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 14279 000014A3 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 14280 000014A4 06                      		push	es
 14281                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14282 000014A5 2EC41E[7A14]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]

 14284                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h

 14286 000014AC 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 14287 000014AF 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 14288                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 14289                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 14290 000014B3 07                      		pop	es
 14291 000014B4 5B                      		pop	bx
 14292 000014B5 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done

 14294                                  
 14295                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14296                                  
 14297                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 14298                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 14299                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 14300                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 14301                                  
 14302                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 14303 000014B7 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 14304                                  					; read driver parm ?
 14305 000014BC 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem

 14307                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 14308 000014C3 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14309                                  ps2_30_problem:

 14311 000014C6 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 14312                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 14313                                  		; 17/10/2022

 14316                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13

 14318 000014CE EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14319                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14320                                  
 14321                                  ; 17/10/2022

 14326                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 14327                                  
 14328                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 14329                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 14330                                  
 14331                                  		; 19/10/2022

 14333                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 14334                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data

 14336                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 14337                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 14338                                  
 14339                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 14340                                  
 14341 000014D6 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 14342 000014D9 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14343 000014DC 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 14344                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 14345                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 14346 000014DE 803E[3105]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 14347 000014E3 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 14348                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 14349                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 14350                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h

 14352                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14353

 14355

 14357                                  					; mdl_ps2_30

 14359                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 14360                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 14361 000014F2 9D                      		popf
 14362 000014F3 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 14363                                  ret_from_i13:				
 14364 000014F5 1F                      		pop	ds
 14365 000014F6 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 14366                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14367                                  
 14368                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 14369                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 14370                                  ; a changeline error.
 14371                                  
 14372                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 14373 000014F9 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 14374                                  i13_ret_error:				
 14375 000014FB 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 14376 000014FE 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 14377 00001500 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 14378 00001502 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 14379 00001504 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 14380 00001509 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 14381                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 14382                                  					; never	would

 14385 0000150F E8AA03                  		call	set_changed_dl
 14386 00001512 5B                      		pop	bx
 14387                                  int13b:

 14389 00001514 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13

 14391                                  
 14392                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 14393                                  
 14394                                  goterr13:
