 20037                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 20038                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 20039                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 20040                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 20041                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 20042                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 20043                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 20044                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 20045                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 20046                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 20047                                  ;	  stub will go.
 20048                                  ;
 20049                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 20050                                  
 20051                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20052                                  update_arena:
 20053 0000097A 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 20054 0000097B 57                      	push	di
 20055 0000097C 51                      	push	cx
 20056 0000097D 52                      	push	dx
 20057                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20058                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 20059                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20060                                  	; ds = cs 
 20061 0000097E C53E[6B02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 20062 00000982 4F                      	dec	di
 20063 00000983 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 20064                                  						;  before sysvar
 20065 00000984 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 20066                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 20067 00000986 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 20068 0000098B 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 20069 0000098D 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 20070                                  
 20071                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 20072 0000098F 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 20073 00000994 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 20074 00000996 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 20075 00000998 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 20076 0000099A 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20077                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 20078 0000099C 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 20079                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 20080 000009A0 C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 20081 000009A6 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 20082                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 20083 000009A8 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 20084 000009AC 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 20085                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20086                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 20087 000009AE 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 20088 000009B1 5A                      	pop	dx
 20089 000009B2 59                      	pop	cx
 20090 000009B3 5F                      	pop	di
 20091 000009B4 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 20092 000009B5 C3                      	retn
 20093                                  ;
 20094                                  ; M012 : END
 20095                                  ;

 20113                                  ;
 20114                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 20115                                  ;
 20116                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 20117                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 20118                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 20119                                  ;
 20120                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 20121                                  ;
 20122                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20123                                  
 20124                                  AllocHMA:
 20125                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 20126                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 20127                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 20128                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 20129                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 20130                                  
 20131                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 20132                                  ;
 20133                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 20134                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 20135                                  ;	push	ax
 20136                                  ;	popf
 20137                                  ;	pushf
 20138                                  ;	pop	ax
 20139                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 20140                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 20141                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 20142                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 20143                                  
 20144                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20145                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 20146                                  
 20147 000009C1 1E                      	push	ds
 20148                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data
 20149                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT
 20150                                  	; 21/10/2022
 20151 000009C2 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 20152 000009C5 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20153                                  
 20154 000009C7 E84A00                  	call	IsXMSLoaded
 20155 000009CA 7545                    	jnz	short grabhma_error
 20156                                  
 20157 000009CC B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 20158 000009CF CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; get the vector into es:bx
 20159                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 20160                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 20161                                  
 20162 000009D1 891E[0E00]              	mov	[xms],bx
 20163                                  	;mov	[0Eh], bx
 20164 000009D5 8C06[1000]              	mov	[xms+2],es
 20165                                  	;mov	[10h],es
 20166                                  
 20167 000009D9 B401                    	mov	ah,1		; request HMA
 20168 000009DB BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,0FFFFh
 20169                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 20170 000009DE FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 20171 000009E2 48                      	dec	ax
 20172 000009E3 7409                    	jz	short allocHMA_1 ; error if not able to allocate HMA
 20173                                  
 20174                                  ;------ Himem may be lying because it has allocated mem for int 15
 20175

 20179                                  		; Return: CF clear on success
 20180                                  		; AX = size of memory above 1M in K
 20181 000009E9 83F840                  	cmp	ax,64		; less than 64 K of hma ?
 20182                                  	;jb	short grabhma_error
 20183                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20184 000009EC 7224                    	jb	short grabhma_err ; cf=1
 20185                                  allocHMA_1:

 20187                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh

 20189 000009F4 48                      	dec	ax
 20190 000009F5 751A                    	jnz	short grabhma_error ; error if couldn't enable A20
 20191                                  
 20192 000009F7 E88501                  	call	IsVDiskInstalled
 20193 000009FA 7415                    	jz	short grabhma_error ; yes, we cant use HMA
 20194                                  
 20195 000009FC B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 20196 000009FF 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20197 00000A01 26C70610003412          	mov	word [es:10h],1234h ; see if we can really read/write there
 20198 00000A08 26813E10003412          	cmp	word [es:10h],1234h
 20199                                  	;jne	short grabhma_error ; don't try to load there if XMS lied
 20200                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20201 00000A0F 7401                    	je	short allocHMA_ok

 20281 00000A38 CB                      	retf
 20282                                  
 20283                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20284                                  ;
 20285                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 20286                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 20287                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 20288                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 20289                                  ;
 20290                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 20291                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 20292                                  ;
 20293                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20294                                  
 20295                                  StartVDHead:
 20296                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 20297                                  
 20298 00000A39 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 20299 00000A3D 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 20300 00000A3F 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 20301 00000A41 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 20302 00000A43 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 20303                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 20304 00000A44 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 20305                                  VDiskSig1:
 20306 00000A4B 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20307                                  
 20308                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 20309                                  
 20310 00000A50 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 20311                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 20312 00000A56 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 20313 00000A65 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 20314 00000A67 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 20315                                  VDInt19:
 20316 00000A68 EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 20317                                  OldVDInt19:
 20318 00000A69 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 20319                                  
 20320                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 20321                                  
 20322                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 20323 00000A6D 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 20324                                  VDiskSig2:
 20325 00000A70 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20326                                  
 20327                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 20328                                  
 20329 00000A75 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 20330 00000A78 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 20331 00000A7A 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 20332 00000A7B 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 20333 00000A7D 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 20334 00000A7E 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 20335 00000A80 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 20336 00000A82 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 20337 00000A83 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 20338 00000A85 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 20339 00000A87 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 20340 00000A89 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 20341 00000A8B 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 20342                                  
 20343                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 20344                                  
 20345                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20346                                  ;
 20347                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 20348                                  ;
 20349                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 20350                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 20351                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 20352                                  ;
 20353                                  ; Inputs : None
 20354                                  ;
 20355                                  ; Outputs : None
 20356                                  ;
 20357                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 20358                                  ;
 20359                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20360                                  
 20361                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20362                                  
 20363                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 20364 00000A8D 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 20365 00000A8F 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 20366                                  
 20367                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 20368                                  
 20369                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20370 00000A91 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 20371                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 20372 00000A94 2EA3[690A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 20373 00000A98 A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 20374                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20375 00000A9B 2EA3[6B0A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20376                                  
 20377                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 20378                                  
 20379 00000A9F B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 20380                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 20381                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20382 00000AA1 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 20383 00000AA4 CD21                    	int	21h
 20384                                  
 20385                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 20386                                  
 20387 00000AA6 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena

 20486                                  
 20487                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 20488                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 20489                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 20490                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 20491                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 20492                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 20493                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 20494                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 20495                                  ;								      ;I070
 20496                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 20497                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 20498                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 20499                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 20500                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 20501                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 20502                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 20503                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 20504                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 20505                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 20506                                  ;								      ;I070
 20507                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 20508                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 20509                                  
 20510                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20511                                  	; ds = cs

 21538                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 21539                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 21540                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 21541                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 21542                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 21543                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 21544                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 21545                                  ;
 21546                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 21547                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 21548                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 21549                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 21550                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 21551                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 21552                                  ;
 21553                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 21554                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 21555                                  ;
 21556                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 21557                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 21558                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 21559                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 21560                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 21561                                  ;
 21562                                  ;	for round-up machine
 21563                                  ;
 21564                                  ;			  none.
 21565                                  
 21566                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 21567                                  ;
 21568                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 21569                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 21570                                  
 21571                                  	; 24/10/2022

 21726                                  		; DOS - 2+ - ALLOCATE MEMORY
 21727                                  		; BX = number of 16-byte paragraphs desired
 21728 00000FF6 A3[E003]                	mov	[memhi],ax		; start of the allocated memory
 21729 00000FF9 C706[DE03]0000          	mov	word [memlo],0		;  to be used next.
 21730                                  
 21731                                  ;;;; at this moment,memory from [memhi]:0 to top-of-the memory is
 21732                                  ;;;; allocated.
 21733                                  ;;;; to protect sysinit,confbot module (from confbot (or =alloclim at
 21734                                  ;;;; this time) to the top-of-the memory),here we are going to
 21735                                  ;;;; 1). "setblock" from memhi to confbot.
 21736                                  ;;;; 2). "alloc" from confbot to the top of the memory.
 21737                                  ;;;; 3). "free alloc memory" from memhi to confbot.
 21738                                  
 21739                                  ;memory allocation for sysinit,confbot module.
 21740                                  
 21741 00000FFF 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 21742                                  	;mov	bx,[CONFBOT]
 21743                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21744 00001001 8B1E[A102]              	mov	bx,[top_of_cdss]
 21745 00001005 29C3                    	sub	bx,ax			; confbot - memhi
 21746 00001007 4B                      	dec	bx			; make a room for the memory block id.
 21747 00001008 4B                      	dec	bx			; make sure!!!.
 21748 00001009 B44A                    	mov	ah,4Ah ; SETBLOCK
 21749 0000100B CD21                    	int	21h			; this will free (confbot to top of memory)
 21750                                  		; DOS - 2+ - ADJUST MEMORY BLOCK SIZE (SETBLOCK)
 21751                                  		; ES = segment address of block to change
 21752                                  		; BX = new size in paragraphs
 21753 0000100D BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh
 21754 00001010 B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 21755 00001012 CD21                    	int	21h
 21756 00001014 B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 21757 00001016 CD21                    	int	21h			; allocate (confbot to top of memory)
 21758                                  		; DOS - 2+ - ALLOCATE MEMORY
 21759                                  		; BX = number of 16-byte paragraphs desired
 21760 00001018 A3[E403]                	mov	[area],ax		; save allocated memory segment.
 21761                                  					; need this to free this area for command.com.
 21762 0000101B 8E06[E003]              	mov	es,[memhi]
 21763 0000101F B449                    	mov	ah,49h			; free allocated memory.
 21764 00001021 CD21                    	int	21h			; free (memhi to confbot(=area))
 21765                                  		; DOS - 2+ - FREE MEMORY
 21766                                  		; ES = segment address of area to be freed
 21767                                  endfile_ret:
 21768 00001023 C3                      	retn
 21769                                  
 21770                                  ; End of "EndFile" DOS structure configuration.
 21771                                  
 21772                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21773                                  ; 26/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21774                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)	
 21775                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21776                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 21777                                  ;
 21778                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 21779                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 21780                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 21781                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 21782                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 21783                                  ; program).
 21784                                  
 21785                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 21786                                  
 21787                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 21788                                  
 21789 00001024 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 21790                                  
 21791                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 21792                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 21793                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 21794                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 21795                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 21796                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 21797                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 21798                                  ; carridge return.
 21799                                  
 21800                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 21801                                  ;character after =.
 21802                                  
 21803 00001025 06                      	push	es
 21804 00001026 1E                      	push	ds
 21805 00001027 07                      	pop	es
 21806 00001028 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 21807 00001029 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 21808                                  
 21809 0000102B 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21810 0000102D FC                      	cld
 21811 0000102E 2EC606[6D03]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 21812 00001034 BF[6E03]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 21813                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 21814 00001037 AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 21815 00001038 3C00                    	cmp	al,0
 21816 0000103A 7402                    	je	short got_installparm
 21817 0000103C EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 21818                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 21819 0000103E AC                      	lodsb
 21820 0000103F 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 21821 00001042 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 21822 00001044 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 21823 00001046 FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 21824 00001048 47                      	inc	di
 21825 00001049 EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 21826                                  done_installparm:
 21827 0000104B 2E880E[6C03]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.
 21828 00001050 80F900                  	cmp	cl,0			; if no parm,then
 21829 00001053 7506                    	jne	short install_seg_set 	; let the parm area
 21830 00001055 2EC606[6D03]0D          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],cr ; 0Dh 
 21831                                  					; starts with cr.
 21832                                  install_seg_set:
 21833 0000105B 2EC70600000000          	mov	word [cs:0],0		; make a null environment segment
 21834 00001062 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs			; by overlap jmp instruction of sysinitseg.
 21835                                  
 21836                                  ;---------------------------------------------------M067----------------
 21837                                  ;
 21838                                  ; 	the environment pointer is made 0. so the current environment ptr.
 21839                                  ; 	will be the same as pdb_environ which after dosinit is 0.
 21840                                  ;
 21841                                  ; 	mov	cs:[instexe.exec0_environ],0 ; set the environment seg.
 21842                                  ;
 21843                                  ; 	instexe.exec0_environ need not be initialized to 0 above. It was
 21844                                  ; 	done as a fix for bug #529. The actual bug was in NLSFUNC and
 21845                                  ; 	was fixed. 
 21846                                  ;
 21847                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21848

 21850

 21865 00001064 2EA3[BE03]              	mov	[cs:iexec.environ],ax	
 21866                                  
 21867                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_com_line+2],ax ; set the seg.
 21868 00001068 2EA3[C203]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_line+2],ax
 21869                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_5c_fcb+2],ax
 21870 0000106C 2EA3[C603]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_5c_fcb+2],ax
 21871                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_6c_fcb+2],ax
 21872 00001070 2EA3[CA03]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_6c_fcb+2],ax
 21873 00001074 E86E00                  	call	sum_up
 21874 00001077 26A3[5603]              	mov	[es:checksum],ax	; save the value of the sum
 21875 0000107B 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21876 0000107D B44B                    	mov	ah,4Bh ; EXEC		; load/exec
 21877 0000107F BB[BE03]                	mov	bx,instexe		; es:bx -> parm block.
 21878 00001082 06                      	push	es			; save es,ds for load/exec
 21879 00001083 1E                      	push	ds			; these registers will be restored in sysinit_base.
 21880 00001084 2EFF2E[4E03]            	jmp	far [cs:sysinit_base_ptr] ; jmp to sysinit_base to execute
 21881                                  					; load/exec function and check sum.
 21882                                  
 21883                                  ;----------------------------------------
 21884                                  
 21885                                  ;j.k. this is the returning address from sysinit_base.
 21886                                  
 21887                                  	; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT)
 21888                                  
 21889                                  sysinitptr:				; returning far address from sysinit_base
 21890 00001089 5E                      	pop	si			; restore si for config.sys file.
 21891 0000108A 06                      	push	es
 21892 0000108B 1E                      	push	ds
 21893 0000108C 07                      	pop	es
 21894 0000108D 1F                      	pop	ds			; now ds - sysinitseg, es - confbot
 21895 0000108E 7306                            jnc     short install_exit_ret
 21896                                  
 21897 00001090 56                      	push	si			; error in loading the file for install=.
 21898 00001091 E8CA21                  	call	badload 		; es:si-> path,filename,0.
 21899 00001094 5E                      	pop	si

 21906

 21908                                  	;retn		; retn (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1283h) ; 18/12/2022
 21909

 21911                                  ;SYSINIT:1142h:
 21912 00001096 B44D                    	mov     ah,4Dh
 21913 00001098 CD21                    	int     21h             ; DOS - 2+ - GET EXIT CODE OF SUBPROGRAM (WAIT)
 21914 0000109A 80FC03                  	cmp     ah,3
 21915 0000109D 7404                    	jz      short sysinitptr_retn
 21916 0000109F E80316                  	call    error_line
 21917 000010A2 F9                      	stc
 21918                                  sysinitptr_retn:	; (SYSINIT:114Fh)

 21923                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 21924                                  ;
 21925                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 21926                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 21927                                  ;
 21928                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 21929                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 21930                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 21931                                  
 21932                                  ParaRound:
 21933 000010A4 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 21934 000010A7 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 21935 000010A9 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21936 000010AB D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21937 000010AD D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21938 000010AF C3                      	retn

 21940                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21941                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 21942                                  ;
 21943                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 21944                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 21945                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 21946                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 21947                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 21948                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 21949                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 21950                                  ;
 21951                                  ;in: after relocation,
 21952                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 21953                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 21954                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 21955                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 21956                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 21957                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 21958                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 21959                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 21960                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 21961                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 21962                                  ;
 21963                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 21964                                  
 21965                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21966                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21967                                  sysinit_base:				
 21968 000010B0 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 21969 000010B5 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 21970 000010BA CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 21971 000010BC 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 21972 000010C1 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 21973 000010C6 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 21974 000010C7 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 21975 000010C8 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 21976                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 21977                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 21978 000010CA E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 21979 000010CD 263906[5603]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 21980 000010D2 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 21981                                  
 21982                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 21983                                  
 21984 000010D4 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 21985 000010D6 0E                      	push	cs
 21986 000010D7 1F                      	pop	ds
 21987 000010D8 BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21988 000010DB CD21                    	int	21h
 21989                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 21990                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 21991                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21992                                  _stall: 
 21993                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21994 000010DD F4                      	hlt 
 21995                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21996                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 21997 000010DE EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 21998                                  
 21999                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 22000 000010E0 26FF2E[5203]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 22001                                  
 22002                                  ;-------------------------------------
 22003                                  
 22004                                  sum_up:
 22005                                  
 22006                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 22007                                  ;out:  ax - result
 22008                                  ;
 22009                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 22010                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 22011                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 22012                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 22013                                  ;
 22014                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 22015                                  
 22016 000010E5 1E                      	push	ds
 22017                                  	;mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 22018                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22019 000010E6 26A1[A102]              	mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 22020 000010EA 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 22021 000010EC 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 22022 000010EE 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22023 000010F0 268B0E[4C03]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 22024                                  					;whole test better fail.
 22025 000010F5 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 22026 000010F7 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 22027                                  sum1:
 22028 000010F9 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 22029 000010FB 46                      	inc	si
 22030 000010FC 46                      	inc	si
 22031 000010FD E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 22032                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 22033                                  sum_sys_code:
 22034                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22035 000010FF BEFE10                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22036                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 22037                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 22038                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 22039                                  	; 02/11/2022
 22040                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 22041                                  	; 30/12/2022 (BugFix)
 22042                                  	; (SI_End is 39D0h for this -Retro DOS v4.0- IO.SYS)
 22043 00001102 B9[F037]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 22044 00001105 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 22045 00001107 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 22046                                  sum2:
 22047 00001109 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 22048 0000110C 46                      	inc	si
 22049 0000110D 46                      	inc	si
 22050 0000110E E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 22051 00001110 1F                      	pop	ds
 22052 00001111 C3                      	retn
 22053                                  
 22054                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22055                                  
 22056                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 22057                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:
 22058 00001112 0000                    	dw	0
 22059                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)

 22075                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22076                                  ; Set_Buffer
 22077                                  ;
 22078                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 22079                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 22080                                  ;
 22081                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 22082                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 22083                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 22084                                  ;
 22085                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 22086                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 22087                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22088                                  
 22089                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22090                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)
 22091                                  
 22092                                  set_buffer:
 22093 00001131 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 22094 00001133 E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 22095 00001136 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1

 22097                                  	; 17/09/2023
 22098 00001138 FEC2                    	inc	dl ; mov dl,1
 22099                                  set_buff_1:

 22103                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue+2],es
 22104 0000113C 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es
 22105                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Dirty_Buff_Count],0 ;set dirty_count to 0.
 22106 0000113F C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 22107                                  
 22108 00001144 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 22109 00001146 2E8B0E[9702]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 22110 0000114B 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 22111                                  
 22112                                  ;	for each buffer
 22113                                  
 22114                                  nxt_buff:
 22115 0000114C E86100                  	call	set_buffer_info 		; set buf_link,buf_id...
 22116 0000114F 89C7                    	mov	di,ax

 22118                                  
 22119 00001153 2E2B3E[9B02]            	sub	di,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; point to last buffer
 22120

 22122                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 22123 00001159 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 22124 0000115C 87CF                    	xchg	cx,di
 22125                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last

 22128

 22130 00001164 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no

 22133 0000116A 2EA1[E003]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff

 22135 0000116E C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0

 22150                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22151                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 22152                                  ;
 22153                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 22154                                  ;
 22155                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 22156                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 22157                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22158                                  
 22159                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 22160                                  GetBufferAddr:
 22161 0000118B 53                      	push	bx
 22162 0000118C 52                      	push	dx
 22163 0000118D 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 22164 00001191 2EF726[9702]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 22165                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 22166 00001196 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 22167                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22168                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round

 22171 0000119B 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax

 22220                                  
 22221                                  ; ======================================================================
 22222                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 22223                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22224                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22225                                  
 22226                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22227                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 22228                                  ;
 22229                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 22230                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 22231                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 22232                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 22233                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 22234                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 22235                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 22236                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 22237                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 22238                                  ;
 22239                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 22240                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 22241                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 22242                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 22243                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 22244                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 22245                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 22246                                  ;	conditions:
 22247                                  ;
 22248                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 22249                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 22250                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 22251                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 22252                                  ;
 22253                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 22254                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 22255                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 22256                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 22257                                  ;
 22258                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 22259                                  ;
 22260                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 22261                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 22262                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 22263                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 22264                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 22265                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 22266                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 22267                                  ;	interrupt line.
 22268                                  ;
 22269                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 22270                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 22271                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 22272                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 22273                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 22274                                  ;
 22275                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 22276                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 22277                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 22278                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 22279                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 22280                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 22281                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 22282                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 22283                                  ;
 22284                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 22285                                  
 22286                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22287                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 22288                                  
 22289                                  	; 14/12/2022
 22290                                  stackinit:
 22291 000011D8 50                      	push	ax
 22292 000011D9 1E                      	push	ds
 22293 000011DA 06                      	push	es
 22294 000011DB 53                      	push	bx
 22295 000011DC 51                      	push	cx
 22296 000011DD 52                      	push	dx
 22297 000011DE 57                      	push	di
 22298 000011DF 56                      	push	si
 22299 000011E0 55                      	push	bp
 22300                                  
 22301                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 22302                                  
 22303                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22304                                  	; ds = cs
 22305 000011E1 A1[8A02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 22306 000011E4 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 22307                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22308                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 22309                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 22310 000011E6 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 22311                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 22312 000011EA A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 22313 000011ED 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 22314                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22315 000011F1 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 22316                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22317                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22318                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 22319 000011F4 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 22320                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22321 000011F8 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 22322 000011FA A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 22323                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22324                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22325                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 22326 000011FD 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 22327                                  
 22328                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 22329                                  
 22330                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 22331                                  
 22332                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 22333                                  	; 12/12/2022

 22335 00001201 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 22336                                  
 22337                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 22338                                  
 22339 00001206 B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 22340                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 22341                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22342                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 22343 00001209 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22344 0000120B 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 22345 0000120D 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 22346 00001211 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22347 00001213 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 22348                                  
 22349                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 22350                                  
 22351 00001216 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 22352 0000121B 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 22353 0000121F F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22354 00001221 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 22355 00001223 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22356 00001225 06                      	push	es
 22357 00001226 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 22358                                  
 22359                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 22360                                  
 22361 00001227 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 22362 0000122B FC                      	cld
 22363 0000122C F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 22364                                  
 22365 0000122E 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 22366                                  
 22367                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 22368                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 22369                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 22370                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2
 22371                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry
 22372

 23128                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23129                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23130                                  
 23131                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23132                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 23133                                  
 23134                                  new_init_loop:
 23135                                  
 23136                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 23137                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 23138                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 23139                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 23140                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 23141                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 23142                                  
 23143 000013CA 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 23144 000013CD 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 23145 000013CF 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 23146 000013D3 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 23147                                  
 23148 000013D6 1E                      	push	ds
 23149                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 23150                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 23151                                  	; 21/10/2022
 23152 000013D7 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 23153 000013DA 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 23154 000013DC 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 23155 000013DF 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 23156 000013E1 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 23157 000013E5 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 23158 000013E8 1F                      	pop	ds
 23159                                  
 23160 000013E9 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 23161 000013EC 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 23162 000013F0 C3                      	retn
 23163                                  
 23164                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 23165                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23166                                  
 23167                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23168                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 23169                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 23170                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 23171                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 23172                                  ;out: devmark established.
 23173                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 23174                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 23175                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23176                                  
 23177                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23178                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 23179                                  ; 04/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23180                                  ; (SYSINIT:176Ch)
 23181                                  
 23182                                  ; 04/09/2023 - PCDOS 7.1 - IBMBIO.COM (SYSINIT:1944h)
 23183                                  
 23184                                  setdevmark:
 23185                                  
 23186                                  	; 04/09/2023
 23187                                  	;push	es
 23188                                  	;push	cx
 23189                                  
 23190 000013F1 2E8B0E[E003]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 23191 000013F6 2E890E[0E14]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 23192 000013FB 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 23193                                  	; 25/10/2022
 23194                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 23195 000013FD 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 23196 00001401 41                      	inc	cx
 23197                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 23198 00001402 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 23199                                  
 23200                                  	; 04/09/2023
 23201                                  	;pop	cx
 23202                                  	;pop	es
 23203                                  	
 23204 00001407 2EFF06[E003]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 23205 0000140C C3                      	retn

 23405                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23406                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 23407                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 23408                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 23409                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 23410                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 23411                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 23412                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 23413                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 23414                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 23415                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23416                                  
 23417                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 23418                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 23419 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 23420 00000002 ??                       .Num_Extra:	   resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 23421 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 23422                                  endstruc
