 23424                                  _$P_Len_PARMS	   equ	4		;AN000;
 23425                                  _$P_I_Use_Default  equ	0		;AN000; no extra stuff specified
 23426                                  _$P_I_Have_Delim   equ	1		;AN000; extra delimiter specified
 23427                                  _$P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 23428                                  
 23429                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23430                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE
 23431                                  ;		DB	minp,maxp	; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED
 23432                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF POSITIONAL 1
 23433                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 23434                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 23435                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 23436                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES
 23437                                  ;		DB	maxk		; # OF KEYWORD
 23438                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 23439                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 23440                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23441                                  
 23442                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 23443                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 23444 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 23445 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 23446 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 23447                                  endstruc
 23448                                  
 23449                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23450                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 23451                                  ;
 23452                                  ;
 23453                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 23454                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 23455                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23456                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23457                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23458                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23459                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23460                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23461                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23462                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23463                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23464                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 23465                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 23466                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 23467                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 23468                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 23469                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 23470                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 23471                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 23472                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 23473                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 23474                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 23475                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 23476                                  ;	   :
 23477                                  ;
 23478                                  ;Note:
 23479                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 23480                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 23481                                  ;
 23482                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 23483                                  ;
 23484                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 23485                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 23486                                  ;
 23487                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 23488                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 23489                                  ;
 23490                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 23491                                  ;
 23492                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 23493                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 23494                                  ;
 23495                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23496                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 23497                                  ;
 23498                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 23499                                  ;
 23500                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23501                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 23502                                  ;
 23503                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23504                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23505                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23506                                  ;
 23507                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 23508                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 23509                                  ;
 23510                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 23511                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 23512                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 23513                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23514                                  
 23515                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 23516                                  
 23517                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 23518                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 23519                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 23520                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 23521                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 23522                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 23523                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 23524                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 23525                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 23526                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 23527                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 23528                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 23529                                  
 23530                                  ;**** Function flags
 23531                                  
 23532                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 23533                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 23534                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 23535                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 23536                                  
 23537                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 23538                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 23539 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 23540 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 23541 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 23542 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 23543 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 23544 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 23545                                  endstruc
 23546                                  
 23547                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23548                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 23549                                  ;
 23550                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 23551                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 23552                                  ;	     +-
 23553                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 23554                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 23555                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 23556                                  ;	     |	:
 23557                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23558                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 23559                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 23560                                  ;	     |	:
 23561                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23562                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 23563                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 23564                                  ;	     +-	:
 23565                                  ;
 23566                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 23567                                  ;
 23568                                  ;Note:
 23569                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 23570                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 23571                                  ;
 23572                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23573                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23574                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23575                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23576                                  
 23577                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 23578                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 23579                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 23580                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 23581                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 23582                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 23583                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 23584                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 23585                                  
 23586                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 23587 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 23588 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 23589 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 23590 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 23591 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 23592                                  endstruc
 23593                                  
 23594                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23595                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 23596                                  ;
 23597                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 23598                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 23599                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 23600                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 23601                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 23602                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 23603                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 23604                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 23605                                  ;
 23606                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 23607                                  ;
 23608                                  ;            +-
 23609                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 23610                                  ;	    | or
 23611                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 23612                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 23613                                  ;	    | or
 23614                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 23615                                  ;	    | or
 23616                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 23617                                  ;	    | or
 23618                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 23619                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 23620                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 23621                                  ;	    | or
 23622                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 23623                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 23624                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 23625                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 23626                                  ;	    +-
 23627                                  ;
 23628                                  ;
 23629                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 23630                                  ;      list.
 23631                                  ;
 23632                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 23633                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 23634                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 23635                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23636                                  
 23637                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 23638                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 23639 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 23640 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 23641 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 23642 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 23643                                  endstruc
 23644                                  
 23645                                  ;--------------------------------
 23646                                  ;**** values for the type field in the result block
 23647                                  
 23648                                  _$P_EOL		   equ	0		;AN000; End of line
 23649                                  _$P_Number	   equ	1		;AN000; Number
 23650                                  _$P_List_Idx	   equ	2		;AN000; List Index
 23651                                  _$P_String	   equ	3		;AN000; String
 23652                                  _$P_Complex	   equ	4		;AN000; Complex
 23653                                  _$P_File_Spec	   equ	5		;AN000; File Spec
 23654                                  _$P_Drive	   equ	6		;AN000; Drive
 23655                                  _$P_Date_F	   equ	7		;AN000; Date
 23656                                  _$P_Time_F	   equ	8		;AN000; Time
 23657                                  _$P_Quoted_String  equ	9		;AN000; Quoted String
 23658                                  
 23659                                  _$P_No_Tag	   equ	0FFh		;AN000; No ITEM_TAG found
 23660                                  
 23661                                  ;**** Return code
 23662                                  ;
 23663                                  ; following return code will be returned in the AX register.
 23664                                  
 23665                                  _$P_No_Error	   equ	0		;AN000; No error
 23666                                  _$P_Too_Many	   equ	1		;AN000; Too many operands
 23667                                  _$P_Op_Missing	   equ	2		;AN000; Required operand missing
 23668                                  _$P_Not_In_SW	   equ	3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 23669                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 23670                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 23671                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 23672                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 23673                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 23674                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 23758                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23759                                  ; SysParse;
 23760                                  ;
 23761                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 23762                                  ;
 23763                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 23764                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 23765                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 23766                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 23767                                  ;
 23768                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 23769                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 23770                                  ;		 is in DS.
 23771                                  ;
 23772                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 23773                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 23774                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 23775                                  ;
 23776                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 23777                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 23778                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 23779                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 23780                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 23781                                  ;
 23782                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 23783                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 23784                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 23785                                  ;
 23786                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 23787                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 23788                                  ;
 23789                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 23790                                  ;
 23791                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 23792                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 23793                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 23794                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 23795                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 23796                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 23797                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 23798                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 23799                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 23800                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 23801                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 23802                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 23803                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 23804                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 23805                                  ;	     (tm08)
 23806                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 23807                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 23808                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 23809                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 23810                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 23811                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 23812                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 23813                                  ;					  (tm12)
 23814                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 23815                                  ;					  (tm13)
 23816                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 23817                                  ;					  (tm14)
 23818                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 23819                                  ;					  (tm15)
 23820                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 23821                                  
 23822                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 23823                                  
 23824                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 23825                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 23826                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 23827                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 23828                                  
 23829                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 23830                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 23831                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 23832                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 23833                                  ;
 23834                                  
 23835                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 23836                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 23837                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 23838                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 23839                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 23840                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 23841                                  
 23842                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 23843                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 23844                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 23845                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 23846                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 23847                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 23848                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 23849                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 23850                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 23851                                  
 23852                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 23853                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 23854                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 23855                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 23856                                  ;	     segment.
 23857

 23859                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS

 23862                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 23863                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.

 24455                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24456                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 24457                                  ;
 24458                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 24459                                  ;
 24460                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 24461                                  ;	    AL = type
 24462                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 24463                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 24464                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 24465                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 24466                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 24467                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 24468                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 24469                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24470                                  ;
 24471                                  ; Output:   None
 24472                                  ;
 24473                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 24474                                  ;
 24475                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 24476                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24477                                  
 24478                                  _$P_Fill_Result:

 24694                                  ; _$P_Remove_Colon;
 24695                                  ;
 24696                                  ; Function: Remove colon at end
 24697                                  ;
 24698                                  ; Input:    cs:SI points to string buffer to be examineed
 24699                                  ;
 24700                                  ; Output:   None
 24701                                  ;
 24702                                  ; Use:	_$P_Chk_DBCS
 24703                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24704                                  
 24705                                  _$P_Remove_Colon:
 24706 000017FA 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24707 000017FB 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 24708                                  _$P_RCOL_Loop:				;AN000;
 24709 000017FC 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 24710 000017FF 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?
 24711 00001801 741A                    	jz	short _$P_RCOL_Exit	;AN000; if yes, just exit
 24712                                  
 24713 00001803 3C3A                    	cmp	al,_$P_Colon		;AN000; is it colon ?
 24714 00001805 750D                    	jne	short _$P_RCOL00	;AN000;
 24715                                  
 24716 00001807 2E807C0100              	cmp	byte [cs:si+1],_$P_NULL ;AN000; if so, next is NULL ?
 24717 0000180C 7506                    	jne	short _$P_RCOL00	;AN000; no, then next char
 24718                                  
 24719 0000180E 2EC60400                	mov	byte [cs:si],_$P_NULL	;AN000; yes, remove colon
 24720 00001812 EB09                    	jmp	short _$P_RCOL_Exit	;AN000; and exit.
 24721                                  
 24722                                  _$P_RCOL00:				;AN000;
 24723 00001814 E81704                  	call	_$P_Chk_DBCS		;AN000; if not colon, then check if
 24724 00001817 7301                    	jnc	short _$P_RCOL01	;AN000; DBCS leading byte.
 24725                                  
 24726 00001819 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; if yes, skip trailing byte
 24727                                  _$P_RCOL01:				;AN000;
 24728 0000181A 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; si points to next byte
 24729 0000181B EBDF                    	jmp	short _$P_RCOL_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 24730                                  
 24731                                  _$P_RCOL_Exit:				;AN000;
 24732 0000181D 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 24733 0000181E 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24734 0000181F C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 24737                                  ; _$P_Do_CAPS_String;
 24738                                  ;
 24739                                  ; Function: Perform capitalization along with the file case map table
 24740                                  ;	    or character case map table.
 24741                                  ;
 24742                                  ; Input:    AL = 2 : Use character table
 24743                                  ;	    AL = 4 : Use file table
 24744                                  ;	    cs:SI points to string buffer to be capitalized
 24745                                  ;
 24746                                  ; Output:   None
 24747                                  ;
 24748                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_Char, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 24749                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24750                                  
 24751                                  _$P_Do_CAPS_String:
 24752 00001820 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 24753 00001821 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 24754 00001822 88C2                    	mov	dl,al			;AN000; save info id
 24755                                  
 24756                                  _$P_DCS_Loop:				;AN000;
 24757 00001824 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; load charater and
 24758 00001827 E80404                  	call	_$P_Chk_DBCS		;AN000; check if DBCS leading byte
 24759 0000182A 720C                    	jc	short _$P_DCS00		;AN000; if yes, do not need CAPS
 24760                                  
 24761 0000182C 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?
 24762 0000182E 740C                    	jz	short _$P_DCS_Exit	;AN000; then exit.
 24763                                  
 24764 00001830 E80C00                  	call	_$P_Do_CAPS_Char 	;AN000; Here a SBCS char need to be CAPS
 24765 00001833 2E8804                  	mov	[cs:si],al		;AN000; stored upper case char to buffer
 24766 00001836 EB01                    	jmp	short _$P_DCS01		;AN000; process next
 24767                                  _$P_DCS00:				;AN000;
 24768 00001838 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip DBCS leading and trailing byte
 24769                                  _$P_DCS01:				;AN000;
 24770 00001839 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; si point to next byte
 24771 0000183A EBE8                    	jmp	short _$P_DCS_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 24772                                  _$P_DCS_Exit:				;AN000;
 24773 0000183C 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 24774 0000183D 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 24775 0000183E C3                      	retn

 24777                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24778                                  ; _$P_Do_CAPS_Char;
 24779                                  ;
 24780                                  ; Function: Perform capitalization along with the file case map table
 24781                                  ;	    or character case map table.
 24782                                  ;
 24783                                  ; Input:    DL = 2 : Use character table
 24784                                  ;	    DL = 4 : Use file table
 24785                                  ;	    AL = character to be capitalized

 24795                                  
 24796 00001843 3C61                    	cmp	al,"a"                  ;AN000; if no,
 24797 00001845 7234                    	jb	short _$P_CAPS_Ret	;AN000;   check if  "a" <= AL <= "z"
 24798

 24805 0000184D C3                      	retn

 24871                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24872                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 24873                                  ;
 24874                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 24875                                  ;	     and make result buffer.

 25123                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25124                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 25125                                  ;
 25126                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 25127                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 25128                                  ;
 25129                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 25130                                  ;
 25131                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 25132                                  ;
 25133                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 25134                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25135                                  
 25136                                  	; 26/10/2022
 25137                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 25138 00001987 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 25139 00001988 2EF606[2314]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 25140 0000198E 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 25141                                  
 25142 00001990 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 25143 00001991 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25144                                  
 25145                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 25146 00001992 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 25147 00001993 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 25148                                  
 25149 00001995 F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 25150 00001996 C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 25151                                  
 25152                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 25153                                  _$P_0099Err: ; 14/08/2023
 25154 00001997 F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 25155                                  _$P_0099Err2: ; 14/08/2023
 25156 00001998 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25861                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25862                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 25863                                  ;
 25864                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 25865                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 25866                                  ;
 25867                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25868                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 25869                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 25870                                  ;
 25871                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 25872                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 25873                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 25874                                  
 25875                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 25876                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 25877                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 25878                                  ;
 25879                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 25880                                  
 25881                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 25882                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25883                                  
 25884                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 25885                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 25886                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 25887                                  	; 14/08/2023
 25888 00001C15 BD[2C14]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 25889                                  
 25890                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 25891 00001C18 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 25892 00001C1A 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 25893                                  
 25894                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 25895 00001C1C 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25896 00001C1E 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 25897                                  
 25898 00001C20 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 25899                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25900                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25901 00001C21 C3                      	retn
 25902                                  
 25903                                  ; 12/12/2022
 25904                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 25905                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 25906                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25907                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 25908                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25909                                  
 25910                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 25911                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 25912 00001C22 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25913 00001C24 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 25914                                  
 25915 00001C26 2E800E[2314]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 25916                                  ;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25917                                  
 25918                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25919                                  	; cf=0
 25920                                  	;retn
 25921                                  
 25922                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 25923                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25924                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 25925 00001C2C F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 25926                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 25927                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 25928 00001C2D C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25972 00001C4D 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 25973 00001C4E 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 25974 00001C4F 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 25975 00001C50 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25976 00001C51 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25977 00001C52 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25978 00001C53 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 25979                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 25980 00001C55 2E8936[1E14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 25981 00001C5A 2E891E[2014]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 25982                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 25983                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 25984                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 25985                                  	; 14/08/2023
 25986 00001C5F 2EC536[1E14]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 25987                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 25988 00001C64 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 25989 00001C67 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 25990 00001C69 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 25991 00001C6B 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 25992 00001C6D 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 25993 00001C70 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 25994 00001C72 F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 25995 00001C73 EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 25996                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 25997 00001C75 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 25998 00001C76 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 25999                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 26000 00001C77 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 26001                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 26002                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26003                                  	; cf=0
 26004                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 26005                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 26006 00001C79 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26007 00001C7A 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 26008 00001C7B 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 26009 00001C7C C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 26020                                  
 26021                                  struc p_parms
 26022 00000000 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?
 26023 00000002 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; an extra delimiter list
 26024 00000003 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; length is 1
 26025 00000004 ??                      	resb 	1	; db ';' ; delimiter
 26026                                  .size:
 26027                                  endstruc
 26028                                  
 26029                                  struc p_pos
 26030 00000000 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; numeric value??
 26031 00000002 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; function
 26032 00000004 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; result value buffer
 26033                                  
 26034                                  ; note: by defining result_val before this structure, we could remove
 26035                                  ;  the "result_val" from every structure invocation
 26036                                  
 26037 00000006 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; value list
 26038 00000008 ??                      	resb	1	; db 0	; no switches/keywords
 26039                                  .size:
 26040                                  endstruc
 26041                                  
 26042                                  struc	p_range
 26043 00000000 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; range definition
 26044 00000001 ??                      	resb 	1	; db 1	; 1 definition of range
 26045 00000002 ??                      	resb 	1	; db 1	; item tag for this range
 26046 00000003 ????????                	resd	1	; dd ?	; numeric min
 26047 00000007 ????????                	resd	1	; dd ?	; numeric max
 26048                                  .size:
 26049                                  endstruc

 26563                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 26564                                  
 26565                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26566                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26567                                  
 26568                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 26569                                  ;
 26570                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 26571                                  ;
 26572                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26573                                  ;
 26574                                  ;   Modification log:
 26575                                  ;
 26576                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 26577                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 26578                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 26579                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 26580                                  ;
 26581                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26582                                  ;
 26583                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 26584                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 26585                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 26586                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 26587                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 26588                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 26589                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 26590                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 26591                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 26592                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 26593                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 26594                                  ;
 26595                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26596                                  
 26597                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 26598                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 26599                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 26600                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 26601                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 26602                                  
 26603                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 26604                                  
 26605                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 26606                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 26607                                  
 26608                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 26609                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 26610                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 26611                                  
 26612                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 26613                                  ;
 26614                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 26615                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 26616                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 26617                                  ;	           line.
 26618                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 26619                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 26620                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 26621                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 26622                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 26623                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 26624                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 26625                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 26626                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 26627                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 26628                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 26629                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 26630                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 26631                                  ;	           for details).
 26632                                  
 26633                                  fInHigh:  db	0
 26634                                  fUmbTiny: db	0
 26635                                  SegLoad:  dw	0
 26636                                  UmbLoad:  db	0
 26637                                  UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 26638                                  UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 26639                                  fm_umb:   db	0
 26640                                  fm_strat: db	0
 26641                                  fm_argc:  db	0	
 26642                                  
 26643                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 26644                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 26645                                  
 26646                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 26647                                  
 26648                                  %endif
 26649                                  
 26650                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****
 26651                                  
 26652                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, SYSCONF.ASM)
 26653                                  ; ((MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS -> SYNINIT:22BAh))
 26654                                  
 26655                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26656                                  ; (SYSINIT:212Bh)	
 26657                                  
 26658                                  		;public	DevEntry
 26659                                  
 26660 00001E60 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 26661 00001E62 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 26662 00001E64 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 26663 00001E66 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 26664 00001E6A 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 26665                                  ; 27/10/2022 
 26666                                  ;ConvLoad:	db	0	; Use conventional (dos 5 -style) InitDevLoad?
 26667                                  ;
 26668 00001E6E 00                      DevUMB:		db	0	; byte indicating whether to load DDs in UMBs
 26669 00001E6F 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; cuurent UMB used fro loading devices (paras)
 26670 00001E71 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)
 26671 00001E73 0000                    DevUMBFree:	dw	0	; Start of free are in the current UMB (paras)
 26672                                  ;
 26673 00001E75 00000000                DevXMSAddr:	dd	0
 26674                                  ;
 26675 00001E79 0000                    DevExecAddr:	dw	0	; Device load address parameter to Exec call
 26676 00001E7B 0000                    DevExecReloc:	dw	0	; Device load relocation factor
 26677                                  ;
 26678 00001E7D 00                      DeviceHi:	db	0	; Flag indicating whther the current device
 26679                                  				;  is being loaded into UMB
 26680 00001E7E 0000                    DevSizeOption:	dw	0	; SIZE= option
 26681                                  ;
 26682 00001E80 00                      Int12Lied:	db	0	; did we trap int 12 ?
 26683 00001E81 0000                    OldInt12Mem:	dw	0	; value in 40:13h (int 12 ram)
 26684 00001E83 50524F544D414E24        ThreeComName:	db	'PROTMAN$'	; 3Com Device name
 26685                                  ;
 26686 00001E8B 00                      FirstUMBLinked:	db	0
 26687 00001E8C 0000                    DevDOSData:	dw	0	; segment of DOS Data
 26688 00001E8E 00000000                DevCmdLine:	dd	0	; Current Command line
 26689 00001E92 00                      DevSavedDelim:	db	0	; The delimiter which was replaced with null
 26690                                  				; to use the file name in the command line
 26691                                  ;

 26700                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26701                                  ; (SYSINIT:215Eh)
