 26703                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26704                                  ;
 26705                                  ; procedure : doconf
 26706                                  ;
 26707                                  ;             Config file is parsed initially with this routine. For the
 26708                                  ;             Subsequent passes 'multi_pass' entry is used .
 26709                                  ;
 26710                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26711                                  
 26712                                  	; 27/10/2022
 26713                                  doconf:
 26714 00001E93 0E                      	push	cs
 26715 00001E94 1F                      	pop	ds
 26716                                  
 26717 00001E95 B80037                  	mov	ax,3700h
 26718                                          ;mov	ax,(CHAR_OPER<<8)	; get switch character
 26719 00001E98 CD21                    	int	21h
 26720 00001E9A 8816[AA02]              	mov	[command_line+1],dl	; set in default command line
 26721                                  
 26722                                  ; 27/10/2022
 26723                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26724                                  ;	;mov	[command_line-1],dl     ; save default switchchar
 26725                                  ;	mov	[def_swchr],dl ; 31/03/2019 
 26726                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 26727                                  
 26728 00001E9E BA[0333]                	mov	dx,config ;'\CONFIG.SYS' ;now pointing to file description
 26729 00001EA1 B8003D                  	mov	ax,3D00h
 26730                                  	;mov	ax,OPEN<<8		;open file "config.sys"
 26731 00001EA4 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 26732 00001EA5 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 26733 00001EA7 7306                    	jnc	short noprob		; brif opened okay
 26734                                  
 26735                                  ; 27/10/2022
 26736                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26737                                  ;      	call	kbd_read		; we still want to give the guy
 26738                                  ;					; a chance to select clean boot!
 26739                                  ;;endif					; (ie, no autoexec.bat processing)
 26740 00001EA9 C606[4903]0B            	mov	byte [multi_pass_id],11	; set it to unreasonable number
 26741 00001EAE C3                      	retn
 26742                                  noprob: 				;get file size (note < 64k!!)
 26743 00001EAF 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax  ; File handle
 26744 00001EB1 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 26745 00001EB3 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 26746                                  	;mov	ax,4202h
 26747 00001EB5 B80242                  	mov	ax,(LSEEK<<8)|2
 26748 00001EB8 CD21                    	int	21h
 26749 00001EBA A3[D203]                	mov	[count],ax
 26750                                  
 26751 00001EBD 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 26752                                  	;mov	ax,4200h
 26753 00001EBF B80042                  	mov	ax,LSEEK<<8		;reset pointer to beginning of file
 26754 00001EC2 CD21                    	int	21h
 26755                                  
 26756                                  	;mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]		;use current alloclim value
 26757                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26758 00001EC4 8B16[A102]              	mov	dx,[top_of_cdss] 
 26759                                  
 26760 00001EC8 A1[D203]                	mov	ax,[count]
 26761 00001ECB A3[4C03]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 26762 00001ECE E8D3F1                  	call	ParaRound
 26763 00001ED1 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 26764                                  
 26765                                  ; 27/10/2022
 26766                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26767                                  ;;
 26768                                  ;;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 26769                                  ;;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 26770                                  ;;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 26771                                  ;;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 26772                                  ;;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 26773                                  ;;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 26774                                  ;;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 26775                                  ;;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 26776                                  ;;
 26777                                  ;       dec     dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 26778                                  ;       mov     [config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 26779                                  ;       sub     dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 26780                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 26781                                  
 26782 00001ED3 83EA11                  	sub	dx,11h			;room for header
 26783                                  	
 26784                                  	;mov	[ALLOCLIM],dx		;config starts here. new alloclim value.
 26785                                  	;mov	[CONFBOT],dx
 26786                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26787 00001ED6 8916[A102]              	mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 26788 00001EDA E8E8EC                  	call    TempCDS 
 26789                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26790                                  	; ds <> cs 
 26791 00001EDD 2E8B16[A102]            	mov	dx,[cs:top_of_cdss]
 26792                                   
 26793 00001EE2 8EDA                    	mov	ds,dx
 26794 00001EE4 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 26795                                  
 26796 00001EE6 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 26797 00001EE8 2E8B0E[D203]            	mov	cx,[cs:count]
 26798 00001EED B43F                    	mov	ah,3Fh
 26799                                  	;mov	ah,READ  ; 3Fh
 26800 00001EEF F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 26801 00001EF0 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 26802 00001EF2 9C                      	pushf
 26803                                  
 26804                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 26805                                  
 26806 00001EF3 50                      	push	ax
 26807 00001EF4 57                      	push	di
 26808 00001EF5 51                      	push	cx
 26809 00001EF6 B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 26810 00001EF8 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 26811 00001EFA E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 26812 00001EFC F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 26813 00001EFE 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 26814                                  
 26815                                  ; we found a 1a. back up
 26816                                  
 26817 00001F00 4F                      	dec	di			; backup past 1Ah
 26818                                  
 26819                                  ;  just for the halibut, stick in an extra eol
 26820                                  
 26821                                  puteol:
 26822 00001F01 B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 26823 00001F03 AA                      	stosb
 26824 00001F04 B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 26825 00001F06 AA                      	stosb
 26826 00001F07 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 26827                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26828                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 26829                                  
 26830                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 26831                                  	; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26832 00001F09 0E                      	push	cs
 26833 00001F0A 1F                      	pop	ds
 26834                                  
 26835 00001F0B 893E[D203]              	mov	[count],di		; new count
 26836                                  
 26837 00001F0F 59                      	pop	cx
 26838 00001F10 5F                      	pop	di
 26839 00001F11 58                      	pop	ax
 26840                                  
 26841                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26842                                  	; 27/10/2022
 26843                                  	;push	cs
 26844                                  	;pop	ds
 26845                                  
 26846 00001F12 50                      	push	ax
 26847                                  	;mov	ah,CLOSE
 26848 00001F13 B43E                    	mov	ah,3Eh
 26849 00001F15 CD21                    	int	21h
 26850 00001F17 58                      	pop	ax
 26851 00001F18 9D                      	popf
 26852 00001F19 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;if not we've got a problem
 26853 00001F1B 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax
 26854 00001F1D 742C                    	jz	short getcom		;couldn't read the file
 26855                                  conferr:
 26856 00001F1F BA[0333]                	mov	dx,config		;want to print config error
 26857 00001F22 E83513                  	call	badfil
 26858                                  endconv:
 26859 00001F25 C3                      	retn
 26860                                  
 26861                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26862                                  ;
 26863                                  ; entry : multi_pass
 26864                                  ;
 26865                                  ;             called to execute device=,install= commands
 26866                                  ;
 26867                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26868                                  
 26869                                  	; 27/10/2022
 26870                                  multi_pass:
 26871 00001F26 0E                      	push	cs
 26872 00001F27 1F                      	pop	ds
 26873                                  
 26874 00001F28 803E[4903]0A            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],10
 26875                                  ;jae_endconv:
 26876 00001F2D 73F6                    	jae	short endconv 		; do nothing. just return.
 26877                                  
 26878                                  	;push	word [CONFBOT]
 26879                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26880 00001F2F FF36[A102]              	push	word [top_of_cdss]
 26881 00001F33 07                      	pop	es			; es -> confbot
 26882                                  
 26883 00001F34 8B36[D403]              	mov	si,[org_count]
 26884 00001F38 8936[D203]              	mov	[count],si		; set count
 26885 00001F3C 31F6                    	xor	si,si ; 0
 26886 00001F3E 8936[D603]                      mov     [chrptr],si		; reset chrptr
 26887 00001F42 8936[2B03]                      mov     [linecount],si		; reset linecount
 26888                                  
 26889 00001F46 E89510                  	call	getchr
 26890 00001F49 EB06                    	jmp	short conflp
 26891                                  
 26892                                  getcom:
 26893 00001F4B E8790E                          call    organize                ; organize the file
 26894 00001F4E E88D10                  	call	getchr
 26895                                  conflp: 
 26896 00001F51 72D2                    	jc	short endconv
 26897                                  
 26898 00001F53 FF06[2B03]                      inc     word [linecount]	; increase linecount
 26899                                  
 26900 00001F57 C606[0D14]00            	mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 26901 00001F5C C606[1014]00            	mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.
 26902 00001F61 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 26903 00001F63 7416                    	je	short blank_line	;  then ignore this line.
 26904                                  
 26905                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26906                                  %if 0
 26907                                  
 26908                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26909                                  
 26910                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 26911                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 26912                                  
 26913                                          mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 26914                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 26915                                  	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 26916                                          cmp     byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 26917                                          je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 26918                                  
 26919                                          push    ax                      ;
 26920                                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 26921                                          mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 26922                                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 26923                                          xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 26924                                          mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 26925                                          pop     ax
 26926                                  ;
 26927                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 26928                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 26929                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 26930                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 26931                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 26932                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 26933                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 26934                                  ;   spot.
 26935                                  ;
 26936                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 26937                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 26938                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 26939                                  ;   retrieved.
 26940                                  ;
 26941                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 26942                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 26943                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 26944                                  	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 26945                                          jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 26946                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 26947                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 26948                                  final:                                  ;
 26949                                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 26950                                  not_final:                              ;
 26951                                  ;endif
 26952                                  
 26953                                  %endif
 26954 00001F65 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 26955 00001F67 E87410                  	call	getchr
 26956 00001F6A 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 26957                                  
 26958 00001F6C 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2
 26959                                  	;jae	short jae_endconv	; do not show badop again for multi_pass.
 26960                                  	; 27/10/2022
 26961 00001F71 73B2                    	jnb	short endconv	
 26962 00001F73 E9FB06                  	jmp	badop
 26963                                  	
 26964                                  coff:	
 26965                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26966                                  	; ds = cs
 26967                                  	;push	cs
 26968                                  	;pop	ds
 26969 00001F76 E85C10                  	call	newline
 26970 00001F79 EBD6                    	jmp	short conflp	; 13/05/2019
 26971                                  
 26972                                  blank_line:
 26973 00001F7B E86010                  	call	getchr
 26974 00001F7E EBD1                    	jmp	short conflp
 26975                                  
 26976                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26977                                  ; 11/12/2022
 26978                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)
 26979                                  ;coff_p:
 26980                                  	;push	cs
 26981                                  	;pop	ds
 26982                                  
 26983                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 26984                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 26985                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 26986                                  ;install= command.
 26987                                  
 26988                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26989                                  ;install command
 26990                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26991                                  
 26992                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26993                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 26994                                  tryi:
 26995 00001F80 803E[4903]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI
 26996 00001F85 7503                    	jne	short not_init_pass
 26997 00001F87 E92301                  	jmp	multi_try_doshi
 26998                                  not_init_pass:
 26999 00001F8A 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; the second pass was for ifs=
 27000                                          ; 11/12/2022
 27001                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2	; now it is NOPs
 27002 00001F8F 74E5                    	je	short coff
 27003                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27004                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 27005                                  					; This pass can be made use of if
 27006                                  					; we want do some config.sys process
 27007                                  					; after device drivers are loaded
 27008                                  					; and before install= commands
 27009                                  					; are processed
 27010                                  
 27011 00001F91 803E[4903]03            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; the third pass for install= ?
 27012 00001F96 7411                    	je	short multi_try_i
 27013 00001F98 80FC48                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_DOS  ; 'H'
 27014                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27015                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2
 27016 00001F9B 74D9                    	je	short coff
 27017                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27018                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 27019                                  
 27020                                  ;       make note of any INSTALL= or INSTALLHIGH= commands we find,
 27021                                  ;       but don't process them now.        
 27022                                          
 27023 00001F9D 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I'	; install= command?
 27024                                  	;jne	short precheck_installhigh ; the first pass is for normal operation.
 27025                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27026 00001FA0 752A                    	jne	short tryb	
 27027                                  	
 27028                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; set the flag
 27029 00001FA2 800E[4A03]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 27030                                  multi_pass_coff2:
 27031 00001FA7 EBCD                    	jmp	short coff ; 13/05/2019	; and handles the next command
 27032                                  
 27033                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27034                                  ;precheck_installhigh:
 27035                                  ;       cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH ; 'W' ; signifier for INSTALLHIGH
 27036                                  ;       jne     short tryb		; carry on with normal processing
 27037                                  ;	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 27038                                  ;	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 27039                                  ;       jmp	short coff
 27040                                  
 27041                                  multi_try_i:
 27042 00001FA9 80FC49                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I' ; install= command?
 27043                                  	;jne	short multi_try_n	; no, check for installhigh
 27044                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27045 00001FAC 7505                    	jne	short multi_pass_filter
 27046                                  
 27047                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27048                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27049                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 27050                                  ;       jc	short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27051                                  ;;endif
 27052                                  
 27053 00001FAE E873F0                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 27054 00001FB1 EBC3                    	jmp	short coff		;to handle next install= command.
 27055                                  
 27056                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27057                                  %if 0
 27058                                  
 27059                                  multi_try_n:
 27060                                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH   ; installhigh= command?
 27061                                          jne	short multi_pass_filter	; no. ignore this.
 27062                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27063                                          call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 27064                                          jc      short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27065                                  ;endif
 27066                                  
 27067                                  ;       The memory environment is in its normal DOS state, so do
 27068                                  ;       the standard calls to set the alloc strategy for loading high
 27069                                  
 27070                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|0 ; 5800h
 27071                                  	int	21h			;get alloc strategy
 27072                                  	mov	bx,ax
 27073                                          push    bx                      ; save for the return
 27074                                  
 27075                                          or	bx,HIGH_FIRST  ; 80h	;set alloc to HighFirst
 27076                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1 ; 5801h
 27077                                  	int	21h			;set alloc strategy
 27078                                  
 27079                                  	mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|2 ; 5802h
 27080                                          int     21h                     ; get link state
 27081                                          xor     ah,ah                   ; clear top byte
 27082                                          push    ax                      ; save for return
 27083                                  
 27084                                          mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3 ; 5803h
 27085                                  	mov	bx,1
 27086                                  	int	21h			;link in UMBs
 27087                                  
 27088                                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 27089                                  
 27090                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3
 27091                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original link state
 27092                                          int     21h
 27093                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original alloc strategy
 27094                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1
 27095                                          int     21h
 27096                                  
 27097                                  	jmp	coff			;to handle next install= command.
 27098                                  
 27099                                  %endif
 27100                                  
 27101                                  multi_pass_filter:
 27102 00001FB3 80FC59                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_COMMENT ; 'Y' ; comment?
 27103 00001FB6 740A                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 27104 00001FB8 80FC5A                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_UNKNOWN ; 'Z' ; bad command?
 27105 00001FBB 7405                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 27106 00001FBD 80FC30                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_REM  ; '0' 	; rem?
 27107 00001FC0 7508                    	jne	short multi_pass_coff 	; ignore the rest of the commands.
 27108                                  
 27109                                  multi_pass_adjust:			; these commands need to
 27110 00001FC2 FF0E[D603]              	dec	word [chrptr]		;  adjust chrptr,count
 27111 00001FC6 FF06[D203]              	inc	word [count]		;  for newline proc.
 27112                                  
 27113                                  multi_pass_coff:
 27114                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27115 00001FCA EBAA                    	jmp	short coff		; to handle next install= commands.

 27117                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27118                                  ; buffer command
 27119                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27120                                  
 27121                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27122                                  ;									      *
 27123                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 27124                                  ;									      *
 27125                                  ; input :								      *
 27126                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 27127                                  ; output:								      *
 27128                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 27129                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 27130                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 27131                                  ;									      *
 27132                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 27133                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 27134                                  ; logic:								      *
 27135                                  ; {									      *
 27136                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 27137                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 27138                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 27139                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 27140                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 27141                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 27142                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 27143                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 27144                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 27145                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 27146                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 27147                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 27148                                  ;	};								      *
 27149                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 27150                                  ; };									      *
 27151                                  ;									      *
 27152                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27153                                  
 27154                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27155                                  	; (SYSINIT:229Ch)
 27156                                  tryb:
 27157 00001FCC 80FC42                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BUFFERS ; 'B'
 27158 00001FCF 7557                    	jne	short tryc
 27159                                  
 27160                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27161                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27162                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 27163                                  ;       jc      short tryc		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27164                                  ;;endif
 27165                                  
 27166                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27167                                  	; 18/12/2022
 27168 00001FD1 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 27169                                  	;mov	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],0 ; 31/03/2019
 27170 00001FD3 880E[C41C]              	mov	[p_buffer_slash_x],cl ; 0
 27171                                  
 27172 00001FD7 BF[7D1C]                	mov	di,buf_parms
 27173                                  	;xor	cx,cx	; 18/12/2022
 27174                                  	; 04/01/2023
 27175                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 27176                                  do7:
 27177 00001FDA E87506                  	call	sysinit_parse
 27178 00001FDD 7303                    	jnc	short if7		; parse error,
 27179                                  	; 04/01/2023
 27180                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  and show messages and end the search loop.
 27181                                  	;;jmp	short sr7
 27182                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27183                                  ;sr7:
 27184                                  	;jmp	coff
 27185                                  	; 04/01/2023
 27186 00001FDF E9EE05                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 27187                                  if7:
 27188 00001FE2 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL ; 0FFFFh	; end of line?
 27189 00001FE5 741A                    	je	short en7		;  then jmp to $endloop for semantic check
 27190                                  	;cmp	word [result_val_swoff],switch_x
 27191 00001FE7 813E[C81C][BD1C]        	cmp	word [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],switch_x
 27192                                  	;jne	short if11
 27193                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27194 00001FED 74EB                    	je	short do7 ;je short en11
 27195                                  
 27196                                  ;	mov	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],1 ; set the flag M016
 27197                                  	;jmp	short en11 ; 31/12/2022
 27198                                  if11:
 27199                                  	;mov	ax,[rv_dword]
 27200 00001FEF A1[CA1C]                	mov	ax,[result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.Picked_Val]
 27201 00001FF2 83F901                  	cmp	cx,1
 27202 00001FF5 7505                    	jne	short if13
 27203                                  
 27204 00001FF7 A3[C01C]                	mov	[p_buffers],ax
 27205                                  	;jmp	short en11
 27206                                  	; 31/12/2022

 27223 00002013 A1[C01C]                	mov	ax,[p_buffers]	; we don't have any problem.
 27224 00002016 A3[9702]                	mov	[buffers],ax	; now,let's set it really.
 27225                                  
 27226 00002019 A1[C21C]                	mov	ax,[p_h_buffers]
 27227 0000201C A3[9902]                	mov	[h_buffers],ax

 27238 00002025 E94EFF                  	jmp	coff

 27241                                  ; break command
 27242                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27243                                  
 27244                                  ;****************************************************************************
 27245                                  ;									    *
 27246                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 27247                                  ;									    *
 27248                                  ; input :								    *
 27249                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 27250                                  ; output:								    *
 27251                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 27252                                  ;									    *
 27253                                  ; subroutines to be called:						    *
 27254                                  ;	sysinit_parse							    *
 27255                                  ; logic:								    *
 27256                                  ; {									    *
 27257                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						    *
 27258                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						    *
 27259                                  ;	while (end of command line)					    *
 27260                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						    *
 27261                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *
 27262                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *
 27263                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,on;					    *
 27264                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */ *
 27265                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,off;				    *
 27266                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				    *
 27267                                  ;	};								    *
 27268                                  ;	if (no error) then						    *
 27269                                  ;	   dos function call to set ctrl_break check according to	    *

 27271                                  ;									    *
 27272                                  ;****************************************************************************
 27273                                  
 27274                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27275                                  	; (SYSINIT:22FFh)
 27276                                  tryc:
 27277 00002028 80FC43                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BREAK ; 'C'
 27278 0000202B 7534                    	jne	short trym
 27279                                  
 27280                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27281                                  ;;ifdef MULTI_CONFIG

 27283                                  ;       jc	short trym		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27284                                  ;;endif
 27285 0000202D BF[CE1C]                	mov	di,brk_parms
 27286 00002030 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 27287                                  	; 04/01/2023
 27288                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 27289                                  do22:
 27290 00002032 E81D06                  	call	sysinit_parse
 27291 00002035 7303                    	jnc	short if22		; parse error
 27292                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  show message and end the search loop.
 27293                                  	;;jmp	short sr22
 27294                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27295                                  ;sr22:
 27296                                  	;jmp	coff
 27297                                  	; 04/01/2023
 27298 00002037 E99605                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 27299                                  if22:
 27300 0000203A 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL		; end of line?
 27301 0000203D 7415                    	je	short en22		; then end the $endloop
 27302                                  
 27303                                  	;cmp	byte [result_val_itag],1
 27304 0000203F 803E[C71C]01            	cmp	byte [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],1
 27305 00002044 7507                    	jne	short if26
 27306                                  
 27307 00002046 C606[F31C]01            	mov	byte [p_ctrl_break],1	; turn it on

 27331                                  ;									      *

 27333                                  ;									      *

 28667                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28668                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 28669                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 28670                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 28671                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 28672                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 28673                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 28674                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 28675                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28676                                  
 28677                                  ;**************************************************************************
 28678                                  ;									  *
 28679                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 28680                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 28681                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 28682                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 28683                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 28684                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 28685                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 28686                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 28687                                  ; input :								  *
 28688                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 28689                                  ; output:								  *
 28690                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 28691                                  ;									  *
 28692                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 28693                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 28694                                  ; logic:								  *
 28695                                  ; {									  *
 28696                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 28697                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 28698                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 28699                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 28700                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 28701                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 28702                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 28703                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 28704                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 28705                                  ;	     }								  *
 28706                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 28707                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 28708                                  ;	};								  *
 28709                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 28710                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 28711                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 28712                                  ; };									  *
 28713                                  ;**************************************************************************
 28714

 29384                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 29391                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 29392                                  ;	*** after each call.
 29393                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 29394                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 29395                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 29396                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 29397                                  ;	 procedure.

 29399                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code

 29744                                  ;
 29745                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 29746                                  ;
 29747                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 29748                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 29749                                  ;
 29750                                  ;	Output : none
 29751                                  ;
 29752                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 29753                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 29754                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 29755                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 29756                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 29757                                  ;
 29758                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29759                                  
 29760                                  LieInt12Mem:
 29761                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29762                                  	; ds = cs
 29763 000026F7 A1[A302]                	mov	ax,[ALLOCLIM]
 29764                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:ALLOCLIM]	; lie INT 12 as alloclim
 29765                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 29766 000026FA E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 29767 000026FD 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 29768                                  	; 13/05/2019
 29769                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 29770                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 29771                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 29772                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29773                                  	; ds = cs
 29774 000026FF 803E[7D1E]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 29775 00002704 74F0                    	je	short limx
 29776 00002706 A1[641E]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 29777                                  lim_set:
 29778                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 29779                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29780                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 29781                                  ;limx:
 29782                                  	;retn
 29783                                  	
 29784                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 29785                                  
 29786                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29787                                  ;
 29788                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 29789                                  ;
 29790                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 29791                                  ;	Output : none
 29792                                  ;
 29793                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 29794                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 29795                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 29796                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 29797                                  ;
 29798                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29799                                  
 29800                                  	; 01/11/2022
 29801                                  SetInt12Mem:
 29802 00002709 1E                      	push	ds
 29803 0000270A BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 29804 0000270D 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 29805 0000270F 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 29806 00002713 2E891E[811E]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 29807 00002718 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 29808 0000271A D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 29809 0000271C A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 29810 0000271F 2EC606[801E]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 29811 00002725 1F                      	pop	ds
 29812                                  ;limx:
 29813 00002726 C3                      	retn
 29814                                  
 29815                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29816                                  ;
 29817                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 29818                                  ;
 29819                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 29820                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 29821                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 29822                                  ;
 29823                                  ;	Output : none
 29824                                  ;
 29825                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 29826                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 29827                                  ;
 29828                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29829                                  
 29830                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 29831                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29832                                  	; ds = cs
 29833 00002727 803E[801E]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 29834                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 29835                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 29836                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 29837 0000272C 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 29838                                  	; 18/12/2022
 29839 0000272E B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 29840 00002731 8826[801E]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 29841                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 29842                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 29843 00002735 1E                      	push	ds
 29844                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 29845 00002736 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 29846 00002738 2EA1[811E]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 29847 0000273C A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 29848 0000273F 1F                      	pop	ds
 29849                                  timx:
 29850 00002740 C3                      	retn

 29886 00002759 1E                      	push	ds
 29887 0000275A B462                    	mov	ah,62h
 29888 0000275C CD21                    	int	21h	; DOS - 3+ - GET PSP ADDRESS
 29889 0000275E 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx
 29890 00002760 2E8B1E[A302]            	mov	bx,[cs:ALLOCLIM]
 29891                                  	;mov	[2],bx
 29892 00002765 891E0200                	mov	[PDB.BLOCK_LEN],bx
 29893 00002769 1F                      	pop	ds
 29894 0000276A C3                      	retn
 29895                                  
 29896                                  ; M020 : END
 29897                                  
 29898                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29899                                  
 29900                                  ; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 29901                                  
 29902                                  %if 0
 29903                                  
 29904                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 29905                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 29906                                  
 29907                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 29908                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 29909                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 29910                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29911                                  
 29912                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29913                                  ;
 29914                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 29915                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 29916                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 29917                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 29918                                  ;
 29919                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 29920                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 29921                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 29922                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 29923                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 29924                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 29925                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 29926                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 29927                                  ; available during the load.
 29928                                  ;
 29929                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 29930                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 29931                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 29932                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 29933                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 29934                                  ; allocated.  After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 29935                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 29936                                  ;
 29937                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 29938                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 29939                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 29940                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 29941                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 29942                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 29943                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 29944                                  ;
 29945                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29946                                  
 29947                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 29948                                  
 29949                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 29950                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 29951                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 29952                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 29953                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 29954                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 29955                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 29956                                  
 29957                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 29958                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 29959                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 29960                                  
 29961                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29962                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 29963                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29964                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 29965                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 29966                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 29967                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29968                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29969                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1.  Its contents
 29970                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 29971                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29972                                  
 29973                                  InitVar:
 29974                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 29975                                  	push	ax
 29976                                  	push	cx
 29977                                  	push	di
 29978                                  	push	es
 29979                                  
 29980                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 29981                                  	push	cs
 29982                                  	pop	es
 29983                                  
 29984                                  	xor	ax,ax
 29985                                  	mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 29986                                  	mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 29987                                  	mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 29988                                  	mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 29989                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 29990                                  	mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 29991                                  
 29992                                  	cld
 29993                                  
 29994                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 29995                                  	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 29996                                  	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 29997                                  
 29998                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 29999                                  	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 30000                                  	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 30001                                  
 30002                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 30003                                  
 30004                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 30005                                  	pop	es
 30006                                  	pop	di
 30007                                  	pop	cx
 30008                                  	pop	ax	 	
 30009                                  
 30010                                  	retn
 30011                                  
 30012                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30013                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 30014                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30015                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 30016                                  ; EXIT    : None
 30017                                  ; ERROR   : None
 30018                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 30019                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30020                                  
 30021                                  FixMem:
 30022                                  	push	ax
 30023                                  	push	bx
 30024                                  	push	cx
 30025                                  	push	dx
 30026                                  	push	es
 30027                                  
 30028                                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 30029                                  
 30030                                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 30031                                  	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 30032                                  
 30033                                  	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 30034                                  
 30035                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 30036                                  
 30037                                  	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 30038                                  	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 30039                                  	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 30040                                  
 30041                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30042                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 30043                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 30044                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30045                                  
 30046                                  fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 30047                                  	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 30048                                  	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 30049                                  	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 30050                                  
 30051                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 30052                                  
 30053                                  fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 30054                                  	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 30055                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 30056                                  
 30057                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 30058                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 30059                                  	; 14/08/2023
 30060                                  	inc	bx
 30061                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 30062                                  
 30063                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 30064                                  
 30065                                  fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 30066                                  	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 30067                                  
 30068                                  	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 30069                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 30070                                  	inc	bx
 30071                                  	mov	es,bx
 30072                                  
 30073                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 30074                                  	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 30075                                  	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 30076                                  fmX:	
 30077                                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 30078                                  
 30079                                  	pop	es
 30080                                  	pop	dx
 30081                                  	pop	cx
 30082                                  	pop	bx
 30083                                  	pop	ax
 30084                                  
 30085                                  	retn
 30086                                  
 30087                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30088                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 30089                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30090                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 30091                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 30092                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30093                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 30094                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30095                                  
 30096                                  fm_link:
 30097                                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 30098                                  	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 30099                                  
 30100                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 30101                                  	;
 30102                                  	;push	es
 30103                                  	;push	cs
 30104                                  	;pop	es
 30105                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 30106                                  	;pop	es
 30107                                  	
 30108                                  	mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 30109                                  
 30110                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 30111                                  	mov	bx,1
 30112                                  	int	21h
 30113                                  	retn
 30114                                  
 30115                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30116                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 30117                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30118                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 30119                                  ; EXIT:     None
 30120                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30121                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 30122                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30123                                  
 30124                                  fm_unlink:
 30125                                  	xor	bx,bx
 30126                                  	
 30127                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 30128                                  	;
 30129                                  	;push	ds
 30130                                  	;push	cs
 30131                                  	;pop	ds
 30132                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 30133                                  	;pop	ds
 30134                                  	
 30135                                  	mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 30136                                  
 30137                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 30138                                  	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 30139                                  	retn
 30140                                  
 30141                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30142                                  
 30143                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30144                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 30145                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 30146                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30147                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 30148                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 30149                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 30150                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30151                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30152                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 30153                                  ;
 30154                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 30155                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 30156                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30157                                  ;
 30158                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 30159                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 30160                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 30161                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 30162                                  ;
 30163                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 30164                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 30165                                  ;
 30166                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30167                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 30168                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 30169                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 30170                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 30171                                  ;     lh
 30172                                  ;     /l
 30173                                  ;     1
 30174                                  ;     1000
 30175                                  ;     2
 30176                                  ;     print
 30177                                  ;     /d
 30178                                  ;     :lpt2
 30179                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 30180                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 30181                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 30182                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 30183                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 30184                                  ; for:
 30185                                  ;    Each /L
 30186                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 30187                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 30188                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 30189                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 30190                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 30191                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30192                                  
 30193                                  ParseVar:
 30194                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 30195                                  	push	di
 30196                                  	push	ds
 30197                                  	push	es
 30198                                  
 30199                                  	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 30200                                  	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 30201                                  	cld
 30202                                  
 30203                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30204                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 30205                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30206                                  
 30207                                  pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 30208                                  	call	isWhite
 30209                                  	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 30210                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30211                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH
 30212                                  	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 30213                                  
 30214                                  	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 30215                                  	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 30216                                  	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 30217                                  
 30218                                  pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 30219                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 30220                                  	and	al,0DFh
 30221                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 30222                                  	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 30223                                  	jne	short pv30
 30224                                  
 30225                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 30226                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 30227                                  
 30228                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 30229                                  	;
 30230                                  	;push	es
 30231                                  	;push	cs
 30232                                  	;pop	es
 30233                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 30234                                  	;pop	es
 30235                                  
 30236                                  	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 30237                                  
 30238                                  	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 30239                                  
 30240                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 30241                                  	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 30242                                  	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 30243                                  
 30244                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 30245                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 30246                                  
 30247                                  	call	parseL
 30248                                  	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 30249                                  
 30250                                  	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 30251                                  	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 30252                                  
 30253                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 30254                                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30255                                  pvErr:	dec	si
 30256                                  	dec	si
 30257                                  	stc
