 35140                                          call    any_delim       ; allow blank lines and such
 35141                                          je	short menu_nextitem ;
 35142                                          stc                     ;
 35143                                          call    print_error     ; non-MENU command!
 35144                                          jmp     short menu_nextitem
 35145                                  menu_numlock:
 35146                                          call    set_numlock
 35147                                          jmp     short menu_nextitem
 35148                                  to_menu_getdefault:
 35149                                          jmp     short menu_getdefault
 35150                                  
 35151                                  ;   Save the offset of the default block name, we'll need it later
 35152                                  
 35153                                  menu_default:
 35154                                          mov     [offDefBlock],si; save address of default block name
 35155                                          cmp     byte [secElapsed],0
 35156                                          jne	short timeout_skip ; secElapsed is only zero for the FIRST menu,
 35157                                          call    skip_token      ; and for subsequent menus IF nothing was typed;
 35158                                          jc	short menu_nextitem ; secElapsed becomes -1 forever as soon as
 35159                                          call    skip_delim      ; something is typed
 35160                                          jc	short menu_nextitem ;
 35161                                          mov     si,bx           ;
 35162                                          call    get_number      ; get number (of seconds for timeout)
 35163                                          cmp     bl,90           ; limit it to a reasonable number
 35164                                          jb	short timeout_ok ; (besides, 99 is the largest # my simple
 35165                                          mov     bl,90           ;  display function can handle)
 35166                                  timeout_ok:                     ;
 35167                                          mov     [secTimeOut],bl ;
 35168                                  timeout_skip:
 35169                                          jmp     short menu_nextitem
 35170                                  
 35171                                  ;   Verify that this is a valid menu item by searching for the named block
 35172                                  
 35173                                  menu_item:
 35174                                          cmp     dl,MAX_MULTI_CONFIG ; have we reached the max # of items yet?
 35175                                          jae	short menu_nextitem ;
 35176                                          mov     di,si           ; DS:DI -> block name to search for
 35177                                          call    srch_block      ;
 35178                                          je	short menu_itemfound ;
 35179                                          stc                     ;
 35180                                          call    print_error     ; print error and pause
 35181                                          jmp     short menu_nextitem ; if not found, ignore this menu item
 35182                                  
 35183                                  ;   srch_block, having succeeded, returns DI -> past the token that it
 35184                                  ;   just matched, which in this case should be a descriptive string; ES:SI
 35185                                  ;   and CX are unmodified
 35186                                  
 35187                                  menu_itemfound:
 35188                                          inc     dx              ; otherwise, increment total block count
 35189                                          mov     bx,dx           ; and use it to index the arrays of offsets
 35190                                          mov	[abBlockType+bx],al
 35191                                          add     bx,bx           ; of recorded block names and descriptions
 35192                                  
 35193                                  ;   There should be a description immediately following the block name on
 35194                                  ;   MENUITEM line; failing that, we'll just use the block name as the
 35195                                  ;   description...
 35196                                  
 35197                                          mov     [aoffBlockName+bx],si
 35198                                          mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],si
 35199                                          mov     di,bx           ; skip_delim modifies BX, so stash it in DI
 35200                                          call    skip_token      ;
 35201                                          jc	short menu_nextitem ; hit eol/eof
 35202                                          call    skip_delim      ;
 35203                                          jc	short menu_nextitem ; hit eol/eof
 35204                                          xchg    bx,di           ;
 35205                                          mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],di
 35206                                  
 35207                                  menu_nextitem:
 35208                                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 35209                                          jmp     menu_process    ; go back for more lines
 35210                                  
 35211                                  ;   Display menu items now, after determining which one is default
 35212                                  
 35213                                  menu_getdefault:
 35214                                          or      dl,dl           ; where there any valid blocks at all?
 35215                                          jnz	short menu_valid ; yes
 35216                                          sub     bx,bx           ; no, so force autoselect of 0
 35217                                          jmp     menu_autoselect ; (meaning: process common blocks only)
 35218                                  menu_valid:
 35219                                          sub     bx,bx           ;
 35220                                          mov     [bMaxBlock],dl  ; first, record how many blocks we found
 35221                                          mov     di,[offDefBlock];
 35222                                          or      di,di           ; does a default block exist?
 35223                                          jz	short menu_nodefault ; no
 35224                                          inc     bx              ; yes, walk name table, looking for default
 35225                                  menu_chkdefault:
 35226                                          push    bx              ;
 35227                                          add     bx,bx           ;
 35228                                          mov     si,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 35229                                          mov     cx,128          ; arbitrary maximum length of a name
 35230                                          push    ds              ;
 35231                                          push    es              ;
 35232                                          pop     ds              ;
 35233                                          call    comp_names      ; is this block the same as the default?
 35234                                          pop     ds              ;
 35235                                          pop     bx              ;
 35236                                          je	short menu_setdefault ; yes
 35237                                          inc     bx              ;
 35238                                          cmp     bl,[bMaxBlock]  ; all done searching?
 35239                                          jbe	short menu_chkdefault ; not yet
 35240                                  menu_nodefault:
 35241                                          mov     bl,1            ; if no default, force default to #1
 35242                                  menu_setdefault:
 35243                                          mov     [bDefBlock],bl  ; yes, this will be the initial current block
 35244                                  
 35245                                  ;   If the timeout was explicitly set to 0 (or technically, anything that
 35246                                  ;   failed to resolve to a number, like "NONE" or "EAT POTATOES"), then we're
 35247                                  ;   supposed to skip menu display and run with the specified default block;
 35248                                  ;   however, if the user hit Enter prior to boot, thereby requesting fully
 35249                                  ;   INTERACTIVE boot, then we shall display the menu block anyway (though still
 35250                                  ;   with no timeout)
 35251                                  
 35252                                          cmp     byte [secTimeOut],0 ; is timeout zero? (ie, assume default)
 35253                                          jne	short menu_display ; no
 35254                                          test    byte [bQueryOpt],1 ; yes, but was INTERACTIVE requested?
 35255                                          jnz	short menu_display ; yes, so *don't* assume default after all
 35256                                          jmp     not_topmenu	;
 35257                                  
 35258                                  ;   Reset the mode, so that we know screen is clean and cursor is home
 35259                                  
 35260                                  menu_display:
 35261                                          mov     ah,0Fh          ; get current video mode
 35262                                          int     10h             ;
 35263                                          mov     ah,00h          ; just re-select that mode
 35264                                          int     10h             ;
 35265                                          push    es              ;
 35266                                          mov     ax,40h          ; reach down into the ROM BIOS data area
 35267                                          mov     es,ax           ; and save the current (default) video page
 35268                                          mov     ax,[es:004Eh]   ; start address and page #, in case the
 35269                                          mov     [wCRTStart],ax  ; undocumented QUIET option was enabled
 35270                                          mov     al,[es:0062h]   ;
 35271                                          mov     [bCRTPage],al   ;
 35272                                          mov     ax,[bMenuPage]	; select new page for menu
 35273                                          int     10h             ;
 35274                                          mov     ax,0600h        ; clear entire screen
 35275                                          mov     bh,[bMenuColor] ; using this color
 35276                                          sub     cx,cx           ; upper left row/col
 35277                                          ;mov	dl,[es:CRT_Cols] 
 35278                                          mov	dl,[es:4Ah]
 35279                                  	dec     dl              ;
 35280                                          ;mov	dh,[es:CRT_Rows];
 35281                                          mov	dh,[es:84h]
 35282                                  	or      dh,dh           ; # of rows valid?
 35283                                          jnz	short menu_clear ; hopefully
 35284                                          mov     dh,[bLastRow]   ; no, use a default
 35285                                  menu_clear:
 35286                                          int     10h             ; clear the screen using the req. attribute
 35287                                          pop     es              ;
 35288                                          mov     [bLastRow],dh   ; save DH
 35289                                          mov     dx,_$MenuHeader
 35290                                          call    print           ; cursor now on row 3 (numbered from 0)
 35291                                  
 35292                                          test    byte [bDisableUI],1
 35293                                          jnz     short menu_nostatus
 35294                                          mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ;
 35295                                          mov     dh,[bLastRow]   ; restore DH
 35296                                          mov     dl,0            ; print the status line on row DH, col 0,
 35297                                          mov     ah,02h          ; now that we can trash the cursor position
 35298                                          int     10h             ;
 35299                                          mov     dx,_$StatusLine
 35300                                          call    print           ;
 35301                                          mov     ah,3            ; get cursor position
 35302                                          int     10h             ;
 35303                                          sub     dl,2            ;
 35304                                          mov     [bLastCol],dl   ; save column where status char will go
 35305                                  
 35306                                  menu_nostatus:
 35307                                          mov     bx,1            ; now prepare to display all the menu items
 35308                                  menu_disploop:
 35309                                          call    print_item	; print item #BL
 35310                                          inc     bx              ; why "inc bx"?  because it's a 1-byte opcode
 35311                                          cmp     bl,[bMaxBlock]  ; all done?
 35312                                          jbe	short menu_disploop ; not yet
 35313                                  
 35314                                  ;   Set cursor position to just below the menu items
 35315                                  
 35316                                          mov     dl,0            ; select column
 35317                                          mov     dh,bl           ;
 35318                                          add     dh,4            ; select row below menu
 35319                                          mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ;
 35320                                          mov     ah,02h          ; set cursor position beneath the block list
 35321                                          int     10h             ;
 35322                                  
 35323                                          mov     dx,_$MenuPrmpt
 35324                                          call    print           ;
 35325                                          call    select_item     ; make a selection, return # in BX
 35326                                          mov     dx,crlfm	
 35327                                          call    print           ;
 35328                                          push    word [bDisableUI]
 35329                                          or      byte [bDisableUI],1
 35330                                          call    show_status     ; clear the status line now
 35331                                          pop     word [bDisableUI]
 35332                                  
 35333                                  ;   Now begins the "re-organization" process...
 35334                                  
 35335                                  menu_autoselect:
 35336                                          cmp     bx,-1           ; clean boot requested?
 35337                                          jne	short normal_boot ; no
 35338                                          call    disable_autoexec; basically, add a /D to the command.com line
 35339                                  menu_abort:
 35340                                          sub     cx,cx           ; then immediately exit with 0 config.sys image
 35341                                          jmp	menu_exit	;
 35342                                  
 35343                                  normal_boot:
 35344                                          cmp     bx,-2           ; back to top-level menu?
 35345                                          jne	short not_topmenu ; no
 35346                                          mov     cx,[count]      ; yes, start all over
 35347                                          sub     si,si           ;
 35348                                          jmp     menu_search
 35349                                  
 35350                                  not_topmenu:
 35351                                          cmp     byte [abBlockType+bx],CONFIG_SUBMENU
 35352                                          jne	short not_submenu
 35353                                          add     bx,bx           ;
 35354                                          mov     di,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 35355                                          call    srch_block      ; THIS CANNOT FAIL!
 35356                                          mov     si,di           ;
 35357                                          mov     cx,bx           ; ES:SI and CX are ready for another round
 35358                                          jmp     menu_found
 35359                                  
 35360                                  not_submenu:
 35361                                          add     bx,bx           ; get BX -> name of selected block
 35362                                          mov     bx,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 35363                                  
 35364                                  ;   BX should now either be ZERO (meaning no block has been selected) or
 35365                                  ;   the offset relative to ES of the block name to be processed (along with
 35366                                  ;   all the "common" lines of course)
 35367                                  
 35368                                  no_selection:
 35369                                          mov     [offDefBlock],bx; save selection
 35370                                          mov     cx,[count]      ; reset ES:SI and CX for reprocessing
 35371                                          sub     si,si           ;
 35372                                          push    ds              ;
 35373                                          mov     ds,[config_wrkseg]; this is where we'll store new config.sys image
 35374                                          sub     di,di           ;
 35375                                  
 35376                                  ;   ES:SI-> config.sys, DS:DI -> new config.sys workspace
 35377                                  ;
 35378                                  ;   Work our way through the config.sys image again, this time copying
 35379                                  ;   all lines that are (A) "common" lines outside any block or (B) lines
 35380                                  ;   within the requested block.  Lines inside INCLUDEd blocks are transparently
 35381                                  ;   copied by copy_block in a recursive fashion;  the amount of recursion is
 35382                                  ;   limited by the fact INCLUDE statements are REMed by copy_block as they are
 35383                                  ;   processed and by the number of unique INCLUDE stmts in config.sys...
 35384                                  ;
 35385                                  ;   BUGBUG 20-Mar-1992 JeffPar: If we can figure out the lower bound of the
 35386                                  ;   stack we're running on, then we should check it inside copy_block
 35387                                  
 35388                                  copyblock_loop:
 35389                                          push    bx              ; save selected block name
 35390                                          call    copy_block      ; process (named or common) block
 35391                                          pop     bx              ;
 35392                                          jc	short move_config ; hit eof
 35393                                  
 35394                                  ;   copy_block can only return for two reasons:  it hit eof or a new block
 35395                                  
 35396                                  copyblock_begin:
 35397                                          push    ax              ;
 35398                                          push    cx              ;
 35399                                          push    si              ;
 35400                                          push    di              ; always do "common" blocks
 35401                                          mov     di,szCommon
 35402                                          push    ds              ;
 35403                                          push    cs              ;
 35404                                          pop     ds              ;
 35405                                          call    comp_names      ;
 35406                                          pop     ds              ;
 35407                                          pop     di              ;
 35408                                          pop     si              ;
 35409                                          pop     cx              ;
 35410                                          pop     ax              ;
 35411                                          je	short copyblock_check
 35412                                          or      bx,bx           ; is there a block name to check?
 35413                                          jz	short copyblock_skip ; no
 35414                                          push    di              ;
 35415                                          mov     di,bx           ; check block against given block name
 35416                                          push    ds              ;
 35417                                          push    es              ;
 35418                                          pop     ds              ;
 35419                                          call    comp_names      ; is this the block we really want to do?
 35420                                          pop     ds              ;
 35421                                          pop     di              ;
 35422                                  copyblock_check:
 35423                                          jc	short move_config ; hit eof
 35424                                          jne	short copyblock_skip  ;
 35425                                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 35426                                          jmp	short copyblock_loop 
 35427                                  
 35428                                  copyblock_skip:                 ;
 35429                                          call    skip_opt_line   ; this ain't the block we wanted, so skip it
 35430                                          call    get_char        ;
 35431                                          jc	short move_config ; hit eof
 35432                                          and     al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; 7Fh
 35433                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ;
 35434                                          je	short copyblock_begin
 35435                                          jmp     short copyblock_skip ; anything else is just skipped
 35436                                  ;
 35437                                  ;   To create as little risk to the rest of SysInit as little as possible,
 35438                                  ;   and to free the workspace at "config_wrkseg" for creating an environment,
 35439                                  ;   copy the new config.sys image to "confbot"
 35440                                  ;
 35441                                  move_config:
 35442                                          mov     cx,di           ; now copy workspace at DS:DI to "confbot"
 35443                                          push    cx              ;
 35444                                  ;
 35445                                  ;   But first, copy the CONFIG=<configuration><0> string to the workspace,
 35446                                  ;   since the configuration name only currently exists in the "confbot" area
 35447                                  ;
 35448                                   	;mov	cx,7
 35449                                  	mov     cx,szMenu-szBoot-1
 35450                                          mov     si,szBoot	; first copy the CONFIG= part
 35451                                          inc     di              ; skip a byte, in case absolutely nothing
 35452                                                                  ; was copied to the workspace, because we always
 35453                                                                  ; zero the first byte of the workspace (below)
 35454                                  copy_boot: 
 35455                                  	;lods    byte ptr cs:[si];
 35456                                          cs
 35457                                  	lodsb
 35458                                  	mov     [di],al         ;
 35459                                          inc     di              ;
 35460                                          loop    copy_boot       ;
 35461                                  
 35462                                          push    es              ; then copy the configuration name
 35463                                          mov     cx,128-7        ; put an upper limit on the name, to be safe
 35464                                          mov     si,[cs:offDefBlock]; ES:SI -> default block name
 35465                                          or      si,si           ; valid?
 35466                                          jnz	short l1	; yes
 35467                                          push    cs              ;
 35468                                          pop     es              ;
 35469                                          mov     si,szCommon
 35470                                  l1:     mov     al,[es:si]      ;
 35471                                          call    any_delim       ;
 35472                                          je	short l2	;
 35473                                          mov     [di],al         ;
 35474                                          inc     si              ;
 35475                                          inc     di              ;
 35476                                          loop    l1              ;
 35477                                  l2:     mov     byte [di],lf	; terminate the configuration string
 35478                                          pop     es              ;
 35479                                  
 35480                                  ;   Now we can copy "config_wrkseg" (DS) to "confbot" (ES)
 35481                                  
 35482                                          sub     di,di           ;
 35483                                          mov     [cs:config_envlen],di
 35484                                          sub     si,si           ;
 35485                                          pop     cx              ; recover the size of "config_wrkseg"
 35486                                  
 35487                                          push    cx              ;
 35488                                          rep     movsb           ; moved!
 35489                                          pop     cx              ;
 35490                                          mov     ax,ds           ;
 35491                                          pop     ds              ;
 35492                                  
 35493                                  ;   Now that the config_wrkseg is available once again, we shall
 35494                                  ;   use it to create an environment. The first thing to go in will be
 35495                                  ;   the "CONFIG=configuration" thing. It is also important to zero
 35496                                  ;   the first byte of the workspace, so that copy_envvar knows the buffer
 35497                                  ;   is empty.
 35498                                  
 35499                                          push    es              ;
 35500                                          mov     es,ax           ;
 35501                                          inc     si              ; ES:SI -> "CONFIG=configuration"
 35502                                          mov     byte [es:0],0	;empty the environment block
 35503                                          call    copy_envvar     ; copy envvar at ES:SI to "config_wrkseg"
 35504                                          pop     es
 35505                                  
 35506                                  ;   Before returning, restore the default video page setting but do NOT
 35507                                  ;   do it using INT 10h's Set Active Page function, because if the menu was
 35508                                  ;   displayed on a different page, then it's because we don't want to see
 35509                                  ;   all the device driver/TSR goop (which goes to the default page)
 35510                                  
 35511                                  menu_done:
 35512                                          cmp     byte [bMenuPage],0
 35513                                          je	short menu_exit	;
 35514                                          push    es              ;
 35515                                          mov     ax,40h          ;
 35516                                          mov     es,ax           ;
 35517                                          mov     ax,[wCRTStart]  ;
 35518                                          mov     [es:004Eh],ax   ;
 35519                                          mov     al,[bCRTPage]   ;
 35520                                          mov     [es:0062h],al   ;
 35521                                          pop     es              ;
 35522                                  menu_exit:
 35523                                          mov     [count],cx      ; set new counts
 35524                                          mov     [org_count],cx  ;
 35525                                          sub     si,si           ; always return ES:SI pointing to config.sys
 35526                                          retn
 35527                                  
 35528                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35529                                  ;
 35530                                  ;   copy_envvar:  copy the envvar at ES:SI to "config_wrkseg"
 35531                                  ;
 35532                                  ;   INPUT
 35533                                  ;    ES:SI -> environment variable (in the form "var=string<cr/lf>")
 35534                                  ;
 35535                                  ;   OUTPUT
 35536                                  ;       config_envlen (ie, where to put next envvar) updated appropriately
 35537                                  ;       carry set if error (eg, missing =); clear otherwise
 35538                                  ;
 35539                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 35540                                  ;       None
 35541                                  ;
 35542                                  ;   NOTES
 35543                                  ;       None
 35544                                  ;
 35545                                  ;   HISTORY
 35546                                  ;       Created 29-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 35547                                  ;
 35548                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35549                                  
 35550                                  copy_envvar:
 35551                                          push    cx              ;
 35552                                          push    si              ;
 35553                                          push    ds              ;
 35554                                          push    es              ;
 35555                                          push    es              ;
 35556                                          mov     es,[config_wrkseg] ; ES:DI to point to next available byte
 35557                                          pop     ds                 ; DS:SI to point to envvar
 35558                                  
 35559                                  ;   Have to calculate the length of the variable name (and if we hit
 35560                                  ;   the end of the line before we hit '=', then it's curtains for this
 35561                                  ;   config.sys line)
 35562                                  ;
 35563                                  ;   The check for NULL is important because copy_envvar is also used to copy
 35564                                  ;   the initial CONFIG= setting, which will have been zapped by a NULL if no
 35565                                  ;   menu block existed (in order to prevent the creation of an environment)
 35566                                  
 35567                                          sub     cx,cx           ;
 35568                                  copy_varlen:                    ;
 35569                                          lodsb                   ;
 35570                                          or      al,al           ; NULL?
 35571                                          stc                     ;
 35572                                          jz	short copy_envexit ; yes, abort
 35573                                          cmp     al,cr          ;
 35574                                          stc                     ;
 35575                                          je	short copy_envexit
 35576                                          cmp     al,lf          ;
 35577                                          stc                     ;
 35578                                          je	short copy_envexit
 35579                                          inc     cx              ;
 35580                                          cmp     al,'='          ;
 35581                                          jne	short copy_varlen
 35582                                          mov     al,0            ;
 35583                                          mov     ah,[si]         ; save char after '='
 35584                                          sub     si,cx           ; back up to given varname
 35585                                          dec     cx              ; CX == # of bytes in varname
 35586                                          sub     di,di           ; start looking for DS:SI at ES:0
 35587                                  copy_varsrch:
 35588                                          cmp     byte [es:di],al
 35589                                          je	short copy_envprep ; search failed, just copy var
 35590                                          mov     bx,di           ; ES:BX -> start of this varname
 35591                                          push    cx              ;
 35592                                          push    si              ;
 35593                                          repe    cmpsb           ;
 35594                                          pop     si              ;
 35595                                          pop     cx              ;
 35596                                          jne	short copy_varnext ; no match, skip to next varname
 35597                                          cmp     byte [es:di],'='
 35598                                          jne     short copy_varnext ; no match, there's more characters
 35599                                  
 35600                                  ;   Previous occurrence of variable has been found; determine the
 35601                                  ;   entire length and then destroy it
 35602                                  
 35603                                          mov     cx,-1           ;
 35604                                          repne   scasb           ; guaranteed to get null (since we put it there)
 35605                                          push    si              ;
 35606                                          mov     si,di           ;
 35607                                          mov     di,bx           ;
 35608                                          mov     cx,[cs:config_envlen]
 35609                                          sub     cx,si           ; destroy variable now
 35610                                  	;rep movs byte ptr es:[di],byte ptr es:[si]
 35611                                  	;;db 0F3h,26h,0A4h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4724h
 35612                                  
 35613                                  	rep	; 0F3h
 35614                                  	es	; 26h
 35615                                  	movsb	; 0A4h
 35616                                  
 35617                                  	pop     si
 35618                                  copy_envprep:
 35619                                          cmp     ah,cr          ; if there is nothing after the '='
 35620                                          je	short copy_envdel ; then just exit with variable deleted
 35621                                          cmp     ah,lf           ;
 35622                                          je	short copy_envdel
 35623                                          jmp     short copy_envloop
 35624                                  
 35625                                  copy_varnext:                   ;
 35626                                          push    cx              ;
 35627                                          mov     cx,-1           ;
 35628                                          repne   scasb           ;
 35629                                          pop     cx              ;
 35630                                          jmp	short copy_varsrch
 35631                                  
 35632                                  copy_envloop:                   ;
 35633                                          lodsb                   ;
 35634                                          cmp     al,cr           ;
 35635                                          je	short copy_envdone
 35636                                          cmp     al,lf           ;
 35637                                          je	short copy_envdone
 35638                                          stosb                   ;
 35639                                          jmp     short copy_envloop
 35640                                  
 35641                                  copy_envdone:                   ;
 35642                                          sub     al,al           ; do SUB to clear carry as well
 35643                                          stosb                   ; always null-terminate these puppies
 35644                                  copy_envdel:                    ;
 35645                                          mov     [es:di],al      ; and stick another null to terminate the env.
 35646                                          mov     [cs:config_envlen],di
 35647                                  
 35648                                  copy_envexit:                   ;
 35649                                          pop     es              ;
 35650                                          pop     ds              ;
 35651                                          pop     si              ;
 35652                                          pop     cx              ;
 35653                                  
 35654                                  copy_done:	; 18/12/2022
 35655                                          retn
 35656                                  
 35657                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35658                                  ;
 35659                                  ;   copy_block:  copy the current block to the new config.sys workspace
 35660                                  ;
 35661                                  ;   INPUT
 35662                                  ;       CX == remaining bytes in "organized" config.sys memory image
 35663                                  ;    ES:SI -> remaining bytes in "organized" config.sys memory image
 35664                                  ;    DS:DI -> new config.sys workspace (equal in size to the original
 35665                                  ;             config.sys image) where the current block is to be copied
 35666                                  ;
 35667                                  ;   OUTPUT
 35668                                  ;       Same as above
 35669                                  ;       AL also equals the last character read from the organized image
 35670                                  ;
 35671                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 35672                                  ;       All
 35673                                  ;
 35674                                  ;   NOTES
 35675                                  ;       None
 35676                                  ;
 35677                                  ;   HISTORY
 35678                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 35679                                  ;
 35680                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35681                                  
 35682                                  copy_block:
 35683                                          call    get_char        ; check for include
 35684                                          jc	short copy_done	;
 35685                                  	and     al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; 7Fh
 35686                                  	cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; another BEGIN implies END as well
 35687                                          je	short copy_done ;
 35688                                  
 35689                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_INCLUDE ; 'J'
 35690                                          mov     al,ah           ; AL == the original line code
 35691                                          jne	short copy_line	; not an "include" line
 35692                                  
 35693                                  ;   We have hit an "INCLUDE" line; first, REM out the line so that we
 35694                                  ;   never try to include the block again (no infinite include loops please),
 35695                                  ;   then search for the named block and call copy_block again.
 35696                                  
 35697                                          mov     byte [es:si-1],CONFIG_REM ; '0'
 35698                                          push    di              ;
 35699                                  
 35700                                          mov     di,szMenu
 35701                                          call    comp_names_safe ; don't allow INCLUDE MENU
 35702                                          je	short copy_skip	;
 35703                                  
 35704                                          mov     di,szCommon
 35705                                          call    comp_names_safe ; don't allow INCLUDE COMMON
 35706                                          je	short copy_skip	;
 35707                                  
 35708                                          mov     di,si           ; try to find the block
 35709                                          call    srch_block      ;
 35710                                          mov     dx,di           ;
 35711                                          pop     di              ;
 35712                                          jne	short copy_error ; no such block
 35713                                          push    cx              ;
 35714                                          mov     cx,bx           ;
 35715                                          push    si              ;
 35716                                          dec     dx              ;
 35717                                          mov     si,dx           ;
 35718                                          call    skip_line       ; skip the rest of the "block name" line
 35719                                          call    copy_block      ; and copy in the rest of that block
 35720                                          pop     si              ;
 35721                                          pop     cx              ;
 35722                                          sub     al,al           ; force skip_opt_line to skip...
 35723                                          jmp     short copy_nextline
 35724                                  
 35725                                  copy_skip:
 35726                                          pop     di
 35727                                  copy_error:
 35728                                          clc                     ;
 35729                                          call    print_error     ; note that carry is clear, no pause
 35730                                          jmp     short copy_nextline
 35731                                  
 35732                                  ;   Copy the line at ES:SI to the current location at DS:DI
 35733                                  
 35734                                  copy_line:
 35735                                          mov     [di],al         ;
 35736                                          inc     di              ;
 35737                                          cmp     al,' '          ; is this is a "real" line with a "real" code?
 35738                                          jb	short copy_nextline ; no
 35739                                          cmp     byte [cs:config_multi],0
 35740                                          je	short copy_loop	; not a multi-config config.sys, don't embed #s
 35741                                          call    get_linenum	; BX == line # of line @ES:SI
 35742                                          mov     [di],bx         ; stash it immediately following the line code
 35743                                          inc     di              ;
 35744                                          inc     di              ;
 35745                                          jmp     short copy_next ;
 35746                                  copy_loop:                      ;
 35747                                          call    get_char        ;
 35748                                          jc	short copy_done ; end of file
 35749                                          mov     [di],al         ;
 35750                                          inc     di              ;
 35751                                  copy_next:
 35752                                          cmp     al,lf ; 0Ah	; done with line?
 35753                                          jne	short copy_loop	; nope
 35754                                  
 35755                                  copy_nextline:
 35756                                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 35757                                          jmp     short copy_block
 35758                                  
 35759                                  	; 18/12/2022
 35760                                  ;copy_done:
 35761                                          ;retn
 35762                                  
 35763                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35764                                  ;
 35765                                  ;   get_linenum:  return line # (in BX) of current line (@ES:SI)
 35766                                  ;
 35767                                  ;   INPUT
 35768                                  ;    ES:SI -> some line in the config.sys memory image
 35769                                  ;
 35770                                  ;   OUTPUT
 35771                                  ;       BX == line # (relative to 1)
 35772                                  ;
 35773                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 35774                                  ;       DX
 35775                                  ;
 35776                                  ;   NOTES
 35777                                  ;       None
 35778                                  ;
 35779                                  ;   HISTORY
 35780                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 35781                                  ;
 35782                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35783                                  
 35784                                  get_linenum:
 35785                                          push    ax              ;
 35786                                          sub     bx,bx           ; BX == line # (to be returned)
 35787                                          push    cx              ;
 35788                                          mov     dx,si           ; DX == the offset we're looking for
 35789                                          push    si              ;
 35790                                          mov     cx,[cs:count]   ;
 35791                                          sub     si,si           ; prepare to scan entire file
 35792                                  get_linenum_loop:               ;
 35793                                          call    skip_line       ;
 35794                                          jc	short get_linenum_done
 35795                                          inc     bx              ;
 35796                                          cmp     si,dx           ; have we exceeded the desired offset yet?
 35797                                          jb	short get_linenum_loop ; no
 35798                                  get_linenum_done:               ;
 35799                                          pop     si              ;
 35800                                          pop     cx              ;
 35801                                          pop     ax              ;
 35802                                          retn
 35803                                  
 35804                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35805                                  ;
 35806                                  ;   srch_block:  searches entire config.sys for block name @ES:DI
 35807                                  ;
 35808                                  ;   INPUT
 35809                                  ;       ES -> config.sys image
 35810                                  ;    ES:DI -> block name to find
 35811                                  ;
 35812                                  ;   OUTPUT
 35813                                  ;       ZF flag set, if found
 35814                                  ;    ES:DI -> just past the name in the block heading, if found
 35815                                  ;       BX == # bytes remaining from that point, if found
 35816                                  ;
 35817                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 35818                                  ;       None
 35819                                  ;
 35820                                  ;   NOTES
 35821                                  ;       This differs from "find_block" in that it searches the ENTIRE
 35822                                  ;       config.sys image, not merely the remaining portion, and that it
 35823                                  ;       takes a pointer to block name that is *elsewhere* in the image
 35824                                  ;       (ie, ES) as opposed to some string constant in our own segment (DS).
 35825                                  ;
 35826                                  ;   HISTORY
 35827                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 35828                                  ;
 35829                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35830                                  
 35831                                  srch_block:	          ; returns BX -> named block in CONFIG.SYS
 35832                                          push    ax              ;
 35833                                          push    cx              ;
 35834                                          mov     cx,[cs:count]   ;
 35835                                          push    si              ;
 35836                                          sub     si,si           ;
 35837                                          push    ds              ;
 35838                                          push    es              ;
 35839                                          pop     ds              ;
 35840                                          call    find_block      ;
 35841                                          mov     di,si           ;
 35842                                          mov     bx,cx           ;
 35843                                          pop     ds              ;
 35844                                          pop     si              ;
 35845                                          pop     cx              ;
 35846                                          pop     ax              ;
 35847                                  find_exit: ; 16/04/2019
 35848                                          retn			;
 35849                                  
 35850                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35851                                  ;
 35852                                  ;   find_block:  searches rest of config.sys for block name @DS:DI
 35853                                  ;
 35854                                  ;   INPUT
 35855                                  ;    DS:DI -> block name to find
 35856                                  ;    ES:SI -> remainder of config.sys image
 35857                                  ;       CX == remaining size of config.sys image
 35858                                  ;
 35859                                  ;   OUTPUT
 35860                                  ;       ZF flag set, if found (also, CF set if EOF)
 35861                                  ;    ES:SI -> where the search stopped (at end of block name or EOF)
 35862                                  ;       CX == # bytes remaining from that point
 35863                                  ;
 35864                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 35865                                  ;       AX
 35866                                  ;
 35867                                  ;   NOTES
 35868                                  ;       This differs from "srch_block" in that it searches only the
 35869                                  ;       remaining portion of the config.sys image and leaves SI and CX
 35870                                  ;       pointing to where the search left off, and that it takes a pointer
 35871                                  ;       to search string in our own segment (DS:DI instead of ES:DI).
 35872                                  ;
 35873                                  ;   HISTORY
 35874                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 35875                                  ;
 35876                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35877                                  
 35878                                  find_block:
 35879                                          call    get_char        ; get line code
 35880                                          jc	short find_exit	; end of file
 35881                                          and     al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 35882                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; beginning of a block?
 35883                                          je	short check_line ; no
 35884                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_INCLUDE
 35885                                          jne	short next_line	;
 35886                                          or	byte [cs:config_multi],1
 35887                                          jmp     short next_line ;
 35888                                  check_line:
 35889                                          or      byte [cs:config_multi],1
 35890                                          call    comp_names      ; compare block names
 35891                                          jbe	short find_exit	; end of file, or names matched
 35892                                  next_line:
 35893                                          call    skip_opt_line   ; no, so skip to next line
 35894                                          jmp	short find_block  ;
 35895                                  ;find_exit:
 35896                                  ;	retn
 35897                                  
 35898                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35899                                  ;
 35900                                  ;   comp_names:  compares keyword @DS:DI to position in config.sys @ES:SI
 35901                                  ;
 35902                                  ;   INPUT
 35903                                  ;    DS:DI -> keyword to compare
 35904                                  ;    ES:SI -> position in config.sys
 35905                                  ;       CX == remaining bytes in config.sys
 35906                                  ;
 35907                                  ;   OUTPUT
 35908                                  ;       ZF flag set, if match (also, CF set if EOF)
 35909                                  ;    ES:SI -> where the comparison stopped (at end of block name or EOF)
 35910                                  ;       CX == # bytes remaining from that point
 35911                                  ;
 35912                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 35913                                  ;       AX
 35914                                  ;
 35915                                  ;   NOTES
 35916                                  ;       None
 35917                                  ;
 35918                                  ;   HISTORY
 35919                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 35920                                  ;
 35921                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35922                                  
 35923                                  comp_names:
 35924                                          push    di              ;
 35925                                  comp_loop:                      ;
 35926                                          call    get_char        ;
 35927                                          jc	short comp_exit	;
 35928                                          call    any_delim       ; is next character a delimiter?
 35929                                          mov     ah,[di]         ; (get next character we're supposed to match)
 35930                                          je	short comp_almost ; yes, it *could* be a match
 35931                                          inc     di              ;
 35932                                          and     ax,~2020h ; 0DFDFh 
 35933                                  				; BUGBUG -- assumes both names are alphanumeric -JTP
 35934                                          cmp     al,ah           ; match?
 35935                                          je	short comp_loop ; yes, keep looking at the characters
 35936                                          clc                     ; prevent erroneous eof indication: clear carry
 35937                                  comp_exit:                      ;
 35938                                          pop     di              ;
 35939                                          retn			;
 35940                                  comp_almost:                    ;
 35941                                          xchg    al,ah           ; we don't know for sure if it's a match
 35942                                          call    any_delim       ; until we verify that the second string has
 35943                                          xchg    al,ah           ; been exhausted also...
 35944                                          jmp     comp_exit       ; if we are, this call to any_delim will tell...
 35945                                  
 35946                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35947                                  
 35948                                  comp_names_safe:
 35949                                          push    ax
 35950                                          push    cx
 35951                                          push	si
 35952                                          push    ds
 35953                                          push    cs
 35954                                          pop     ds
 35955                                          call    comp_names
 35956                                          pop     ds
 35957                                  	pop	si
 35958                                          pop     cx
 35959                                          pop     ax
 35960                                          retn
 35961                                  
 35962                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35963                                  ;
 35964                                  ;   print_item:  display menu item #BL
 35965                                  ;
 35966                                  ;   INPUT
 35967                                  ;       BL == menu item # to display
 35968                                  ;
 35969                                  ;   OUTPUT
 35970                                  ;       Menu item displayed, with appropriate highlighting if BL == bDefBlock
 35971                                  ;
 35972                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 35973                                  ;       None
 35974                                  ;
 35975                                  ;   NOTES
 35976                                  ;       This function saves/restores the current cursor position, so you
 35977                                  ;       needn't worry about it.
 35978                                  ;
 35979                                  ;   HISTORY
 35980                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 35981                                  ;
 35982                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35983                                  
 35984                                  print_item:		; prints menu item #BL (1 to N)
 35985                                          push    ax              ;
 35986                                          push    bx              ;
 35987                                          push    cx              ;
 35988                                          push    dx              ;
 35989                                          push    si              ;
 35990                                          mov     ah,03h          ; get cursor position
 35991                                          mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ; always page zero
 35992                                          int     10h             ; DH/DL = row/column
 35993                                          push    dx              ; save it
 35994                                          mov     ah,02h          ; set cursor position
 35995                                          mov     dh,bl           ;
 35996                                          add     dh,3            ;
 35997                                          mov     dl,5            ;
 35998                                          int     10h             ; set cursor position for correct row/col
 35999                                          mov     al,bl           ;
 36000                                          add     al,'0'          ; convert menu item # to ASCII digit
 36001                                          mov     ah,[bMenuColor] ; normal attribute
 36002                                          cmp     bl,[bDefBlock]  ; are we printing the current block?
 36003                                          jne	short print_other ; no
 36004                                          or      ah,70h          ; yes, set bgnd color to white
 36005                                          mov     ch,ah           ;
 36006                                          mov     cl,4            ;
 36007                                          rol     ch,cl           ;
 36008                                          cmp     ch,ah           ; are fgnd/bgnd the same?
 36009                                          jne	short print_other ; no
 36010                                          xor     ah,08h          ; yes, so modify the fgnd intensity
 36011                                  print_other:                    ;
 36012                                          mov     bh,0            ;
 36013                                          add     bx,bx           ;
 36014                                          mov     di,[aoffBlockDesc+bx]
 36015                                          mov     bl,ah           ; put the attribute in the correct register now
 36016                                          mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ; get correct video page #
 36017                                          mov     ah,09h          ; write char/attr
 36018                                          mov     cx,1            ;
 36019                                          int     10h             ;
 36020                                          inc     dl              ; increment column
 36021                                          mov     ah,02h          ;
 36022                                          int     10h             ;
 36023                                          ;mov	ax,0900h+'.'    ;
 36024                                          mov	ax,092Eh
 36025                                  	int     10h             ; display '.'
 36026                                          inc     dl              ; increment column
 36027                                          mov     ah,02h          ;
 36028                                          int     10h             ;
 36029                                          ;mov	ax,0900h+' '    ;
 36030                                          mov	ax,0920h
 36031                                  	int     10h             ; display ' '
 36032                                          inc     dl              ; increment column
 36033                                          mov     ah,02h          ;
 36034                                          int     10h             ;
 36035                                          push    es              ;
 36036                                  print_loop:                     ;
 36037                                          mov     al,[es:di]	; get a character of the description
 36038                                          inc     di              ;
 36039                                          cmp     al,TAB ; 9	; substitute spaces for tabs
 36040                                          jne	short print_nontab ;
 36041                                          mov     al,' '          ;
 36042                                  print_nontab:                   ;
 36043                                          cmp     al,' '          ;
 36044                                          jb	short print_done ; stop at the 1st character < space
 36045                                          cmp     al,'$'          ;
 36046                                          je	short print_done ; also stop on $
 36047                                          mov     ah,09h          ; display function #
 36048                                          int     10h             ;
 36049                                          inc     dl              ; increment column
 36050                                          cmp     dl,78           ; far enough?
 36051                                          jae	short print_done ; yes
 36052                                          mov     ah,02h          ;
 36053                                          int     10h             ;
 36054                                          jmp     print_loop      ;
 36055                                  print_done:                     ;
 36056                                          pop     es              ;
 36057                                          pop     dx              ;
 36058                                          mov     ah,02h          ;
 36059                                          int     10h             ; restore previous row/col
 36060                                          pop     si              ;
 36061                                          pop     dx              ;
 36062                                          pop     cx              ;
 36063                                          pop     bx              ;
 36064                                          pop     ax              ;
 36065                                          retn			;
 36066                                  
 36067                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36068                                  ;
 36069                                  ;   select_item:  wait for user to select menu item, with time-out
 36070                                  ;
 36071                                  ;   INPUT
 36072                                  ;       None
 36073                                  ;
 36074                                  ;   OUTPUT
 36075                                  ;       BX == menu item # (1-N), or -1 for clean boot
 36076                                  ;       Selected menu item highlighted
 36077                                  ;       Cursor positioned beneath menu, ready for tty-style output now
 36078                                  ;
 36079                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 36080                                  ;       None
 36081                                  ;
 36082                                  ;   NOTES
 36083                                  ;       None
 36084                                  ;
 36085                                  ;   HISTORY
 36086                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 36087                                  ;
 36088                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36089                                  
 36090                                  select_item:		; returns digit value in BX (trashes AX/CX/DX)
 36091                                          mov     bl,[bDefBlock]  ; BL will be the default block #
 36092                                          mov     al,bl           ;
 36093                                          call    disp_num        ;
 36094                                          call    show_status     ; display current interactive status
 36095                                          cmp     byte [secTimeOut],-1
 36096                                          je	short input_key	; no time-out, just go to input
 36097                                          mov     ah,GET_TIME ; 2Ch
 36098                                          int     21h             ;
 36099                                          mov     bh,dh           ; BH = initial # of seconds
 36100                                  check_time:
 36101                                          mov     al,[secTimeOut] ;
 36102                                          sub     al,[secElapsed] ;
 36103                                          jae	short show_time	;
 36104                                          or      byte [bQueryOpt],2  ; disable all further prompting
 36105                                          mov     byte [secElapsed],0
 36106                                          jmp	select_done	; time's up!
 36107                                  show_time:
 36108                                          push    bx              ;
 36109                                          mov     bl,al           ; save # in BL
 36110                                          mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ;
 36111                                          mov     ah,03h          ; get cursor position
 36112                                          int     10h             ;
 36113                                          push    dx              ;
 36114                                  	add	dl,8		; move cursor to the right
 36115                                          mov     ah,02h          ; set cursor position
 36116                                          int     10h             ;
 36117                                          mov     dx,_$TimeOut
 36118                                          call    print           ; print the "Time remaining: " prompt
 36119                                          mov     al,bl           ; recover # from BL
 36120                                          cbw                     ; this works because AL is always <= 90
 36121                                          mov     cl,10           ;
 36122                                          div     cl              ; AL = tens digit, AH = ones digit
 36123                                          mov     cl,ah           ;
 36124                                          add     al,'0'          ;
 36125                                          mov     ah,0Eh          ;
 36126                                          int     10h             ; write TTY tens digit
 36127                                          mov     al,cl           ;
 36128                                          add     al,'0'          ;
 36129                                          mov     ah,0Eh          ;
 36130                                          int     10h             ; write TTY ones digit
 36131                                          pop     dx
 36132                                          mov     ah,02h          ; set cursor position back to where it was
 36133                                          int     10h             ;
 36134                                          pop     bx              ;
 36135                                  input_key:
 36136                                          mov     ah,RAW_CON_IO ; 6
 36137                                          mov     dl,0FFh         ; input request
 36138                                          int     21h             ;
 36139                                          jnz	short got_key	;
 36140                                          cmp     byte [secTimeOut],-1; is there a time-out?
 36141                                          je	short input_key	; no, just go back to input
 36142                                          mov     ah,GET_TIME     ;
 36143                                          int     21h             ; DH = seconds
 36144                                          mov     ah,dh           ;
 36145                                          sub     dh,bh           ; should generally be zero or one
 36146                                          mov     bh,ah           ;
 36147                                          jnc	short got_time	;
 36148                                          mov     dh,1            ; it wrapped back to zero, so assume one
 36149                                  got_time:
 36150                                          or      dh,dh           ; any change?
 36151                                          jz	short input_key	; no
 36152                                          add     [secElapsed],dh ;
 36153                                          jmp	short check_time ;
 36154                                  got_key:
 36155                                          push    ax              ;
 36156                                          mov     ax,-1           ; zap both secTimeOut and secElapsed
 36157                                          xchg    [secTimeOut],ax
 36158                                          cmp     al,-1           ; was time-out already disabled?
 36159                                          je	short timeout_disabled ; yes
 36160                                          push    bx              ; let's disable # seconds display
 36161                                          mov     ax,0A20h        ; write multiple spaces
 36162                                          mov     bx,[bMenuColor]
 36163                                          mov     cx,80           ; 80 of them, to be safe
 36164                                          int     10h             ; to completely obliterate # seconds display
 36165                                          pop     bx   		;
 36166                                  
 36167                                  timeout_disabled:
 36168                                          pop     ax              ;
 36169                                          or      al,al           ; extended key pressed?
 36170                                          jnz	short normal_key ; no
 36171                                          int     21h             ; get the next part of the key then
